INTRODUCTION

 Welcome to Inferna—the richly textured, mysterious, and strangely knowable world that poet Stefene Russell inhabits so completely. In this poem-cycle’s nine sections—each with its own “tiny outfit,” idiosyncratic boyfriend, and keyhole to peer out of—Russell’s language soars and dives, and the rising and falling of so much sheer music is exhilarating. Her seemingly effortless lines are measured human breaths. They’re smart and they’re felt. Her images are well-honed blades or luxurious blankets; they startle or they comfort—depending.

 You’ll watch “the shadows / leap and fall on the walls of / the carnival tent.” You’ll hear the mockingbird (hers is an “emergency mockingbird, mind you) “singing to you, the same tune / over and over: that one / about someone stealing your car.” You’ll be a witness “as Peetie Wheatstraw’s / ghost strums / Santa Claus Blues / from a cold / blue star.”

 Inferna is absolute magic-making at its most lucid. There’s nothing abstract or unduly dreamy about this dream of a life. Russell gives us some remarkable hope: that it is indeed possible to articulate what too often threatens to remain ineffable. And she’s not shy about what she wants out of the deal: “Alleys are my city’s secret pockets. / I want the whole sky and all the wine in your house, / and all the wine in your neighbor’s house.”

 And why not? Inferna is itself so intoxicating. This is vintage Stefene Russell—and I promise there will be no easy sleeping it off. Hers is one of the most distinctive voices in this or any town. Inferna is a bad dream gone awfully good. Inferna is a flat-out wonder.

 I’m here stealing one of Russell’s lines from her opening poem on the carnival midway: “Dazzle, Dazzle, Huzzah.” That’s what this book does, and does—and what I’ve been trying to say here all along.

 —David Clewell, St. Louis, 2013         
Missouri's Second Poet Laureate (2010-2012).

 

THE PROJECT

Inferna is a poem-cycle by Stefene Russell, a contemporary underworld journey in miniature, told through nine cycles of three poems each and is the first installment of a planned trilogy that will mirror Dante’s Divine Comedy. The chapters are roughly equivalent to the circles of the underworld as described in Virgil, Dante, and the myth of the Babylonian goddess Inanna. Unlike Inanna, who loses a piece of jewelry or a piece of clothing at each gate, the speaker instead puts on magic and toxic dresses, falls into the arms of cads and criminals, and is propelled forward with keyhole glimpses of nature and the sublime. Inferna is not the underworld as Dante wrote it—a hell where sinners are tormented for eternity—but a subterranean ecosystem that is claustrophobic, hellishly self-referential, yet ultimately redemptive.

 The second book, Ghostboxing, is inspired by Dante’s Purgatorio, Dadaist chance operations, and James Merrill’s supernatural epic, The Changing Light at Sandover. The first section will be based on fragments of EVP (electronic voice phenomenon) generated by a smartphone app near specific gravesites in Bellefontaine Cemetery. Part two is based on outtakes from the “Ouija Papers” of Alice Turner, who allegedly channeled the ghost of her husband, Harry Turner, St. Louis’ first real bohemian and founder of the literary magazine Much Ado, who drowned in the Mississippi River on Christmas Day, 1931. In part three, the Possum Codex, the speaker follows the nocturnal animal of the title back into the world of the living.

 The final book in the trilogy, Paysan,Voyageur, is a fractal history/nature long poem set along the banks of the Mississippi, overlaying the natural history of the river with its cultural history, including the “prehistoric Manhattan” of Cahokia; the colonial French “paysans” who farmed on common fields at the edge of the river, as well as the “voyageurs,” who floated flatboats over its surface; and Chestnut Valley, the cradle of ragtime, which was demolished during St. Louis’ urban renewal program during the early ’60s. Though inspired by Dante, it locates the Paradiso not in heaven, but on a mystical and animistic earth.

 We are asking you to help launch this trilogy by supporting this project with a purchase of one of the perks available on this campaign.

 

“Stefene Russell has stirred the cauldron of Inferna with all the faces and facets of the unanswerable that has pursued humanity since our enshrouded beginnings, and then some.”

 —Walter Bargen, Missouri's First Poet Laureate  (2008-2010).

 

  WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL SUPPORT

Inferna is the second release by Intagliata Imprints (following Chris King’s 2012 chapbook, Shape of a Man). The 40-page chapbook will feature a letterpress cover by Firecracker Press, and will be released at Mad Art Gallery in St. Louis, Missouri on February 15 from 7 to 10 p.m. www.madart.com. The event will feature readings by Stefene Russell, Chris King, and Nicole Rainey.

 Your donations will go toward the printing of a letterpress chapbook by Firecracker Press. Costs include cover design, printing of the cover and body, paper, film, printing plates, and labor for printing, scoring, folding and trimming. Total cost for 100 copies (the minimum run) will be $1500. If the number of pre-orders exceeds that amount, more will be printed and any remaining funds will go to towards the cost of the other two books in the trilogy.

 Please help if you can, even if "help" simply means reposting this on all of your various social media networks and telling all of your friends about it.

 “Inferna is a fire of transformation, the painful passage between possible states of existence, in the infinity of potential selves both imagined by the speaker and imposed by social juries and intimate adversaries. A pharmacopeia of emotional potions and poisons, a periodic table of basic elements and missing essentials for a satisfied life, it leaps gulfs of concrete knowledge and ephemeral lore in alchemy of understanding. A blinding blaze of being and a beacon of far truth, these pages burn past themselves in flashes of inspiration and scorched paths of sad wisdom. Lighting a way in the lush, primeval menace of misheard fairytales and the forbidding, glorious perils of unrhapsodized nature, Inferna is crucible and chronicle of what we must walk through to what we might be."

 —Adam McGovern, www.HiLoBrow.com

 

 

“Stefene Russell says she belongs to the kaleidoscope school of poetry, but I think it belongs to her—nowhere in contemporary verse have I seen the newness of language, the tenacity of speaker and the vivaciousness of the imagery mixed so gellingly. Russell’s Inferna is a poem-cycle worth getting lost inside.”

 —Travis Mossotti, 2011 May Swenson Poetry Award Winner

 

 THE TEAM

Poetry Scores is an international non-profit that translates poetry into other media, scoring long poems as you would a movie, and then makes silent movies to the scores. It has also invited artists from around the world to translate poems into visual art. Scored poets have included Leo Conellan, K. Curtis Lyle, David Clewell, Wole Soyinka, Andreas Embirikos, and Ece Ayan, whose Blind Cat Black has been translated into music, art, and film, and screened in the United States and Ayan’s native Turkey. On January 11, composer Barbara Harbach debuted her score of Embirikos’ “Phantom of the Dream’s Origin” at the Touhill Center for the Arts on the campus of Missouri University in St. Louis, Missouri. www.poetryscores.blogspot.com/

 

Stefene Russell is St. Louis Magazine’s Culture Editor, and is a member of Poetry Scores, an arts collective that translates poetry into other media. In 2007, Poetry Scores translated her poem Go South For Animal Index into music. The poem, with essays by Russell and Poetry Scores artistic director Chris King, was released as a letterpress book with a CD of the score, printed by Firecracker Press. Russell is also a former co-editor of 52nd City and Prinsesstårta literary magazines, and was featured as part of River Styx’s Hungry Young Poets Series, the Observable Poetry Series (including 2005’s “Three Stephanies,” reading), the Archive Reading Series, and the Pulitzer’s Sound Waves series. Her work has appeared in The Lumberyard, Bad Shoe, and Otis Nebula. Her poem “Thylacine,” part of a cycle of endangered species poems, was put to music by Tim Rakel of the Union Electric www.theunionelectric.bandcamp.com and released as a 7-inch single on colored vinyl, co-produced by Poetry Scores, with cover art by Sleepy Kitty www.sleepykittyarts.com. Go South was translated into Turkish in 2012 by artists in Istanbul, Poetry Scores’ first sister city. Her next reading is January 28 at Tony Renner’s Chance Operations series at Duff’s www.chanceoperationsstl.blogspot.com with Eric Schramm www.areyououtsidethelines.wordpress.com/categor... and Raphael Maurice www.ucityreview.com/3_Maurice_Raphael.html On February 9, she joins the HEARding Cats Collective www.herdingcatscollective.org a strange and wonderful conglomeration of artists who promote adventurous work in St. Louis, Missouri. This music/poetry event, Missing Part, will also feature some of St. Louis’ most active masters of the spoken word, including K. Curtis Lyle, Anna Lum, Brett Underwood and Treasure Shields Redmond. Missing Part takes place at Fort Gondo Compound for the Arts www.fortgondo.com

 

Chris King is creative director of Poetry Scores, an international organization dedicated to translating poetry into other media based in St. Louis. He is the author of the poetry chapbooks Shape of a Man and A heart I carved for a girl I knew. His credits as a book editor include Michelangelo: A Life on Paper by Leonard Barkan (Princeton University Press) and The Mourner’s Song by James Tatum (University of Chicago Press).

 

Scott Intagliata is also a member of Poetry Scores, and has assisted the organization with fundraising and development as well as manuscript acquisition. Intagliata has worked as a college professor, journalist, and enjoyed a long career running political campaigns. Since 1998, he has been one of the owners of a manufacturing firm that sells throughout North America and over 20 countries internationally.

 

Jacque Brown is the manager of the St. Louis Curio Shoppe and a mixed media artist/sculptor. She has a background in talent/music promotion and management and conflict resolution through the Arts. She was a radio presenter for Vibraphonic.fm in the UK promoting Native American contemporary music internationally and has lectured on using the Arts for conflict resolution in the UK and Morocco. She presently works with St. Louis nonprofits, small businesses, artists and youth entrepreneurship on development, promotion and administrative support through the St. Louis Curio Shoppe.

 

Kevin Belford is an artist in St Louis, Missouri. He has freelanced for the better part of his career after graduating from the Kansas City Art Institute, Kansas City, Missouri. His work has crossed the entire spectrum of graphic arts and conceptual development from medical illustration to corporate theater to children’s television. He is also the author and illustrator of Devil at the Confluence: The Pre-War Blues Music of St. Louis, Missouri, a book and cultural preservation project he has researched for more than a decade. For more information, go to www.devilattheconfluence.blogspot.com

 

Amy VanDonsel is a mixed media artist, and is a member of Poetry Scores, an arts collective that translates poetry into other media. Her visual responses to poems, including to Phantom of the Dream’s Origin, by Andreas Embirikos, “Ever-Ready Bank Accounts,” by Wole Soyinka, and Jack Ruby’s America, by David Clewell have been show during the Poetry Scores annual art invitationals. In 2011, she created a series of 10 mixed media paintings based on the poems in Chris King’s chapbook Shape of a Man, and the pair collaborated to curate the works of 30 artists shown in conjunction with the chapbook’s publication. Her work has also been featured in other group and solo exhibitions, most recently at the SOHA Gallery in St. Louis, Missouri.

 

Nick Barbieri is a drummer, singer, songwriter, recording engineer and producer based in St. Louis, Missouri. A graduate of St. Louis University, Nick has recently played in the reunited pop rock band The Heebie Jeebies.  Most recently, Nick has been working with Chris King, Dave Melson and Mark Buckheit on original music for Poetry Scores, under the name of Three Fried Men.  Recent works include; Three Fried Men for Site/Sound at Laumeier Sculpture Park, St. Louis, Missouri, September 2012 www.erichall.bandcamp.com/track/man-with-briefcase-at-2968443 and the Poetry Scores Art Invitational event at Mad Art Gallery in St. Louis, Missouri on November 9, 2012 www.soundcloud.com/poetry-scores/desire-nick-ba...

 

St. Louis Curio Shoppe promotes “Shopping Truly Local.” They sell and consign locally made goods from businesses, nonprofits, young entrepreneurs, authors, musicians, filmmakers, artisans and artists who are within a 50 mile radius of St. Louis, Missouri. They strive to celebrate all that is St. Louis by actively supporting their community and local arts, promoting local businesses and sharing their city's unique history through displays and events. www.stlcurioshoppe.com www.facebook.com/stlcurioshoppe

 

Firecracker Press, a graphic design studio and letterpress print shop located in St. Louis, Missouri, opened in February of 2002, combining antique printing technology with new thinking to design and produce objects that people enjoy seeing and feeling. They use computer design software to conceive ideas but still carve woodblocks and print by hand to produce event posters, business cards, party invitations, advertising and more. www.firecrackerpress.com

 

VIDEO CREDITS

Video: Kevin Belford

Audio: Nick Barbieri

Music: “Piece for Disaffected Piano, No. 1,” and Piece for Disaffected Piano, No. 2,” by Kevin McLeod, courtesy of freepd.com

Footage: 1939-40 World’s Fair home movies from the Prelinger Collection; “Patterns for Smartness,” by Hartley Productions and Simplicity Pattern Co., courtesy of Archive.org

story:
Hello,

My name is Venus Mason Theus. I am a self published author and the founder of the Anointed Pen Christian Writers annual conferences.

The literary world is being bombarded with sub-par reading materials. There are currently millions of titles in circulation; however only a small percentage of that circulation offers literature that enriches lives and glorifies God. Erotica and false doctrine disguised as self help and inspirational reading have flooded the shelves of bookstores and online shopping carts; yet truly edifying reading materials remain in comparative obscurity.

 
With that in mind, a few years ago I coordinated and fully sponsored the inaugural seminar for Christian writers. The theme that first year was Let Your Gift Shine in 2009. Then and each subsequent year  I have primarily funded the conferences with my personal resources which I call my “cookie jar stash.”

This year I will host the 5th annual event.  I am very proud to say that the event has grown in the quality of the presenters, workshops; and in the number of attendees. There is lots of untapped talent just waiting to be unearthed but let's face it, financial resources are limited for a lot of people so help is needed.

The conference will be held at Greater Grace Temple in Detroit, Michigan on Friday, September 27 and Saturday, September 28th. For more information about the Anointed Pen Conference services, please click on my photo or here to be redirected to my official website. Go to the official registration page if you'd like to attend the conference. Thank you in advance!

Penspirationally yours,

Venus

You Can Help Aspiring Writers

There are a number of ways you can help from corporate sponsorship to personal donations (please see the column on the right side of your screen)

Platinum Level Sponsor - $1000

The platinum conference sponsorship package combines marketing and branding association before the event and maximum exposure during the conference. Only one sponsorship at this level is available. Benefits:
 
As a platinum sponsor, the conference will bear the name of the conference along with the Anointed Pen, for example, Your Company Name/Anointed Pen Conference for Christian Writers.

Addressing the Conference

The platinum sponsor is the only sponsor given the opportunity to address the conference. As the platinum sponsor you will have the opportunity to address the conference for 5 to 10 minutes during the closing conference session.

Name Badges

The platinum sponsor is the only sponsor whose company logo appears on the attendee name badges. Your company logo will be featured alongside the Conference Anointed Pen Conference logo on the attendee name badges.

Signage Rights

The platinum sponsor is entitled to provide appropriate signage in the main conference room, conference luncheon and the conference registration area. The platinum sponsor’ssignage will be more prominent than those of any co-sponsors.

Attendee Passes

Theplatinum sponsor will be offered 5 complimentary attendee passes.

Company Literature and Giveaway

As the platinum conference sponsor you have the opportunity to distribute your company's brochure and a gift/giveaway to be included in the attendee pack that is distributed to participants upon registration at the conference.

Acknowledgements

As the platinum sponsor you will be thanked during the opening and closing conference sessions.

Donation requested by September 13, 2013

 

Gold Level Sponsor - $500

The gold conference sponsorship package combines marketing and branding association before the event and extensive exposure during the conference. Only three sponsorships at this level are available. Benefits include:

Signage Rights

A gold sponsor is entitled to provide appropriate signage in the conference registration area. Only the platinum conference sponsor's signage will feature more prominently than those of the gold sponsors.

Attendee Passes

Each gold sponsor will be offered 4 complimentary attendee passes.

Pre-Conference Promotional Materials

As a gold conference sponsor your company's name and logo appear more prominently than those of any silver or individual conference option sponsors and will be featured (within productions schedule) the pre-conference promotional material.

Company Literature and Giveaway

As a gold conference sponsor you have the opportunity to distribute your company's brochure and a gift/giveaway to be included in the attendee pack that is distributed to participants upon registration at the conference.

Acknowledgements

As a gold sponsor you will be thanked during the opening and closing conference sessions.

Donation requested by September 13, 2013

Silver Sponsor Level - $300

The silver conference sponsorship package combines marketing and branding association before the event and exposure during the conference. Only five sponsorships at this level are available. Benefits include:

3 Attendee Passes

Each silver sponsor will be offered 2 complementary attendee passes.

Pre-Conference Promotional Material

Hello,
My name is Venus Mason Theus. I am a self published author and the founder of the Anointed Pen Christian Writers annual conferences.
The literary world is being bombarded with sub-par reading materials. There are currently millions of titles in circulation; however only a small percentage of that circulation offers literature that enriches lives and glorifies God. Erotica and false doctrine disguised as self help and inspirational reading have flooded the shelves of bookstores and online shopping carts; yet truly edifying reading materials remain in comparative obscurity. With that in mind, a few years ago I coordinated and fully sponsored the inaugural seminar for Christian writers. The theme that first year was Let Your Gift Shine in 2009. Then and each subsequent year  I have primarily funded the conferences with my personal resources which I call my “cookie jar stash.”
This year I will host the 5th annual event.  I am very proud to say that the event has grown in the quality of the presenters, workshops; and in the number of attendees. There is lots of untapped talent just waiting to be unearthed but let's face it, financial resources are limited for a lot of people so help is needed.
The conference will be held at Greater Grace Temple in Detroit, Michigan on Friday, September 27 and Saturday, September 28th. For more information about the Anointed Pen Conference services, please click on my photo or here to be redirected to my official website. Go to the official registration page if you'd like to attend the conference. Thank you in advance!
Penspirationally yours,
Venus

story:
Me & The Truth

Hi there and thanks for stopping by my first-ever Indiegogo campaign! That video is about me, not exactly about my project. My name is Mariam, and I'm an early-career* writer/artist who has obsessed over one thing for about a year now: completing my first book.


The Truth about Panties: and other revelations about Christianity, singles & sex) is the working title of my in-progress memoir about my experiences living in Southern and Midwestern red states (and about a year in a very blue state) at the intersections of Christianity, black culture, womanhood and feminism. Being a Christian adds a layer of complication to life and love for Black American women. In The Truth, I peel back sheets of personal, spiritual and sexual discoveries as I share my search for love, purpose, godliness and acceptance in the liberal and holy worlds I don't quite belong to.

The thing is ...

I'm stuck. I'm not in an MFA program, and though I attend a writers group regularly, I'm at that point where I need guidance from a professional writer who will "get it"--get the story, the intersections, the nuances of culture.

That's where VONA comes in.

 

Voices of Our National Arts Foundation is the only multi-genre writing workshop for writers of color. (Black poets have Cave Canem, but I write memoir.) The program is for one week in Berkeley, CA, and it's a rare and wonderful opportunity for writers of color to learn from other writers of color, rather than from white teachers who often have trouble understanding the experiences of people who are not white and helping them articulate those experiences in writing. My workshop leader will be Staceyann Chin, Def Poetry Jam on Broadway co-writer/producer, memoirist, activist, performer, etc. This is going to get me unstuck.

But good teaching in the arts is expensive.

VONA costs $1450 for tuition and room and board. Airfare is NOT included.

And I've had some setbacks over the past few years...

  • Layoff in 2008
  • Started a writing consultant business that never quite took off
  • 4+ years without an employer or steady income
  • Still paying off undergrad loans
  • A back injury at the end of 2012 that cost about $900 in physical therapy. Didn’t put a dent in my high-deductible insurance plan. Every cent came out of my pocket.
  • A 2012 tax bill of about $2600 (which is more than my monthly net income and which I sent in right before the IRS went under criminal investigation)

Hence, despite life being much better these days with a full-time job, I can’t pay for VONA with cash, as I want to, and I have to be realistic about debt. After all, I’m a writer.

So I’m asking for help getting to VONA.

My goal is to raise $725—half the tuition/room & board, from YOU.

Your donations will go to my tuition/room & board fees for VONA. The rest is on me. I'm willing to invest in myself as an artist and will go to VONA no matter how much or how little I raise. I will put the cost on a credit card if I have to, but generating a larger base of support will help me not be so far behind as I work for the returns on my investment.

Should I raise more than what I need, I’ll put the surplus towards high-quality e-publishing a series of essay collections, likely through BookBaby. The design of e-book cover, layout and distribution to all e-book platforms costs $250.

Should I raise more than that, I’ll put the surplus towards credit card debt incurred by paying for VONA.

And you'll get something, too.

Check out the perks below!

Why The Truth and VONA are important

Two reasons:

  1. The voices of people of color, and especially women of color, are still largely missing from the literary world. Writers of color need supportive environments in which to learn and improve their craft, just as they need opportunities for publication.
  2. Hearing these voices is important because listening can bring about social change. I believe in art as a means of achieving social change. Therefore, writing is the way I choose to engage in activism and the way I think I’m most effective as an activist. Through creative writing and performance, I want to inform readers about sexism, racism, and their resulting social injustices and inspire them to rethink their world view, change their lives and change the culture of their communities.

I know what you’re thinking: “Wait. She’s stuck. How do we know she can finish this book?”

*I’m considered early-career because I haven’t published a book, but in Kentucky, I’m well-recognized as a writer. I’ve received awards and grants from Kentucky Foundation for Women, Kentucky Arts Council, University of Louisville, University of Kentucky and Society of Professional Journalists, Louisville Chapter.

And it’s not like I haven’t started. An agent read my 263-page memoir last year. It was a collection of essays then, and she suggested I rewrite it as a straight narrative. As an essayist, that has terrified me, but for the most part, I think it’s a good idea, and it’s in progress. The rewrite has already resulted in a brand new early chapter you can listen to right now.

Also, I’ve already had people sign up for updates about this memoir, and I’ve asked close family and friends to help with this Voyage to VONA. I’m determined not to let them down, even if it means I have to do another Indiegogo campaign to raise money to self-publish my book.

If you don’t want to or can’t donate to Mariam’s Voyage to VONA …

  • Spread the word about the campaign and/or the book to others who might be interested 
  • Get on my book and publications mailing list
  • Read my blog
  • Follow me on Twitter
  • Look out for more work by me beforeThe Truth comes out. I have plenty of essays--previously published and never seen before--that are off the memoir's subject. For a long time now, I've wanted to e-publish them in a series of collections, and it's just about that time.

story:
Darkness Strikes: A Short Story Collection

Darkness Strikes is a 10,000 word-plus collection of "dark fiction" short stories with varying topics including murder, suicide, and battles with the afterlife. There are currently four completed stories and the book is formatted and ready to be sent to the printers, however, depending on the funds I am able to raise I will be considering an additional two stories for inclusion into the collection.

The Impact and The Author

My name is Timothy Daniel Farrell and I am an author from the small town of Thomaston, CT. I have been writing for a relatively short period of time, but in my short career I have really come a long way. I graduated from Thomaston High School in 2008 and am currently pursuing an associates degree in Liberal Arts and Sciences at Naugatuck Valley Community College. 

I have held several writing jobs including freelance work for the hyper-local news website Patch.com as well as some volunteer journalism work for the video game websites HookedGamers.com and GameDwellers.com. My work is largely influenced by some of the industry giants in the "dark fiction" genre including Stephen King, Chuck Hogan, and Guillermo Del Toro. I also draw from M. Knight Shyamalan's style of telling a story and hitting the audience with a powerful ending.

This collection is my very first completed project and I am really looking forward to it's release. I have had a small number of outside participants read the finished product and the overall consensus is very positive so I have high hopes for the book's success. 


What We Need & What You Get

Currently I am looking at raising close to $1,000 USD. That money will be used primarily for printing and self-publishing, but also for the purchase of an ISBN number which would allow for sales on eBook platforms like Amazon's Kindle, and for some minor marketing/promotional costs.

I understand that money is tight all around for everyone so if donations and pledges are too much to ask, don't worry! There are plenty of other ways to show your support! You can spread the word on various social networking sites like Twitter and Facebook, or even just by word of mouth, every little bit helps.

For those of you who can spare a little cash to send my way I am going to try and do as much as I can for you. I will be offering perks like free autographed copies of the book, personal shout outs through email, phone calls, or even Skype messaging, as well as personal sponsor thank you pages in the actual book!

If any of you have questions about me, the book, or this campaign, please don't hesitate to visit my website and send me an email. I make it a goal to answer each and every one ASAP.

 currently.

Our Story

I have been a life long writer, though never published. I wrote my first play at age twelve. I have had a dream of being an accomplished writer my entire life and now I am close to being one. I want to publish my first collection o poetry as soon as possible. I finished it this summer along with another collection and a screenplay. I need to publish a thorough avoidance in order to move on to my next and next goals. i need to get the

 

Everyone I show my work to thinks it is wonderful, thought provoking and insightful. And twelve of my relatives can't be wrong! It is a wonderful collection that encompasses views on mental illness, spousal and child abuse,

lust, betrayal, longing, faith,grief and more. It will  appeal to a wide range of people who appreciate well written, well thought out, inspiring poetry.

 

I need $758 to cover the publishing and $92 to cover my first order of books and their shipping to me.

I have  a tier of rewards that start with under 10$ - a pdf file of 30 poems from the collection.

$10 - $20 a signed copy of the book. over  $20 - a signed copy of the book and a phone interview from me.

I hope this is acceptable.

 

Blogs. Website. Email. Fb or twitter its all a great way to tell your friends about the great book you just got and about the wonderful author you just discovered. So do me a favor, read, explore rage at it. but tell someody. They'll thank you.

story:
Please help this neophyte author publish her first full-length novel and screenplay. Although I have previously had poetry and short-stories published, this is my first attempt at publishing a full-length novel based on my life experiences. The venture into self-publishing will help me to get the materials necessary to write on the go, hire a part-time assistant to help with editing, marketing and production. My story will empower those who have faced similar challenges in life and illustrate the obstacles facing women-of-color in the 21st century USA.

Telling my story, although fictionalized, will help others who have faced similar issues but felt too stigmatized and ashamed to speak out and seek help. The story covers areas such as mental illness, corporal punishment, domestic violence, rape, homelessness, drug abuse, AIDs and ostracism.

Through trial, error and disaster, the heroine eventually achieves happiness, love and stability through sacrifice,  positive-thinking and a bit of guile. Although she goes through disheartening experiences (bullying and public humiliation), suffers dillusionment (explores the world of S&M in NYC and Amsterdam), and is continuously challenged to independently support herself and her child while living in one of the most violent and drug infested public housing projects in NY - eventually stability, love and success are achieved!

The novel takes you into some of the darkest areas of human existence and illustrates some of the brightest examples of minority women's plight for dignity and equality.

Rather than take a second job at minimum wage to make ends meet, I'd like to tell my story and hopefully begin a venture that will give others an opportunity to begin a career in publishing.

A little about me:

  • Poetry writer who took classes at the Harlem Schoemberg Inst.
  • Second place winner of erotica contest..
  • Instructor in Business Writing and Communication Skills at local college

story:
“Run Te Karehu, run!” the woman cried desperately as she struggled with her attackers. Te Karehu ran as quickly as she could. She didn’t look back, not even when she heard a deafening scream and the sound of a body falling to the ground; for she knew the consequences that would befall her, if she was not able to evade the attacking taua. Te Karehu had managed to scramble out of the turnip garden and fought to keep ahead of her pursuers; however, she was only a young girl and the men quickly caught her before she could reach the cover of the surrounding scrub. The men bound the girl, before returning to the turnip garden to prepare the woman that they had recently slain – for dinner.

 

The woman was the author’s 4 x great grandmother, and the girl - her daughter!

 

Project

Born for War: New Zealand’s Military History – A Family Perspective

 

An historical novel and accompanying documentary, with a difference. Born for War begins with traditional Maori inter-tribal warfare in the far-north of Aotearoa (New Zealand) in 1800 (see excerpt above); before continuing on through a number of subsequent conflicts and events, over a period of approximately 200 years. It focuses upon a number of ‘real’ characters (all related), including Maori war chiefs, European war heroes and their descendants; their roles and actions in their respective conflicts (including their interactions with each other). As well as being an entertaining novel, it can also be utilised as an academic reference; as the characters and events have been researched comprehensively and the novel referenced as such.

 

Aim of this project

This novel is not meant to promote or legitimise war in any way, shape or form - it is simply an honest account to acknowledge the roles and actions of 'real' characters during these conflicts. The novel takes a real 'twist' toward the end, with the author questioning the value of conflict as a way of resolving problems. The only genuine conclusion that can be drawn, is that war is a futile exercise.

 

'War does not determine who is right and who is wrong - only who is left'.

 

Author

The author is ex-military himself, having served in the Australian Army for a period of 10 years (1995-2005); initially as a Para-trooper with 3 RAR, before corps transferring and becoming a Military Policeman with 2 MP Coy. During his military career, he was presented with the awards for 'Most Outstanding Soldier' and 'Best at P.T.' (Physical Training) whilst at the School of Infantry in 1996; the 'Student of Merit' at the ADF Dental School in 1999; and 'Provost Marshal Army - Certificate of Merit' for fighting fires and evacuating personnel during 2002. The author was deployed on Operation Relex II in 2003, and was promoted to Corporal later that year. The author represented NSW Army in Rugby Union (1996) and Basketball (2003 & 2004). After discharging from the defence forces, the author completed a Bachelor of Arts degree (2005-2007) and a Master of Teaching degree (2008-2009); he now teaches in the South West Sydney region.

 

Impact of the 'Born for War' project so far

The author's research has already had an impact upon New Zealand's cultural, historical and legal scenes. A discovery about the signatories to the Treaty of Waitangi, has been discussed by academics, scholars and historians and is currently being used in the current Ngapuhi Treaty Hearings. The author's research is being used by the Ministry for Culture and Heritage on their New Zealand History online website. Two Kiwi artists, Penny Howard (painter) and Doug Poole (poet); have created artworks and poems about Ngapuhi chief Moka Te Kainga-mataa, using my research findings as their inspiration. The Russell Museum is displaying an exhibition titled 'Three Brother Chiefs: Te Wharerahi, Rewa, Moka' in 2012.*Please refer to the website addresses below for further information.

 

What I will spend your hard-earned money on

As part of my research process, I have endeavoured to travel to as many of the sites of which I write. I have done this for a number of reasons. The first reason being, to 'walk the ground' so that I can undertake a thorough ground appreciation, as well as observe any specific aspects which can assist my writing. Another reason being, to pay my respects to every soldier of whom I write.

 

I plan to travel to, and undertake research on the former WW1 Western Front of Ypres (Ieper) and Messines (Mesen) in Belgium, in June 2011. This trip will see me visit numerous battle sites, museums, memorials, and cemeteries in this region. Of particular note, is my visit to the Kandahar Farm Cemetery in Wulverghem, to pay my respects to a family member, who lost his life on the first day of the Battle of Messines on June 7, 1917.*Hence the specific date of my trip.

 

Why I need your help

I have already purchased the airfare and travel insurance ($1,900) but still require 'on-site' costs i.e. regional travel (trains), local travel (buses, taxi), accommodation, food, entry fees, etc.

 

I have invested upwards of $40,000 of my own funds towards this project, without any funding from organisations or institutions (with the exception of the Neville Wallace Children's and Grandchildren's Memorial Trust, who provided $500 towards my Vietnamese research trip in 2010). As you can imagine, these research trips are extremely costly, and when added together - are a considerable challenge for a writer without any funding.

 

Please help me tell this story...

“Run Te Karehu, run!” the woman cried desperately as she struggled with her attackers. Te Karehu ran as quickly as she could. She didn’t look back, not even when she heard a deafening scream and the sound of a body falling to the ground; for she knew the consequences that would befall her, if she was not able to evade the attacking taua. Te Karehu had managed to scramble out of the turnip garden and fought to keep ahead of her pursuers; however, she was only a young girl and the men quickly caught her before she could reach the cover of the surrounding scrub. The men bound the girl, before returning to the turnip garden to prepare the woman that they had recently slain – for dinner. 
 
The woman was the author’s 4 x great grandmother, and the girl - her daughter! 
 
Project 
Born for War: New Zealand’s Military History – A Family Perspective 
 
An historical novel and accompanying documentary, with a difference. Born for War begins with traditional Maori inter-tribal warfare in the far-north of Aotearoa (New Zealand) in 1800 (see excerpt above); before continuing on through a number of subsequent conflicts and events, over a period of approximately 200 years. It focuses upon a number of ‘real’ characters (all related), including Maori war chiefs, European war heroes and their descendants; their roles and actions in their respective conflicts (including their interactions with each other). As well as being an entertaining novel, it can also be utilised as an academic reference; as the characters and events have been researched comprehensively and the novel referenced as such. 
 
Aim of this project
This novel is not meant to promote or legitimise war in any way, shape or form - it is simply an honest account to acknowledge the roles and actions of 'real' characters during these conflicts. The novel takes a real 'twist' toward the end, with the author questioning the value of conflict as a way of resolving problems. The only genuine conclusion that can be drawn, is that war is a futile exercise.
 
'War does not determine who is right and who is wrong - only who is left'.

story: We are a highly successful online magazine (www.drunkenabsurdity.com) founded by alternative writer Adam Schirling that features the very best counter-culture, underground, and alternative literature, music, movies, art, and poetry from artists and writers all over the world. Due to such high demand, as well as nostalgia for counter-culture mags of the past, we wish to publish our very first print issue! However the cost of publishing a print magazine in a quality that our amazing contributors and readers deserve is very high. We have tried raising capital from selling t-shirts, posters, and stickers (www.drunkenabsurdity.storenvy.com), but we are falling far short of the minimum needed. The money will be spent on the cost of designing, printing, binding, and shipping our magazine all over the world! Drunken Absurdity came to existence due to my own experiences as an alternative writer trying to get work published in online and print magazines. For every one piece I would have published, 5 would be rejected for being too controversial or alternative in nature. To me that seemed wrong, and against the core principles of alternative lit. The more I met other writers and artists with the same story, the angrier I got. Finally, I decided to create a home for all the misfits in the underground lit and art scene. Most of us haven't been to art school or hold a Masters in Creative Writing. We are born of the same blood as Bukowksi, Kerouac, and Hunter Thompson. We love what we do, and deserve a platform to be heard on!

story:
My name is Michael Dorsey and I am a professional speaker living in Baltimore, MD:
  • The One Click Movement is a project that was born out of my love for riding roller coasters which I  was unable to do because of my weight.
  • In 1999, I attempted to ride the "Lightning Racer" at Hersheypark.  Leading up to actually sitting in the seat, we really thought it was going to happen.  However, after 3 attendants attempted to get my lap bar locked down, they had to ask me to get off of the ride.  At one point, I remember one of the attendants even saying, "All we need is One Click, all we need is One Click..." but we never heard that click.  I remember walking away, watching the train leave the station and thinking to myself, "I was One Click away from getting what I wanted.  I could smell it, I could taste it, I could see it...but I couldn't have it." 
  • While the hurdle I needed to overcome was my weight, I have come to realize that everyone has a "One Click" issue that they need to overcome in order to do that thing they have been wanting to do.  
  • I NEED your help achieving my dream of inspiring others to pursue their passion and purpose by helping them overcome their One Click.

 

What I Need
 
  • I need $10,000 to pay for the production of the "One Click" book which will serve as a supplement to the keynotes and workshops I plan to travel the country presenting. 
  • Production costs include:  Editing, Artwork, Publishing, Copywright registration.
  • Funds will also be used for supplies and equipment needed for production.
  • Perks (Named after some of my favorite roller coasters) Hard copies of the finished book, Inspirational MP3, Behind the Scenes DVD, Commemorative T-Shirt, Books donated in your name to an organization or group of your choice, a 20 minute Skype session and a 30 minute keynote.
The Impact 
  • I believe that this project is an opportunity to inspire individuals to tackle head on that hurdle or obstacle that seems to be keeping them from pursuing that "thing" they have been wanting to pursue (i.e. lose weight, start a new business, propose to significant other, change careers, etc...)
  • Even before my time on NBC's The Biggest Loser, I was in the business of inspiring individuals to develop their personal and professional traits for success.  This project will allow me to combine my love for people and the experience millions have witnessed with my transformation on television.
  • The MLD Communications advisory team is made up of folks who  are committed to bringing this project in on budget and in a timely manner.  I promise to use your money well! 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you can't donate money, there is still a way you can help...Spread the word! The more people that know about this project the larger the impact.  So tweet, retweet, text, call, email, stand on a street corner - just tell others about us, encourage them to donate and/or spread the word.

sous-titres français

PARA CONSTRUIR LA CABINA DE NUESTRA RADIO COMUNITARIA INDIGENA AUTONOMA, MEXICO

QUIENES SOMOS

Somos un grupo de jóvenes indígenas nahuas y popolucas que vivimos en el Sur de Veracruz en México, integrados a la  “Articulación de la Sierra de Santa Marta” donde compartimos sueños, sembramos y cultivamos semillas de un futuro mejor para nuestros pueblos.  Enlazamos nuestro trabajo el Movimiento de resistencia civil contra las altas tarifas de luz, la Red de mujeres de la tierra unidas por un futuro y un mundo mejor, nuestras radios comunitarias, el Centro de Derechos Humanos de los pueblos del Sur de Veracruz “Bety Cariño”, el proceso de “Fortalecimiento de los pueblos popolucas en defensa del territorio” y el Colectivo Altepee.

QUE ESTAMOS HACIENDO, COMO PUEDES AYUDAR

Estamos construyendo nuestro centro de articulación, una palapa comunitaria, con el esfuerzo en ayuda mutua de todos y todas. Para este año 2013, tenemos el sueño de construir un cuarto de edición de audios y videos, y un espacio para la cabina de radio. Es para este proyecto de construcción que les solicitamos el apoyo de 6 mil dólares.

En caso de que no nos puedan apoyar con recursos económicos pero desean hacerlo de alguna manera, les invitamos a difundir esta campaña con todos sus contactos.

IMPACTO

Con la construcción de la cabina de radio en nuestro centro de articulación, donde se encuentra la palapa y la tiendita de productos de la región, podremos darle mucho más vida a nuestra radio comunitaria, a la producción de videos, programas de música, noticieros, y más – aquí mismo en nuestra palapa comunitaria – contando así con mayor presencia y mayor calidad de programación para todas las comunidades que nos escuchan.

 Muchísimas gracias por su apoyo solidario.

 

::: ENGLISH :::

FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF OUR AUTONOMOUS, INDIGENOUS COMMUNITY RADIO, MEXICO

WHO WE ARE

We are a group of indigenous youth, nahuas and popolucas, who live in southern Veracruz in Mexico, part of an organizing process called the “Articulation of the Sierra Santa Marta Region,” where we share dreams and cultivate seeds of a better future for our communities.  We bring together our diverse forms of work and organizing, the Civil Resistance Movement Against High Electricity Rates, the Network of Women United for a Better Future and World, our Community Radios, the Bety Cariño Center for Human Rights of the Peoples of Southern Veracruz, the Strengthening the Popoluca People in Defense of the Land,” and the Colectivo Altepee. 

WHAT WE’RE DOING, HOW YOU CAN HELP

We are building a community center, our palapa, a joint space of articulation, with the mutual help of everyone – men and women, youth, adults, and elders.  This year, 2013, we plan to build a room for editing audio and video, and a radio booth for the community radio station.  It is for this construction project that we are fundraising six thousand dollars.

In the case that you can’t contribute monetarily, but you wish to help, please circulate the information of our efforts to your contacts! 

IMPACT

With the construction of our radio booth at our articulation center, where our our communities come together, and where our small store sells local products, we will liven up our community radio station – producing videos and audio here at our community palapa – strengthening  our presence and the quality of programming for our communities.

Many thanks for you solidarity and support. 

 

::: FRANÇAIS :::

POUR CONSTRUIRE LA CABINE DE NOTRE RADIO COMUNAUTAIRE AUTOCHTONE AUTONOME, MEXIQUE

QUI SOMMES NOUS

Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes autochtones nahuas et popolucas qui vivons dans le Sud de l’ état du Veracruz au Méxique, integré à l’ Articulation de la montagne de Santa Marta” dans laquelle nous partageons nos rêves et semons et cultivons les graines d’un avenir meilleur. Nous coordonnons nos actions avec le mouvement de résistance civile contre les tarifs élevés de l'électricité, le Réseau de femmes de la terre, unies pour un avenir et un monde meilleur”, nos radios comunautaires, le Centre de Droits Humains des peuples du Sud du Veracruz “Bety Cariño”, le processus de renforcement du peuple popoluca pour la défense du territoire et le groupe de jeunes de musique traditionnelle Altepee.

QUE FAISONS NOUS, COMMENT PEUX TU AIDER

Nous construisons notre centre d’ articulation, une palapa comunautaire avec l’ effort de tout le monde. Pour cette année 2013, nous avons le rêve de construire une pièce d’ édition d’ audios et videos et un espace pour la cabine de radio.  C’ est pour ce projet de construction que nous cherchons le soutien de 6 mil dolars.

IMPACT

Avec la construction de la cabine de radio dans le centre d’ articulation où se trouve la palapa y le petit magasin de produits regionaux, nous pourrons donner beaucoup plus de vie à notre radio comunautaire, à la production de videos, programmes de musique, nouvelles, et autres – ici même dans notre palapa communautaire - avec davantage de présence et une meilleure qualité des programmes pour le bien de tous les villages qui nous ecoutent.

Merci beaucoup pour votre soutien solidaire.

story:
Managing in the Land of Tea, Taliban and Warlords

"Drink tea ‘til you pee". This may be the most important secret for succeeding in business in Afghanistan and the rest of the developing world. Of course, it’s not really about the tea. So what is the principle embedded in that phrase that so often dictates the success or failure of a business deal in most of the world? It is this principle, and others like it, that this book will spell out. 

This book uses my business experiences in Afghanistan to illustrate what it takes to succeed in business in environments outside of the West and how to successfully manage cross-culturally. This is not a book about the war in Afghanistan, though it certainly deals with its consequences.

I landed in Afghanistan in 2003 as one of a small group of eight senior executives for a new mobile phone start-up - now Afghanistan's largest mobile phone provider. Pock-marked skeletal buildings showed the physical damage wrought on the country by its over two decades of nearly continuous conflict. But I quickly discovered that the cost in human capital was far greater as I began to work with Afghans whose approach to business and to life had been shaped principally by their need to simply survive. To navigate this hostile minefield of cultural complexities required every bit of the cultural intelligence and experience that I had learned through my childhood growing up in Ecuador and Indonesia and my years doing business in over thirty countries around the world. 

Over the years spent working in Afghanistan, I have gathered together stories of my experiences - some are funny, others serious and still others life-threatening. Many of these experiences illustrate key principles for how to lead, manage and do business cross-culturally. After leaving the mobile phone company I started my own leadership training company where my colleagues and I trained and mentored senior Afghan leaders in business and government. It was here that I honed and applied the principles which I had learned through sweat, tears and (almost) blood. 

This book targets the business professional who is or will be working cross-culturally. However, with the size of the world shrinking quickly, most of us, even outside the business realm, are dealing with relationships that cross the cultural divide. This book is for you too.

So, how can you help?

I need your financial support to finish this book and get it published. Indiegogo gives you an easy way to join me on this journey.

How does Indiegogo work?

Indiegogo works by helping me fund my project online through your contributions. You contribute, but you also get a reward for your contribution and for partnering with me. 

I have tried to make the rewards mostly about getting a copy of the book itself, but wanted to throw in an extra here and there to say thanks to everyone who has faith in me. I've put in one ultimate (and crazy) reward for those who are crazy like me (and have deep pockets); a business tour of Kabul and, naturally, a round of golf at the world’s most dangerous golf course, the Kabul Golf Club… and a book, of course. After arriving in Kabul, I'll be your own personal guide and golf buddy at the course that was still a live minefield when I first arrived in the country in 2002. Don't worry. They've all been cleared... they say.

What’s the process for contributing? 

    • Click on the Contribute button

    • Contribute $15 or more. You can use your credit card or Paypal account.

    • Tell others about the book and encourage them to join the adventure!  

Reaching the Goal

There is no upper limit to the support the project can receive. The more money it receives, the higher quality the editing, the higher quality the graphics art and the higher quality the book itself. Ultimately I’d love to market the book more widely, but that really is a stretch goal!

Where the Money goes 

    • A good editor… used multiple times! 
    • Professional advice 
    • Cover graphics that speak of quality 
    • Printing costs 
    • Expenses related to the actual writing

Risks and Challenges

Challenges: Staying alive at least until the book gets published! Just kidding… sort of. My wife, Katrina (who I met in Kabul), and I will head back into Kabul after the Christmas season in Seattle. As long as we have no more crazies like Terry Jones burning Qurans and no one tells the Taliban that I'm going to mention them in the book, we’ll be fine.

I'll finish up the writing using the editorial services of a quality self-publishing house, get my Afghan colleagues' final input and then send it to be printed. Of course Afghanistan tends to alter most well-laid plans, but adaptability is one of the principles from the book and that principle will be well-used by the end of the project.

Managing in the Land of Tea, Taliban and Warlords
"Drink tea ‘til you pee". This may be the most important secret for succeeding in business in Afghanistan and the rest of the developing world. Of course, it’s not really about the tea. So what is the principle embedded in that phrase that so often dictates the success or failure of a business deal in most of the world? It is this principle, and others like it, that this book will spell out. 
This book uses my business experiences in Afghanistan to illustrate what it takes to succeed in business in environments outside of the West and how to successfully manage cross-culturally. This is not a book about the war in Afghanistan, though it certainly deals with its consequences.
I landed in Afghanistan in 2003 as one of a small group of eight senior executives for a new mobile phone start-up - now Afghanistan's largest mobile phone provider. Pock-marked skeletal buildings showed the physical damage wrought on the country by its over two decades of nearly continuous conflict. But I quickly discovered that the cost in human capital was far greater as I began to work with Afghans whose approach to business and to life had been shaped principally by their need to simply survive. To navigate this hostile minefield of cultural complexities required every bit of the cultural intelligence and experience that I had learned through my childhood growing up in Ecuador and Indonesia and my years doing business in over thirty countries around the world. 
Over the years spent working in Afghanistan, I have gathered together stories of my experiences - some are funny, others serious and still others life-threatening. Many of these experiences illustrate key principles for how to lead, manage and do business cross-culturally. After leaving the mobile phone company I started my own leadership training company where my colleagues and I trained and mentored senior Afghan leaders in business and government. It was here that I honed and applied the principles which I had learned through sweat, tears and (almost) blood. 
This book targets the business professional who is or will be working cross-culturally. However, with the size of the world shrinking quickly, most of us, even outside the business realm, are dealing with relationships that cross the cultural divide. This book is for you too.
So, how can you help?
I need your financial support to finish this book and get it published. Indiegogo gives you an easy way to join me on this journey.
How does Indiegogo work?
Indiegogo works by helping me fund my project online through your contributions. You contribute, but you also get a reward for your contribution and for partnering with me. 
I have tried to make the rewards mostly about getting a copy of the book itself, but wanted to throw in an extra here and there to say thanks to everyone who has faith in me. I've put in one ultimate (and crazy) reward for those who are crazy like me (and have deep pockets); a business tour of Kabul and, naturally, a round of golf at the world’s most dangerous golf course, the Kabul Golf Club… and a book, of course. After arriving in Kabul, I'll be your own personal guide and golf buddy at the course that was still a live minefield when I first arrived in the country in 2002. Don't worry. They've all been cleared... they say.
What’s the process for contributing? 
    • Click on the Contribute button
    • Contribute $15 or more. You can use your credit card or Paypal account.
    • Tell others about the book and encourage them to join the adventure!  
Reaching the Goal
There is no upper limit to the support the project can receive. The more money it receives, the higher quality the editing, the higher quality the graphics art and the higher quality the book itself. Ultimately I’d love to market the book more widely, but that really is a stretch goal!
Where the Money goes 
    • A good editor… used multiple times!      • Professional advice      • Cover graphics that speak of quality      • Printing costs      • Expenses related to the actual writing

story:
EMPOWERED2BEME
Hi, and thank you for your interest.  Empowered2beme (My Cure for Type 2 Diabetes) is a very robust book and manual to help others overcomeType2 Diabetes and is the culmination of countless hours of personal research and development that empowered me to overcome Type 2 Diabetes and morbid obesity.  This is not information given by my doctor or dietician.  This is a lifestyle change, not a diet and is simple and easy to follow.

Type 2 Diabetes "The Silent Killer"
Type 2 Diabetes is one of the worlds largest and fastest growing epidemics, currently with more than  24,000,000,000 diagnosed in the U.S. alone without prejudice.   346 million people worldwide have diabetes.  Diabetes is a leading cause in Heart Attacks and Strokes and is the perpetrator and cause of countless deaths.  The information I have put together if followed could possibly eradicate the death rate from Type 2 Diabetes.

The Cure
Have your ever lost a loved one or dear friend to a serious illness or disease and it seemed there was nothing you could do to help.  NOW is the time!  I believe this book contains the power to eradicate Type 2 Diabetes.  What a bold statement, I know!  But after more than 15 years of uncontrolled sugar levels between 300 and 600 at any given time, I am FREE and have been for more than three years.  (and I am not on any medicine to regulate my blood sugar levels).

The Question
If you had the cure would you wait, would you stay silent, would help get the cure to others?  Or would you do nothing?  I believe I found the cure and can't stay silent.

The Plea 
I need your help to make this possible.  Help me "Rock the world with hope".

The Book
The book will be separated for quick reference, the first part being the story of how I personally overcame Type 2 Diabetes and subsequent chapters of detailed access to food lists and nutritional information and guides showing others how each food will effect their blood sugar levels and showing them how to make the best choices.  

Our food producers and Associations are deceiving the vast population diagnosed with Type2 Diabetes by labeling food as "Sugar Free" it may be sugar free; however a lot of these sugar free foods are worse for you to eat than normal sweets.  Its a LIE and the results are that of a insulin nuclear bomb!  This book will educate and Empower those diagnosed with Type2 Diabetes on the truths about foods and how they truly effect the body.   I am very passionate about this because these principles and this information has changed and saved my life and halted further complications.  

The Recipe Book
The Recipe Book will offer recipes that I have personally created and others that have been adapted to allow people with Type2 Diabetes to enjoy life with freedoms to include Entrees, Appetizers and Desserts that should not elevate the blood sugar levels.  

The App
The App will give quick access to foods with needed values and offer a quick list of best choices for foods that should not elevate the blood sugar levels.  The App will also allow each person to track their daily, weekly and monthly progress.

The Website
The website will integrate cooking videos, pod casts, blogs as support forums and links to helpful information, calendar of events and special offers such as an e-format of the book and recipe book that will offer the same integration to track progress as the app does.  

My Brief Story
For 15 years i struggled with uncontrolled Type2 Diabetes with little problems/symptoms except for frequent urination, which was not so bad; however, my blood sugar at anytime would range between 300-600.  I was not compliant with the doctors orders because the medicine they prescribed made me sick and it was worse than the current symptoms.

 About 5 years ago i began to experience Diabetic Neuropathy and was eventually diagnosed with Diabetic Retinopathy.  I took this serious and did not want to lose my vision or legs.  The doctors prescribed medicine and I was compliant to take it, but did not want to be on it for the rest of my life like the doctor said, so I started researching what caused Type2 Diabetes and found it was pretty much in direct relation to what you eat.  For the past almost four years my blood sugar has remained in normal range (usually lower than those that have never had blood sugar problems and my last A1C was 5.1 which is incredible) and the neuropathy and retinopathy has subsided.  I want to share what I discovered with the world to help everyone that struggles with Type 2 Diabetes overcome.  Help me "Rock the world with Hope!".

story:
Everyone who gets a Perk, of any type, will be invited to our World Kick Off Party at the end of the Year!  This will be a must attend, history making event!  Please note that travel and lodging is not included.

Get your own signed eBook, or printed copy & join the online community!

Plus your support will help send books - in your name - to influential people & challenge them to think:

What does it mean to be a woman today? 

Do women really have the right to fully express, and be themselves?

Does society still hold women back? If so, how does society hold women back? Who holds women back? This book and social network address these questions in a new way. It will intrigue, shock, and possibly disturb you. As a result, you might just think about things in a different way. It is a controversial series of women's interviews and photos. There is no nudity, just astonishing portraits of women from all walks-of-life.

However, most of the women also had portraits taken while having intense orgasms. 

Some chose not to, it was completely voluntary. 


Why did they do this? To make a statement, to stimulate discussion about women's rights, to express themselves, to be part of something that challenges social stigmas and norms, and to have beautiful portraits made.

They also participated because there is a revolutionary device that allows women to achieve the big "O"- quickly and while fully clothed.

They talked about their feelings of double standards on many topics, including careers, academics, "acceptable behavior", taking the initiative in relationships, sexual expression, masturbation, bi and homosexuality, chivalry, the future, being the "bread winner", children, and other topics.

We found a common reason why women felt they couldn't express themselves.




It wasn't what we expected.

We didn't start out asking these questions - a very unusual path led us here.  Sometimes life is much stranger than fiction.

Human Innovations is a health and biotechnology start-up. The director of R&D was researching ways to help with scarring and adhesions that can result from C-Section surgery.  He discovered a method, and device, that appeared to help significantly.

The device also caused an unexpected side effect.  It literally gave the fully clothed women who tested it intense orgasms.  While this was quite amazing, it certainly was not part of their original direction.


All the women emphatically endorsed it for private, home use. 


However, a new controversy arose.




One woman suggested that since you can be fully clothed, why not have it in health clubs, and even dance clubs? The DiscoStick(TM) worked through clothing, even jeans - so why not?

Many women agreed, others were horrified...


How would you react? How would your family and friends react?


Just because something was possible, should we do it?


Things got even more confusing when some women said it absolutely was not acceptable in general. However, it might be OK in certain exceptions, like at a Chippendale's show and other women were doing it, or if their partner, or boy friend “made” them try it at a dance club.

What is the difference? When women talked about it together, they often were not able to explain why they had their particular view.

Frequently, their answer was "that's just the way it is".

Granted this is a very new and different scenario, but it forced us to address many questions most people did not know, nor did not want to even acknowledge existed. A huge variety of responses continued to come from different women and their partners.

This also caused other questions to come up about what exactly it meant to be a woman today. Do women have equal rights with men?

A similar situation happened with drugs like Viagra®* a prescription only “medical” therapy for men.  How is this different?


Are women truly “sexually liberated” today – or are there still hidden rules that rigidly dictate how women express themselves? What other “unwritten and unspoken” rules are out there?


Are these rules truly helping women (and men) be all they can be? Who enforces these rules? Do Men, Women, both parties enforce these rules?


The more we discussed it, the more controversy, double standards and "unspoken rules" kept coming up. It was astonishing how people's lives are controlled by rules they often do not even realize are there. Some were intensely curious about this new realization - it made others angry.

People, who saw the test videos, kept commenting on how amazingly beautiful the women's expressions were. From those ideas, we decided to try to document this unusual phenomenon in a book. We are not trying to make any stance, just trying to capture what really is going on.

However, we were concerned that a book of this nature would be considered "PORN".  One lady laughed and said: "PORN??? how can this be PORN?.... the women are clothed & the orgasms are real".



The Impact:

Reading this far, it's likely you either really support the idea of women being able to express themselves this way – or you're totally against it.

Our question to you is: can you clearly answer why?


We are creating a book that attracts interest due to its controversy - and then challenges people to really think about who they are, and what they want out of life. Possibly even becoming aware of beliefs they never realized they had, but just  "accepted". We are not trying to tell you what to think. We are asking you to think - and share with others what you think. The theme of this book, addresses one of the fundamental aspects of being an adult woman. Though fundamental, it is often shrouded in a multitude of cultural rules for expression.

It appears some of the challenges in cultures stem from people not feeling comfortable talking about certain topics – resulting in those areas becoming “covert”. This not only hinders freedom of expression but also causes internal conflicts. It also opens the door for exploitation.

Perhaps by really thinking about this topic, and considering both your spoken and unspoken rules, you might expand that to other areas as well. Are you truly living the life you want to and being the person your really are inside? Are you living up to your true potential? If not, what is really holding you back?

By sending these books to influential people, and the resulting controversy, our goal is to encourage people worldwide to think about what it means to be a woman, and feel more comfortable being whoever they are.

Since it has no nudity or profanity, it should be allowable in most venues.

By these women sharing their personal dreams, hopes and fears, maybe people will realize that we're all unique, but deep down, not all that different. We believe the better we understand and appreciate each other, the richer life is.Our way of doing this is to capture a snapshot of these ladies lives - expressing their emotion and simply being in the moment.

Billy Cone once said that to him, art is anything that both moved the artist, and conveys emotion in those seeing it.  After you see this book, we think you'll agree that these wonderful women are very real people, who have become "ART".


We have an amazing team. 

Alie Hargrove, Delilah Dice, and Maude Mensah, are the first of the 17 models who have participated so far.  Their conviction and courage to speak up about topics of which most are afraid to will benefit both Women and Men.  We're honoured to work with them.

Billy Cone is an Internationally renowned photographer, artist and curator.  For the past 8 years he's travelled world wide taking women's portraits for his new book "FEMME".  Previous art books published include: "Photos de Voyage & A Gourmet's Journal" and "Living Statues Photographies".  Billy divides his time between living in North Carolina and France. 

EJ Holmes is an award winning portrait photographer specializing in the female nude.  EJ has travelled extensively in Canada, the US and South America both taking photos and working as a certified Coffee taster.  EJ lives in Montreal Canada.

SlapDash Publishing, LLC.  Publishes a wide range of photographic and art books focusing primarily on regional history.  They have been essential in helping us develop this project.

Steve McGough, is the author of "Faces of O".  He's the director of R&D at Human Innovations, LLC. and has filed US and International Patents, as well as trademarks in the US, European Union, and Japan related to this project.  Steve has worked in a variety of areas ranging from neuroscience to creating Internet and high tech companies.


Do you want to be part of History?

We are raising a total of $20,000


$15,000 for printing of "Faces of O" as a hard cover coffee table style book.  This will allow us to put them in locations where they will be eagerly accepted, and some where, they will not. We are getting most of the layout and development volunteered, so all the $15K will go into the book. 17 Models have volunteered so far, we will be shooting more models soon to complete the project.



$5000 to upgrade our current social networking site server infrastructure. This money will cover upgrade to the social network sites capacity -- and improve each online member's experience. We have completed site development. Several hundred people have already joined and are active in the community. However, it is currently hosted on a single shared server. Frequently we will have over 1000 people looking at the site. This causes a slow-down in performance with the current set up. This money will be used to migrate the servers to a hosted "cloud". This will give us flexibility to expand as user demand increases.


The goal is to have over 10K users by the end of the Summer. Through this, you will be able to share your stories, and meet thousands of new potential friends. Steve & numerous Open Source technology volunteers have donated all engineering and labor.

This would not be possible without projects such as the Elgg social networking software platform, and their wonderful teams of supporters around the world.  They are supporting us, & we're committed to bring the "O" back to Open Source.


What you get:

We will provide this to you guaranteed, whether the full funding goal is met.

Please see our Perks on the upper right side of the site.  We are only offering what we can currently provide - with your help, together we can really make a difference!

Please also note that the "Limited Collectors Edition" Ebooks will include more photos than the printed versions, as well as the Ebooks which will be available later.  Further, you can send a request to the Author regarding who you'd like the book dedicated to, as well as other thoughts.  Steve will write a personal note in response & sign it.  We'll then scan the message and integrate it into your personal collectors edition Ebook.

If you use a coupon to purchase printed books at our wholesale cost + shipping, Steve will write a personal note and dedication on this inside of each book for you.

For digital images, we will provide you a login & password to an online photo gallery.  After browsing the gallery & selecting the image(s) you like, just let us know their name(s).  We'll then email or provide a link to the high resolution file. 

Digital images offered are in the 8-18 mega pixel size & suitable for very large prints.  If you want to print the portrait, we can also give recommendations to the highest quality & most cost effective photo printers we have found so far.  To make sure we can deliver on everything we have here, we're only providing the digital media, however the printers we refer you to will charge you the same wholesale cost we would have paid.


We'd like to meet you!  Alie, Delilah, Maude, Billy, EJ, Steve and all the others participating in the book are members of the social networking site.  You can create an account and ask any of them questions.

If you think of something else you'd like, contact us & make an offer!  It's possible we can add it as a Perk!



What do we do if the funding is over $20k?

First, we all dance a jig!  Then - more books!!!!  More funding allows us to print more books. You funding the project makes this happen.


Also, getting the books to physically exist is just step one. Getting people to think is the next big challenge.


With sufficient funding we'll send hundreds of copies of the hard copy book to influential people & hopefully challenge them to think.  We'll send (or hand deliver) them to Lady Gaga, public libraries, Donald Trump, Ellen Degeneres, Rush Libaugh, Snoop Dog, David Guetta, Oprah,  Michelle & Barack Obama, Oprah, Grahm Norton, Sarah Palin, Hillary Clinton, Bill Clinton, Martha Steward, Queen Elizabeth, The Daily Show, The Colbert Report, & Hugh Hefner to name a few.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe try the " Three for Three" --- If you agree with this idea - or you don't agree - LET OTHERS KNOW ABOUT IT!  Tell at least 3 other people & ask them to each tell 3 or more people to repeat spreading the word?


Join the "Faces of O" Facebook community and invite all your friends to join as well.


"Like" this page on Facebook and tell all your friends to check it out!


Tweet to all your friends what you think about this project!


Model for the project! - Limited spots available, check the social network for upcoming shoot locations, and dates. If you'd like a guaranteed spot in the book, check our perks.


Challenge local celebrities and media personalities to Model for the project!

Do you have an opinion you want to share?  Join the social network at discostick.co to share your own stories and experiences, and discuss this with others.




* Viagra® is a trademark of Pfizer, Inc. and is not affiliated with Human Innovations, LLC
