Are you truly living the life you want to and being the person your really are inside? Are you living up to your true potential? If not, what is really holding you back?By sending these books to influential people, and the resulting controversy, our goal is to encourage people worldwide to think about what it means to be a woman, and feel more comfortable being whoever they are.Since it has no nudity or profanity, it should be allowable in most venues.By these women sharing their personal dreams, hopes and fears, maybe people will realize that we're all unique, but deep down, not all that different.  We believe the better we understand and appreciate each other, the richer life is.Our way of doing this is to capture a snapshot of these ladies lives - expressing their emotion and simply being in the moment.Billy Cone once said that to him, art is anything that both moved the artist, and conveys emotion in those seeing it.  After you see this book, we think you'll agree that these wonderful women are very real people, who have become "ART". 
We have an amazing team.  
Alie Hargrove, Delilah Dice, and Maude Mensah, are the first of the 17 models who have participated so far.  Their conviction and courage to speak up about topics of which most are afraid to will benefit both Women and Men.  We're honoured to work with them. Billy Cone is an Internationally renowned photographer, artist and curator.  For the past 8 years he's travelled world wide taking women's portraits for his new book "FEMME".  Previous art books published include: "Photos de Voyage & A Gourmet's Journal" and "Living Statues Photographies".  Billy divides his time between living in North Carolina and France.  EJ Holmes is an award winning portrait photographer specializing in the female nude.  EJ has travelled extensively in Canada, the US and South America both taking photos and working as a certified Coffee taster.  EJ lives in Montreal Canada.SlapDash Publishing, LLC.  Publishes a wide range of photographic and art books focusing primarily on regional history.  They have been essential in helping us develop this project.Steve McGough, is the author of "Faces of O".  He's the director of R&D at Human Innovations, LLC. and has filed US and International Patents, as well as trademarks in the US, European Union, and Japan related to this project.  Steve has worked in a variety of areas ranging from neuroscience to creating Internet and high tech companies.Do you want to be part of History?

We are raising a total of $20,000 
$15,000 for printing of "Faces of O" as a hard cover coffee table style book.  This will allow us to put them in locations where they will be eagerly accepted, and some where, they will not.   We are getting most of the layout and development volunteered, so all the $15K will go into the book.  17 Models have volunteered so far, we will be shooting more models soon to complete the project.


$5000 to upgrade our current social networking site server infrastructure. This money will cover upgrade to the social network sites capacity -- and improve each online member's experience.  We have completed site development.  Several hundred people have already joined and are active in the community.  However, it is currently hosted on a single shared server.  Frequently we will have over 1000 people looking at the site.  This causes a slow-down in performance with the current set up.  This money will be used to migrate the servers to a hosted "cloud".  This will give us flexibility to expand as user demand increases.
The goal is to have over 10K users by the end of the Summer.  Through this, you will be able to share your stories, and meet thousands of new potential friends.  Steve & numerous Open Source technology volunteers have donated all engineering and labor.  This would not be possible without projects such as the Elgg social networking software platform, and their wonderful teams of supporters around the world.  They are supporting us, & we're committed to bring the "O" back to Open Source.

What you get:

We will provide this to you guaranteed, whether the full funding goal is met.

Please see our Perks on the upper right side of the site.  We are only offering what we can currently provide - with your help, together we can really make a difference!Please also note that the "Limited Collectors Edition" Ebooks will include more photos than the printed versions, as well as the Ebooks which will be available later.  Further, you can send a request to the Author regarding who you'd like the book dedicated to, as well as other thoughts.  Steve will write a personal note in response & sign it.  We'll then scan the message and integrate it into your personal collectors edition Ebook.If you use a coupon to purchase printed books at our wholesale cost + shipping, Steve will write a personal note and dedication on this inside of each book for you.For digital images, we will provide you a login & password to an online photo gallery.  After browsing the gallery & selecting the image(s) you like, just let us know their name(s).  We'll then email or provide a link to the high resolution file.  Digital images offered are in the 8-18 mega pixel size & suitable for very large prints.  If you want to print the portrait, we can also give recommendations to the highest quality & most cost effective photo printers we have found so far.  To make sure we can deliver on everything we have here, we're only providing the digital media, however the printers we refer you to will charge you the same wholesale cost we would have paid.
We'd like to meet you!  Alie, Delilah, Maude, Billy, EJ, Steve and all the others participating in the book are members of the social networking site.  You can create an account and ask any of them questions. 
If you think of something else you'd like, contact us & make an offer!  It's possible we can add it as a Perk!




What do we do if the funding is over $20k?
First, we all dance a jig!  Then - more books!!!!  More funding allows us to print more books. You funding the project makes this happen.

Also, getting the books to physically exist is just step one. Getting
 people to think is the next big challenge.
With sufficient funding we'll send hundreds of copies of the hard copy book to influential people & hopefully challenge them to think.  We'll send (or hand 
deliver) them to  Lady Gaga, public libraries, Donald Trump, Ellen Degeneres, Rush Libaugh, Snoop Dog, David Guetta, Oprah,  Michelle & Barack Obama, Oprah, Grahm Norton, Sarah Palin, Hillary Clinton, Bill Clinton, Martha Steward, Queen Elizabeth, The Daily Show, The Colbert Report, & Hugh Hefner to name a few.



Other Ways You Can Help
 Maybe try the " Three for Three" --- If you agree with this idea - or you don't agree
 - LET OTHERS KNOW ABOUT IT!  Tell at least 3 other people 
& ask them to each tell 3 or more people to repeat spreading the word?

Join the "Faces of O" Facebook community and invite all your friends to join as well.

"Like" this page on Facebook and tell all your friends to check it out!



Tweet to all your friends what
you think about this project!



Model for the project! -
Limited spots available, check the social network for upcoming shoot
locations, and dates.  If you'd like a guaranteed spot in the book,
check our perks.
Challenge local celebrities and media personalities to Model for the project! Do you have an opinion you want to share?  Join the social network at discostick.co to share your own stories and experiences, and discuss this with others.

is a trademark of Pfizer, Inc. and is not affiliated with Human
Innovations, LLC

Short Summary

We are launching pre-sales to independently publish a special 2-in-1 disability themed anthology, Companions & Earthbound, edited by Olivia Dreisinger. This 2-in-1 anthology collects writing by ten disability-identified authors about disability, animals, and the environment. A werewolf with PTSD, an environmentally ill AI, and a poisoned island are featured alongside human characters living with brain injury, chronic pain, neurodivergence, and more. By backing this project, you can help support the growing genre of disability fiction!

What We Need & What You Get

Our target is to raise $2000. The budget will go towards covering contributor honorariums, printing costs, artwork by the talented Sasha Zamani, and campaign fees (unfortunately these fundraising platforms take quite a bit of money from you). Contributor perks include eBooks and paperback copies (check out the perks sidebar to learn more)! The anthology is nearly completed and we hope to get the anthology into your hands by early 2021.

About the Editor

Olivia Dreisinger is a chronically ill scholar specializing in all things disability. She is the director of two documentaries: Handler is crazy and disabled! She holds an MA in English Literature from McGill University and is working towards a PhD at the University of British Columbia. 

Alternative Payment Options

PayPal or etransfer (Canada only for the latter) are also completely welcome if credit card is not an accessible option for you. You can send payments to oliviadreisinger@gmail.com and please indicate which perk you are purchasing along with a shipping address (if applicable).

Cover artwork image description: A pencil sketch of two parakeets in a cage.

WISH EDITION OF THE SONNETS BY WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

Edited by Boris Velkov

NEIGHBOURS, GOD SPEED!

My name is Boris Velkov and I am an author from Belgrade, Serbia. I graduated from Philological High School  in Belgrade (German, English and Latin language), and studied at the Faculty of Dramatic Arts in Belgrade (Dramaturgy).                 I have written several dramas in verse for theater and radio. For the past 12 years   I've been translating The Sonnets by William Shakespeare into my native Serbian   language. In 2013 I published a bilingual book of translated Sonnets, and I need your support in order to edit and publish The WISH Edition of the Sonnets (in  English language) to commemorate the 400thanniversary of Shakespeare's death on 23rd April 2016.

WHY THIS “WISH EDITION”?

While translating The Sonnets I took a closer look and measured every word in every sonnet since it was very important to me to carefully select the very genuine meaning of each and every one in order to select a proper word reflecting and constructing the same meaning in my native language (you probably already know that poetry by no means can be translated literally). To do this job properly I compared the Early Modern English original (Quarto edition, printed in  1609) to the Modern English version of The Sonnets which is a transcription of Early Modern English original and can be found in all current editions of Shakespeare's Sonnets. By doing this I've noticed some, probably unintentional, transcription mistakes in Modern English version which give completely different and non-genuine meanings to a  particular sonnet and to The Sonnets as a whole (you can find some  examples in the gallery). Speaking of The Sonnets as a whole, I've also noticed, having full insight of their inner and outer structure that they form two more poems which I have named A POEM IN THE SONNETS and A POEM OUT OF THE SONNETS, and they will be printed in this WISH Edition for the very first time. Plus, I discovered the 0th Sonnet by William Shakespeare, which can be a certain key for the other 154, and that's the one more exclusive feature of this WISH edition of The Sonnets.

BOOK CONTAINS:

  • DEDICATION PAGE (WISH Edition dedicated to THE ONLIE BEGETTER perk claimer. See picture gallery.)
  • EDITOR'S WORD
  • 0. SONNET BY WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE (WISH Edition exclusively.)
  • 154 SONNETS BY WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE (WISH Edition exclusively: Correction of some unintentional transcription mistakes noticed in all the otherModern English Editions of The Sonnets. See examples in the picture gallery.)
  • A POEM IN THE SONNETS (WISH Edition exclusively.)
  • A POEM OUT OF THE SONNETS (WISH Edition exclusively.)
  • 1O FULL COLOURED COMMERCIALS PAGES (e-book, paperback & hardcover only; NOT included in leather cover copies.)
  • LIBER AMICORUM: LIST OF PLATINUM, DIAMOND, GOLD, SILVER & BRONZE SPONSORS; LIST OF ENTERPRENEURS & DONORS (e-book, paperback & hardcover only; NOT included in leather cover copies.)
  • INDEX OF FIRST-LINES

EDITOR'S WORD

“For several centuries to many careerists The Sonnets were exactly the same thing as Egyptian pyramids are to those romanticized adventurers that are pictured in popular culture media. The tomb robbers even in this case are not much different; those least successful will express doubt that Shakespeare's authorship is just a myth and rumour, and that another, much more notable writer in Elizabethan England, wrote instead of the Poet; those mediocre, who call themselves Shakespeareologists,will have "reasonable suspicion" and talk about Shakespeare as the author who is really remarkably valuable (because their title cannot be something worthless), but would argue that he could never create great works without the unanimous support of the whole "theatrical community "; the most unscrupulous would say that Shakespeare is the man of wicked nature, and that (asif dishonour can be defended  in codes) he had  concealed himself  in front of a court of  religious fanatics by  writing in "misty language".  Which of these  to believe? "No, I am that I am" Shakespeare would say in one  of his sonnets,  and perhaps the true identity of the Poet is discovered exactly in them - The Sonnets. This book (WISH Edition)  can be read by everyone, but is highly recommended not to expect everything.”

Boris Velkov

I DO COMMEND ME TO YOU

Dear friends, let's together pay homage to our beloved ever-living Poet so the world could say that we are those ”Whose speechless song being many, seeming one, /Sings this to thee: 'Thou single wilt prove none.”.

UPDATE:

Thank you! We have officially met our funding goals. Wow! We're so grateful that you've helped us get to this point! With your continued support, we can exceed our goals and use the additional funds to publish a novel by a female writer in 2017.  

Help us keep going full steam ahead towards publishing even more writing about strong women – please spread the word and share our campaign!


About Spider Road Press

Who we are:

We are an indie publishing company with a mission. Founded in 2013, we're based in Houston, Texas, but we publish writers from all over the world. Here's what we're all about:

  • Publishing and promoting literature by and about strong women. (You don't have to be a female writer, but we do specialize in strong female characters.)
  • Publishing fiction about women from diverse backgrounds. (The world needs diverse books). 
  • Connecting talented, emerging writers with contests and opportunities to publish their work.
  • 5% for healing: we donate 5% of the proceeds from our book sales to women's shelters and veteran's groups.
What we're creating:
  • In 2016, we are publishing Approaching Footsteps: Four Novellas by Women, a compendium of four smart, suspenseful novellas. We hope to employ top-notch designers and consultants to make this our best collection yet. We hope that, through distribution, marketing and library donations, we can share this excellent fiction about complex women with many new readers.  
  • The Spider's Web Flash Fiction Prize recognizes excellence in flash fiction with a female protagonist by awarding cash prizes, trophies and publication to the top three entries. For the 2016 contest, we are hiring two skilled short fiction writers as judges, and increasing publicity so that even more writers can get involved. We strive to expand and improve the contest, while still keeping entry fees low, so that many women and men can enter their unique flash fiction.    

We'd love your help with this, and we've got some special rewards for you in return!


What You Receive 



We value every donation, no matter how small – and we have a range of thank-you gifts waiting for you:

  • Eve's Requiem, Spider Road Press's 2014 book of chilling fiction - perfect for Halloween.
  • Mix-and-match sets of Spider Road Press books, in print or digital format.
  • An exclusive copy of In the Questions, a collection of poetry by women only available through our IndieGogo campaign. Enjoy poems by established poets such as Shae Savoy, Catherine Edmunds, Andrea Barbosa & Teresa Mei Chuc, as well as emerging poets such as Karen Marinaccio, Eileen Brunetto, Melissa Algood and Gay Yellen.    
  • A steel Spider Road Press travel mug - proudly display your support of independent publishing.
  • A striking art poster of a Virginia Woolfe quotation by the artists at ObliviousState.
  • A bundle of beloved books by famous female short story writers, such as Alice Munro and Flannery O'Connor.
  • A custom art commission by Genevieve Smith, an artist featured in our exclusive poetry collection In the Questions.
  • Short Story Editing by editor-in-chief Patricia Flaherty Pagan.
  • Literary-themed dining at unique Houston bistros. 


An example art commission by Genevieve Smith, an artist featured in our exclusive poetry book, "In the Questions". (Available as part of an $100 perk alongside other great rewards.)

The striking print by the artists at ObviousState. (Available as part of an $100 perk alongside other great rewards.)

What We Need 
Here's exactly where your help will be going.
  • $1,000 – Production, consulting, distribution and marketing costs for our exciting 2016 collection, Approaching Footsteps. We hope to increase distribution to get this collection into more bookstores. We also strive to pay our writers and consultants - mostly female - a living wage for their creative work, and raising this amount will help us more meaningfully recognize their contributions. This number represents these two goals for this project.
  • $250 – Funding the prizes, judges' stipends, consultant work and marketing of the 2016 Spider's Web Flash Fiction Prize. We strive to keep entry fees below $15, and this amount of money raised will help us to do so.
  • $350 – Web design to support Spider Road Press's needs and increase our interaction with readers.
  • $150 - Increase staff hours in 2016 to streamline communication with our writers and artists.
  • Exceeding our goal: If we are able to raise over $2500, we will publish a novel with a strong female protagonist in 2017!



Our Impact

The world is full of complex, diverse women, so books and ebooks should be full of them, too. It's time that women saw the joy, pain and complexity of their lives reflected on more pages. At Spider Road Press, we are honored to publish and promote both established and emerging writers who bring she-roes to life. Through our anthologies, we are  able to offer readers a glimpse into many perspectives. Through our contest, we celebrate precise stories about multifaceted women. In all of our projects, we make an effort to take a chance on new writers with unique voices.  

Through our 5% for healing program, we put our values into action by donating to vital organizations such as The Houston Area Women's Center and Disabled American Veterans. 

Our Challenges

Indie publishing is a labor of love. We love bringing new fiction to our readers! To keep doing this, and keep working with a great team of creative folks, we need additional resources. We want our books to be the best they can be, and pay our writers what they deserve. As a mission-oriented, small publisher in an exciting, but very crowded marketplace, we need to keep growing so that readers will find our books and writers. Do our sales cover all of our needs? Not yet. Publishing our books & ebooks is just the beginning. We need to invest more in marketing and distribution to take Spider Road Press to the next level. 

And what about our contest? Isn't is self-supporting? Last year, entry fees that we received only covered the three prizes. In 2016, we've hired experienced judges and want to publicize the contest widely. Yet we've vowed to keep to entry fees below $25. 

In the meantime, we are determined to stay and alive and to continue giving 5% of our proceeds to charity. That's where you could help.   


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but still want to help, here are some other ways you can do that!

  • Share this campaign! Get the word out and make some noise - you never know whose interest might be piqued.
  • Like us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, and take a spin around our website.
  • And finally – if you know a talented writer who wants to be published, let them know about Spider Road Press and our calls for submissions. Who knows? They might be writing about the complex, diverse female characters that we love. They could become the next member of the Spider Road Press family of writers. 



Why are we "Spider Road?"

The weekend that Patricia Flaherty Pagan decided to found our small press, she was visiting Big Bend National Park with her husband. She was impressed by the tarantulas that she saw crossing the roads there. In the face of speeding cars and large obstacles, the spiders were bold and tenacious. Their fearless attitude is what we try to bring to all that we do at Spider Road Press.   

Thank you for learning about us and our work. Happy reading and writing!

UPDATE:

Thank you! We have officially met our funding goals. Wow! We're so grateful that you've helped us get to this point! With your continued support, we can exceed our goals and use the additional funds to publish a novel by a female writer in 2017.  
Help us keep going full steam ahead towards publishing even more writing about strong women – please spread the word and share our campaign!

About Spider Road Press
Who we are: We are an indie publishing company with a mission. Founded in 2013, we're based in Houston, Texas, but we publish writers from all over the world. Here's what we're all about:


Publishing and promoting literature by and about strong women. (You don't have to be a female writer, but we do specialize in strong female characters.)
Publishing fiction about women from diverse backgrounds. (The world needs diverse books). 
Connecting talented, emerging writers with contests and opportunities to publish their work.
5% for healing: we donate 5% of the proceeds from our book sales to women's shelters and veteran's groups.

What we're creating:


In 2016, we are publishing Approaching Footsteps: Four Novellas by Women, a compendium of four smart, suspenseful novellas. We hope to employ top-notch designers and consultants to make this our best collection yet. We hope that, through distribution, marketing and library donations, we can share this excellent fiction about complex women with many new readers.  

The Spider's Web Flash Fiction Prize recognizes excellence in flash fiction with a female protagonist by awarding cash prizes, trophies and publication to the top three entries. For the 2016 contest, we are hiring two skilled short fiction writers as judges, and increasing publicity so that even more writers can get involved. We strive to expand and improve the contest, while still keeping entry fees low, so that many women and men can enter their unique flash fiction.    
 We'd love your help with this, and we've got some special rewards for you in return!


What You Receive 
   



We value every donation, no matter how small – and we have a range of thank-you gifts waiting for you:
  
Eve's Requiem, Spider Road Press's 2014 book of chilling fiction - perfect for Halloween.

Mix-and-match sets of Spider Road Press books, in print or digital format.
An exclusive copy of In the Questions, a collection of poetry by women only available through our IndieGogo campaign. Enjoy poems by established poets such as Shae Savoy, Catherine Edmunds, Andrea Barbosa & Teresa Mei Chuc, as well as emerging poets such as Karen Marinaccio, Eileen Brunetto, Melissa Algood and Gay Yellen.    
A steel Spider Road Press travel mug - proudly display your support of independent publishing.
A striking art poster of a Virginia Woolfe quotation by the artists at ObliviousState.
A bundle of beloved books by famous female short story writers, such as Alice Munro and Flannery O'Connor.
A custom art commission by Genevieve Smith, an artist featured in our exclusive poetry collection In the Questions.


Short Story Editing by editor-in-chief Patricia Flaherty Pagan.
Literary-themed dining at unique Houston bistros. 





An example art commission by Genevieve Smith, an artist featured in our exclusive poetry book, "In the Questions". (Available as part of an $100 perk alongside other great rewards.)


The striking print by the artists at ObviousState. (Available as part of an $100 perk alongside other great rewards.)

What We Need 

Here's exactly where your help will be going.


$1,000 – Production, consulting, distribution and marketing costs for our exciting 2016 collection, Approaching Footsteps. We hope to increase distribution to get this collection into more bookstores. We also strive to pay our writers and consultants - mostly female - a living wage for their creative work, and raising this amount will help us more meaningfully recognize their contributions. This number represents these two goals for this project.

$250 – Funding the prizes, judges' stipends, consultant work and marketing of the 2016 Spider's Web Flash Fiction Prize. We strive to keep entry fees below $15, and this amount of money raised will help us to do so.

$350 – Web design to support Spider Road Press's needs and increase our interaction with readers.

$150 - Increase staff hours in 2016 to streamline communication with our writers and artists.

Exceeding our goal: If we are able to raise over $2500, we will publish a novel with a strong female protagonist in 2017!







Our Impact The world is full of complex, diverse women, so books and ebooks should be full of them, too. It's time that women saw the joy, pain and complexity of their lives reflected on more pages. At Spider Road Press, we are honored to publish and promote both established and emerging writers who bring she-roes to life. Through our anthologies, we are  able to offer readers a glimpse into many perspectives. Through our contest, we celebrate precise stories about multifaceted women. In all of our projects, we make an effort to take a chance on new writers with unique voices.  
Through our 5% for healing program, we put our values into action by donating to vital organizations such as The Houston Area Women's Center and Disabled American Veterans. 
Our Challenges
Indie publishing is a labor of love. We love bringing new fiction to our readers! To keep doing this, and keep working with a great team of creative folks, we need additional resources. We want our books to be the best they can be, and pay our writers what they deserve. As a mission-oriented, small publisher in an exciting, but very crowded marketplace, we need to keep growing so that readers will find our books and writers. Do our sales cover all of our needs? Not yet. Publishing our books & ebooks is just the beginning. We need to invest more in marketing and distribution to take Spider Road Press to the next level. 
And what about our contest? Isn't is self-supporting? Last year, entry fees that we received only covered the three prizes. In 2016, we've hired experienced judges and want to publicize the contest widely. Yet we've vowed to keep to entry fees below $25. 
In the meantime, we are determined to stay and alive and to continue giving 5% of our proceeds to charity. That's where you could help.   
 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, but still want to help, here are some other ways you can do that!  Share this campaign! Get the word out and make some noise - you never know whose interest might be piqued. Like us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, and take a spin around our website.
And finally – if you know a talented writer who wants to be published, let them know about Spider Road Press and our calls for submissions. Who knows? They might be writing about the complex, diverse female characters that we love. They could become the next member of the Spider Road Press family of writers. 









Why are we "Spider Road?"
The weekend that Patricia Flaherty Pagan decided to found our small press, she was visiting Big Bend National Park with her husband. She was impressed by the tarantulas that she saw crossing the roads there. In the face of speeding cars and large obstacles, the spiders were bold and tenacious. Their fearless attitude is what we try to bring to all that we do at Spider Road Press.   
Thank you for learning about us and our work. Happy reading and writing!

The Murder of Time: Making and Unmasking a Sleeper - Part 2

UPDATE January 2016: eBook is for sale at http://lulu.com/spotlight/matthewpauly

From the Sirhan Sirhan (RFK’s killer) event, Mark David Chapman (John Lennon’s killer) to the more recent MKULTRA Sleeper Patsy James Homes (Aurora, CO theatre shooting) event, many have suspected mind-control being employed for “plausibly deniable” government agency assassinations, and “false flag” terror events.  These clandestine operations mislead, and terrorize the public to serve the interests of an elite group within the security-political establishment.

To execute these covert crimes, mind-control R & D is needed.  In 1940 the OSS (CIA precursor), and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) started a joint-project to develop “better assassins.” This announcement was published in The Ottawa Citizen in 1940.  Canada provides the Guinea Pig subjects for US military/CIA experiments to refine mind-control, with RCMP assistance.  Matthew Pauly has been a non-consensual MKULTRA Sleeper Assassin test subject (and non-consenting fatal weapons tester) since Nov 2005 when he was coerced into a Canadian Military 5-ton, armored van (plate 250002) and used as the subject for a joint-training exercise between the US JTF, and Canadian JTF2, with RCMP support. 

There have been nearly a dozen torturous events Matthew has been subject of, including being forced to assassinate after being sworn as an enemy of the US, abducted onto US soil, high-dosed with Scopolamine (#1 mind control drug), tortured until dissociated, hypnotized, and finally coerced at gunpoint.  

Matthew finally shook off his US Consulate based, JTF handler in July, 2015 by publicly (on Facebook) calling in the Israeli Institute for Special Operations and Intelligence after “Mitch” had asked all about his Jewish friends, including their occupations, addresses, and names during his intended last contact during a May, 2015 home invasion, before an intended fatal weapons test on June 4, 2015 in Toronto.  Mitch had previously reported being tortured, and mind-controlled by his Nazi grandfather since he was five. His grandfather he reported was a mind-control scientist brought to American in the CIA’s ‘Project Paperclip’ in 1945.

Through one tradecraft error by Mitch on June 4, 2015 Matthew detected danger and survived his second fatal weapons test.  It remains to be seen if Matthew survives the Israeli Institute for Special Operations and Intelligence reaction to his very public whistleblowing to the government of Israel, several Israeli newspapers, and their American and Canadian counterparts. 

He had whistle blown of the Israeli Institute for Special Operations and Intelligence’s death threat delivered in person July 14, 2015 at his house regarding a faked, hate, snuff film that Mitch (JTF) produced for the very purpose of leaking it to this agency to trick them into murdering Matthew, his test-subject become whistleblower.  Since Matthew had amnesia due to torture-dissociation, they wished him to first remember the faked, hate, snuff film before they came back and murdered him; the film was well done and does not look fake

The Israeli Institute for Special Operations and Intelligence forcibly injected him with a radio nuclei on Aug 3, 2015. This "smart assassination" murder technique results in a 'plausibly deniable' death due to multiple-organ Cancer that starts about one year after the injection(s).

For ten years Matthew has been writing a book manuscript detailing his non-consensual involvement in this program.  He recently teamed up with a fellow MKULTRA survivor Ann Diamond who wrote several books about her surviving childhood experiments by Dr. Ewen Cameron at the Allan Memorial Institute in Montreal, a CIA funded MKULTRA operation.  All that remains is minor effort to revise and edit the manuscript.  This proposal is to seek the funding to complete the book, and especially to provide for extra security.

Matthew has been a computer programmer for twenty-five years, but has been unable to work for the past 2.5 years due to significant PTSD illness from the many violent events at the hands of Mitch the US JTF officer.  Please see Matthew’s recent interview with Sean Stone on “The Buzzsaw”, see above link.
 
If you wish a far more detailed account about the book, please see the prior fundraiser The Murder of Time: Making and Unmasking a Sleeper

Protecting Your Privacy

Indiegogo will not share your name with me, or anyone if you do the following:

- On panel 1 of the 3 simple donation panels, checkmark the box labelled 'Hide my name on the campaign page'

- On panel 3, select the option 'Credited to another name:' and enter Anonymous in the text box, or whatever you prefer

If you wish to select a Perk, then do not do the above.

The site uses HTTPS (S=Secure Sockets Layer), and as a computer professional I assure you that its adequately secure.  Indiegogo is a professional online business that adequately secures their crowdsourcing site as it is the mission-critical core of their business.

If you want STRONG PRIVACY, then use the TOR browser so your traffic to Indiegogo donation pages is routed through the TOR network encrypted so your donation will be untraceable. If you strongly suspect you have a wiretap on your Internet connection, then since TOR's last hop to your TOR browser is not encrypted, you will need another solution.  

In this case, either a) use a public Wi-Fi (somewhat risky,) or b) simply a friend's Internet connection, or c) a wired computer in your public library to make a donation while ensuring your privacy.  Your donation will make a big difference. Please do not let your fear get the best of you.  We have not let our fear stop us.  The government is counting on people being too afraid to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this crowdsource campaign with others.  Please like my postings at the Facebook profile http://facebook.com/matthew.pauley99   Please buy the book when it comes out.  Please check back on this page as I will add a link to an online petition to demand a halt to non-consensual human experimentation.  

Here is a powerful three-minute video that is guaranteed to touch and move you.

story:
Now available!

 

Hi, my name is Trina. 

I have studied, researched, presented, and created a podcast on the science of happiness. I also happen to be a digital artist.

I transform the science of happiness into usable art that can brighten your day. 

 

How happy are you right now? 

Maybe you just feel like you are trying to juggle work and various responsibilities, or perhaps you are already trying to live your best life. Regardless, there is always room to be happier.

Thousands of researchers are figuring out what makes you happier. However, this information is buried in dry-as-a-saltine-cracker, peer-reviewed papers. How can I turn this information into something juicy and delicious for your busy day? How can I add a little positivity to your life?

My answer is A Happier Year.

 

A Happier Year is a daily flip calendar filled with 366 days of science-based action. 

I transform positive psychology into something usable. Each day for an entire year, you get a beautiful piece of art with a small, doable action.

 

 

A Happier Year transforms research papers into small, doable actions that may make you a little happier. I want to be transparent about where these ideas come from. Science is about sharing knowledge, so I have the list of references publicly available to everyone. If you want to nerd out, you can read the corresponding peer-reviewed paper that each activity is based on.

Some of these studies had small sample sizes or tiny effect sizes, this is why I'm not promising miracles. In fact, even the best research out there still has limitations. I don't think anyone can promise miracles and monumental changes. However, many small steps in the right direction can eventually add up. I want to give you tools for thriving.

 

 

I give you a small and easy action each day of the year because you are more likely to stick to small changes. You get real action with detailed instructions.

I’ve broken up a few of the more challenging and time-consuming activities into multiple steps that I guide you through over the course of a week or so.

 

 

You get a space to complete the activities on most days. Writing down just a few words will help keep you accountable and on track. Many of the activities only take a few minutes to complete.  

Actionable activities aimed at adding a little happiness to your life take some work. 

You don’t get a vague or cliché quote. This isn’t just fluffy motivational stuff telling you to, “live, laugh, love,” your way to happiness. Many activities are going to take some effort. If happiness was effortless, you could just watch movies for the rest of your life. Real happiness involves work.

 

 

This isn’t just a book that sits on your shelf, creates a change for a week, and then life goes back to normal. I know life is busy, and your time is valuable. I want to help foster action in your life in a sustainable way.

 

 

Why should art be reserved for museums, your walls, and picture books? Not only is A Happier Year full of knowledge, but it is also a piece of art for your home or office. My goal was to present the science of happiness and activities in a fun way so you consistently complete the activities in A Happier Year. This tabletop calendar will add a pop of colour to any space.

 

 

 I’ve only included the month and date, so you can start using the calendar any day of any year. I've designed the activities so that you don't have to wait for the new year. If you start mid-February, you have activities for the next year until the following February.

There are a few weeks that have activities that build on the previous day or two. If the calendar lands in your hands during one of those weeks, you can do that series of activities in one day.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

My name is Trina. I received my B.A., Honours in Psychology at UBC Okanagan in B.C., Canada in 2017. My undergraduate research and thesis were about positive psychology.

Since graduation, I have travelled to over 30 countries, started rock climbing and sent my first 5.12, snowboarded down some powdery black diamonds, and more. In 2018, I started my podcast, Happycast: The Science of Happiness. Now, I created A Happier Year.

A Happier Year was born out of my passion for the science of happiness, and my passion for visual arts. I’ve always been an artist at heart, and have years of digital art and graphic design under my belt. It was a rewarding process to illustrate and design the entire calendar on my own.

 

I started reading papers on the science of happiness in university and haven't stopped since. My favourite journals can be found here and here.  

 

I digitally illustrated and designed all of the pages myself. Not only do I have a passion for science, but I also have a passion for art. I wanted to give you the full-meal-deal. Usable science and a piece of art for your desk.  

 

Details, like the water colours that appear in the background on many pages, were hand-painted. 

 

Below, you can see the digitized result of the hand-painted watercolours. 

 

 

 

Each calendar will be printed in full colour on an offset press. The page dimensions will be 4 inches x 5 inches. The calendar is dated January 1 to December 31, with a separate page for each day.

This is an evergreen calendar. I have only included the month and day, so you can start using this calendar any day of any year.

story:
The Tao of Bob

I'm Spike Gillespie, writer, teacher, secular officiant. In 2015 through a series of remarkable and rather unbelievable events, I came into possession of a little ranch just east of Austin, the city where I'd lived for 24 years. The ranch was rundown, rumored to have been a meth lab, and featured an informal junkyard. Through incredible support from investors, friends, and strangers, I gutted and remodeled the house and barn and purchased a 250 square-foot tiny chapel. This never finished project, known as the Tiny T Ranch, is now home to weddings, memorial services, gatherings for grieving parents, workshops, classes, and retreats. It is also Home to Bob.

Bob came on my radar in late 2016. His daughter, Ellen, is a great friend of mine. When her mom/Bob's wife died that summer, Bob-- who'd spent nearly nine decades as a Midwest farmer-- decided it was time for a change. He wanted to winter closer to Ellen in Austin, but he hoped for a rural setting, not being a big fan of cities. When I heard his desire, I invited him to come stay with me. Aside from having my son, this was THE BEST CHOICE I EVER MADE.

It didn't take long for us to realize how much we love each other. One day when I was reminding Bob this was his home, that he wasn't a visitor, he admitted he really would like to live out his days here. And so it came to pass. He flew to Indiana in the spring of 2017 and, with the help of one of his sons, he drove the rest of his stuff down. We are officially in it for life.

It's time for me to tell the story of Bob and our life at the ranch. This is more than a real-life buddy film unfolding on a daily basis. As many of you know from my previous books, I have struggled with PTSD, anxiety, and depression much of my life, ailments that are directly related to having been raised by a mentally ill father. I have dedicated much of my adult life to seeking help to heal from the extensive fallout of this trauma. Meditation, therapy, friends, exercise, writing-- all of this has helped. But nothing has helped more than having Bob around. He is my new father, a gentle man who reassures and loves me daily, who has helped me through heartbreak, lawnmower crises, frozen pipes, and the aggravation of the occasional shitty client. Bob understands the long view and patiently reminds me about impermanence and looking forward instead of back. He is a Living Buddha.

It's also the story of jumping in and making space for radical change. Sometimes Bob and I sit around just laughing about our circumstances. Did I ever think I'd be living with an old farmer from Indiana? Hell No. Did he ever imagine living with a tattooed aging punk rocker who hosts same-sex marriages, Vampire LARP parties, and has a penchant for adopting rescue dogs and horses? Again: Hell No. Other times we talk about the extreme stress both of us were under not long before we met. Each of us spent much of 2016 caring for gravely ill partners and feeling nearly broken in the process. We're helping each other heal from that stress, too, including encouraging each other to eat-- between us we unintentionally lost 75 pounds thanks to our respective ordeals. These days we eat tomato sandwiches the way our horses eat grass.

As with my last two books, the plan is to self-publish this one. Your contribution will help me buy the necessary time to carve out the space I need to dedicate myself to writing. Those of you who know me know I am a workhorse, which is a good thing considering the constant and never ending demands of running Tiny T. The funds I am seeking will serve as a sort of book advance so that I can step away from some of my off-ranch work for a couple of months and dedicate myself to this project. 

I'm aiming for a $7,000 goal, some of which will afford me writing time and the balance of which will cover printing costs. Perks include a chance to pre-purchase the book, some badass merch, and Lunch With Bob.

As with many of my past books, this one will be a hybrid: part memoir and part self-help. I want to share the story of Bob so you can feel the love, too. Hopefully you'll also be inspired if you, too, are struggling with the ongoing challenges of mental illness.

I have a good track record with these projects. This will be my third self-published book and I am very familiar with what it takes to go from writing the first word to mailing off finished books. I'm a professional writer with eight previous titles published. In 2016 I was voted Best Nonfiction/Memoirist Writer in Austin in the Austin Chronicle's Annual Best Of Austin Issue (an award I also received in 2006).

Risks and challenges are minimal, but they exist. Typically I write pretty fast given that my other work is demanding so I don't have time to sit in a field by a pond and dreamily contemplate the process. That said, this time around I am giving myself eight months to complete this project-- luxuriously long by my standards. So it's not really a risk, just a note that if you do contribute, books won't be delivered until 2018. There is also a very slim chance that I might choose to shop this one to some big houses. While I have been published in the past by Simon & Schuster, The University of Texas Press, and Seal Press, honestly self-publishing best suits my punk rock DIY style. However should I decide to send it out to a few agents, and should someone show interest, there is the possibility that publication might take a little longer since traditional houses are notoriously slow to get books out there.

I know not everyone will be in the position to help financially. Every time I ask for help I feel a little reluctant because I know there are so many people and organizations also seeking help, that a lot of these folks have truly desperate needs, and that also, in these trying times you might be more inclined to spend your money on non-profits or, you know, food and electricity. Even if you can't help with a financial contribution, I would be so grateful if you'd help me spread the word. 

Thank you so much.

Fucking Namaste,
Spike

The Tao of Bob
I'm Spike Gillespie, writer, teacher, secular officiant. In 2015 through a series of remarkable and rather unbelievable events, I came into possession of a little ranch just east of Austin, the city where I'd lived for 24 years. The ranch was rundown, rumored to have been a meth lab, and featured an informal junkyard. Through incredible support from investors, friends, and strangers, I gutted and remodeled the house and barn and purchased a 250 square-foot tiny chapel. This never finished project, known as the Tiny T Ranch, is now home to weddings, memorial services, gatherings for grieving parents, workshops, classes, and retreats. It is also Home to Bob.
Bob came on my radar in late 2016. His daughter, Ellen, is a great friend of mine. When her mom/Bob's wife died that summer, Bob-- who'd spent nearly nine decades as a Midwest farmer-- decided it was time for a change. He wanted to winter closer to Ellen in Austin, but he hoped for a rural setting, not being a big fan of cities. When I heard his desire, I invited him to come stay with me. Aside from having my son, this was THE BEST CHOICE I EVER MADE.
It didn't take long for us to realize how much we love each other. One day when I was reminding Bob this was his home, that he wasn't a visitor, he admitted he really would like to live out his days here. And so it came to pass. He flew to Indiana in the spring of 2017 and, with the help of one of his sons, he drove the rest of his stuff down. We are officially in it for life.
It's time for me to tell the story of Bob and our life at the ranch. This is more than a real-life buddy film unfolding on a daily basis. As many of you know from my previous books, I have struggled with PTSD, anxiety, and depression much of my life, ailments that are directly related to having been raised by a mentally ill father. I have dedicated much of my adult life to seeking help to heal from the extensive fallout of this trauma. Meditation, therapy, friends, exercise, writing-- all of this has helped. But nothing has helped more than having Bob around. He is my new father, a gentle man who reassures and loves me daily, who has helped me through heartbreak, lawnmower crises, frozen pipes, and the aggravation of the occasional shitty client. Bob understands the long view and patiently reminds me about impermanence and looking forward instead of back. He is a Living Buddha.

story:
Who are you, and what is this book about?
I'm Jeremy Kroeker. I've written two books, includingThrough Dust and Darkness, and the Canadian bestseller Motorcycle Therapy. 

My third book, Motorcycle Messengers,  is a bit different.

Motorcycle Messengers: tales from the road by writers who ride, is a collection of travel stories from some of the leading writers in the genre ... plus a few people you've never heard of. Consider it a sample pack of authors. Many of the stories in the book are original compositions, but some are adapted selections or extracts from books that already exist. 

In Motorcycle Messengers, you'll find stories, or extracts by:
Lois Pryce
Sam Manicom
Carla King
Paddy Tyson
Geoff Hill
Neil Peart
Ted Simon
Ted Bishop
Mark Richardson
Christopher P. Baker
Jeremy Kroeker
and others ... 

Why do you need my help? 

To do this properly, I'll need to print at least 3,000 copies. That way, I can keep the per unit cost down, and make sure that the book is widely distributed. But, more importantly, I need to pay these writers. 

The contributors to this anthology have given of their time and their talent for just a pittance. They each earn only $200 (Canadian) per story. If I offered them any less, they would splash me with used engine oil. And so, if I should exceed my goal, one of the first things I'll do with the extra money is pay the writers a bonus. They deserve it!

In addition to a large-ish print run, and paying the writers, I need money for graphic design, and copy editing. Roughly, that all adds up to $6,000 (Canadian). 

And, if I do not reach my goal, this book will go on anyway ... I'll just print fewer copies and I'll be really sad. 

What do I get out of this?

You'll be the very first to have a copy of Motorcycle Messengers, of course! The book is scheduled for wide release in the Spring of 2016, but I'll mail you a copy hot off the press. You'll have it months earlier.

There are other perks on offer, as well. You can have your name listed in the back of the book with a note of thanks from Oscillator Press. For a bit more, you can list your company name. This book will be read by thousands of motorcycle enthusiasts ... your target market, yes? Let them know that your company or brand stands behind them. 

If I can't afford to contribute, is there something else I can do to help?

Yes! Please share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook, or simple word of mouth. Every bit helps.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings!  I'm Chris and it's my job to tell you about the It's the "Write" Time campaign.  I recently lost my father who was only 61.  A notion that I have struggled with came to the forefront during this trying time.  

I am not doing the work that I feel called to do.  In essence I feel called to evangelize, but not in the traditional way people think about.  I am not an extrovert and although I have faith in the Holy Spirit I am rarely able to let the flames of my faith burn brightly when there's a large number of people.  God seems to be directing me away from teaching so what am I supposed to do?  What risk do I need to take to work for the greater glory of God before my life on earth ends?  Life can be very short and even if I make it to 100 years old I'm willing to bet that I will still think it was too short.  I need to do something now or I may never do it.  That's why now is The "Write" Time!  I have a talent for writing that can be developed even more.  I have a wild imagination and strongly believe that I can promote a faith in Jesus through fictional works that subtly weave a message of faith into the story line.  They won't be "Christian" books, but mainstream genre books that show faith in a positive light.  That's the short story, now here are more details about the campaign my team has developed to help make this a real story of evangelization instead of just a pipe dream.

                                                         


What We Need & What You Get

Chris needs time.  The old adage that 'time is money' is very accurate here.  The immediate goal of the "It's the Write Time" team is to raise $6,000 to cover his salary and the cost of perks & fees for two months.  If we meet the goal early in the campaign there will be additional perks to raise more money to get to three months.

What happens if we don't make the $6,000?  As long as we reach $2,000 Chris will take two weeks to do as much work on a book as possible.  The perks will still be awarded, however, those related to the completion of the project may take much longer.

You get some awesome perks that are listed on the sidebar of this page.  You'll also get satisfaction knowing that you helped someone evangelize others one reader at a time.

                                                                                                              

The Impact

A successful campaign will have Chris writing full time beginning July 1st and going through the end of August.  That will be at least 40 hours a week of writing, researching and brainstorming with probably a little bit of writer's block thrown in there.  A complete novel may not get accomplished in those 352 hours, but it will be an excellent start.  

                                                

Many factions of the world as well as a majority of the media seem to think it is fair to pick on Christians and particularly Catholics.  The books that Chris writes will subtly present a proper view of Christianity and throw in a little bit of teaching on Catholic beliefs.  People may be surprised that they learn truths in a mainstream novel that are very different from what they were led to believe.  With the grace of God readers may choose to explore their faith (or be called to it) through this subtle method.  At the very least, we hope people will be less inclined to believe outright falsehoods just because they hear something on the news or read it on the internet.

                                  

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of risks to you as a donor and to this team.  What if the book that is written is just terrible?  How can the author just leave his regular work to write, what will he do for an income after two months?  What if the book doesn't get done in two months?

It can be assured that the book won't be terrible.  Everybody has different opinions on reading material and some people might think it's not very good, but certainly any honest critic won't say it's terrible.  There's always a risk that a story may not appeal to a large group.  In that case, we'll learn from our experience, get better feedback from our audience and keep slowly working at it.  That's a great benefit to the "It's the 'Write' Time" campaign!  We're starting a community of followers interested in this work and able to give their input.  The hope is that the evangelization campaign will go on much longer after this financial campaign comes to an end.

Chris, the author, is currently in a unique position to be able to take time away from work.  His main position at a parish may not be available after he is gone for some months, but it's possible he could still get some hours.  Chris also delivers mail on Saturdays and will continue to do so during the writing process.  Afterwards, he can pick up extra hours at the post office.  Ultimately, the desire would be to work part-time so the writing can continue.  Writing as a profitable career is a long-term commitment for most authors.  Chris' wife, Jessie, who also serves as the Supreme Commander on the "It's the Write Time" campaign has a wonderful job helping local schools with their Career Technical Education programs.  It doesn't come with a great salary, but it does have great benefits so health insurance is not a concern for our family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray!  That's the greatest way to help.  Pray for the success of the financial campaign, the success of the writing efforts, the success of lighting the fire of faith in readers, and pray for the patience, motivation and determination of the "It's the 'Write' time team to keep this work going through completion and beyond!

story:
Hi, my name is Amanda Katherine Loy.

December of 2018, I had a preventative double mastectomy (aka I amputated my breasts) to prevent breast cancer. I have the BRCA 1 gene mutation, which raises my risk of developing breast cancer over my lifetime to up to 85%.

When I was going through the process of navigating surgery/genetic counseling etc, I felt SO alone. There are no resources for twenty something year olds navigating a genetic predisposition like this (or, for that matter, navigating breast cancer). And I made it my mission to CHANGE THAT.

And thus, I Chopped Off My Tits, my upcoming book was born. What started as me sharing the nitty gritty details of my story turned into a movement and, really, a book that not just womxn with my story can relate to, but anyone who has ever faced a traumatic event in their lifetime. It’s funny, it’s candid AF, it’s incredibly transparent and I’m so excited to birth this baby into the universe this December. 

 

You might be wondering how you can help?

The writing part of a book, well, other than the hours of my unpaid time as I’m self publishing this bad boy, is free. And truthfully, I would write this again in a heartbeat for NOTHING just to get this out to the masses. 

That being said, there are a LOT of costs that are about to come straight out of my pocket:

  • The photo shoot expenses for my book cover — to fund the space, the photographer, the design elements, hair/makeup — that alone is over $1500 all in. 
  • Not to mention, the design work for the cover, getting the book printed, to fund my book launch party in Chicago (and possibly other cities), my time promoting the book as we go into launch season and promote on podcasts, tv shows, travel etc. It alll adds up! 

 

Your Impact

Your contribution to birthing this book into the world would help me not just cover the expenses of this massive project, but make a HUGE impact for spreading the awareness for BRCA and breast cancer in young women to the masses. 

And any remaining funds that don’t go directly into the book will go STRAIGHT to Metavivor — a non profit who’s mission is to fund research for a cure for metastatic breast cancer, the only breast cancer that kills (that 1/3 women who ever get diagnosed with breast cancer will face in their lifetime) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to financially contribute? Share this link to your socials! Help me get the word out about this book. Get on the list for as soon as it goes live on Amazon — www.amandakatherineloy.com/book 

EVERY VOICE COUNTS. We’re in this together and I’m SO grateful for you taking the time to support this cause and my book baby.

story:
Story of My Book

The Weight You Carry - The Weight You Carry takes readers along on my 125-pound weight-loss journey and transformation into a new-found identity.

I am Tanner Jay, and I wrote The Weight You Carry, because I believe my story will help others with similar issues. I hope to better explain weight loss and the highs and lows of my journey.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance of having an identity in something other than the approval of others. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the importance of an identity in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you appreciate life more and not be consumed with the unrealistic expectation of trying to impress the world.

In this book, you'll learn about my 125 pound weight loss journey and the process of finding my identity:

The many struggles of growing up obese and finding my identity in the wrong places

Losing the weight and being able to hear the stories of others on similar journeys

Finding an identity and looking back on where I once found my purpose

You will relate to The Weight You Carry if you have struggled with self-image or sought the approval of others over your own self-worth. This is especially true for those seeking their real identity for the first time.

 

The Book - The Weight You Carry


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + six other chapters. From these chapters, a person will be able to see my story of growing up overweight and why I fell into obesity. Along with this, you will be able to understand my motivation to begin my weight-loss journey.

Part 2 contains Chapters 7-12. From these chapters the reader will be able to see the incredible weight loss I began and finished. The 125-pound weight-loss journey filled with a roller coaster of emotions allows the reader to get a feel for what it was like to partake in this transformation. Finally, the reader will see how my openness in sharing my story allowed others to open up about their own insecurities and struggles.

Part 3 contains Chapters 13-17. These chapters do a phenomenal job of showing the many false promises of weight loss. This is paired with a call to action for the reader to further search for identity.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

My name is Tanner Jay, and I majored in Professional Selling at Ball State University. I am known for being able to connect with individuals with my personable and sarcastic personality. This friendly personality has allowed me to share my story and develop relationships with many individuals in my life

I wrote this book as my weight loss story is truly unique and something I felt called to share. I hope to be an example to many of the false realities of weight loss and the search for the approval of others.

I am an outgoing guy who truly loves connecting with people and creating deep, personal friendships with them. I find absolute joy in interacting with people and loving them well.

story:
The Story of My Book

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a shared affinity for character-based storytelling and immersive world building. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for crime dramas. And ultimately, I hope this book is a tool to help you see your own story in a different light.

In this book, you'll learn about the difficult interactions between the primal drives of grief, longing, and the desire for revenge:

  • A girl’s body is found, tangled in the mangroves of the river that splits a sleepy Florida town in two.
  • A young boy, Atticus, attempts to navigate a world that very clearly does not want him in it: as he observes without fully processing the grief of the community around him, he encounters a shifty newcomer outside of his local Church.
  • Newbury, fleeing hallucinatory visions and paranoid dreams of oceans on fire, stumbles into the swampy Florida heat without having processed a single moment of the week-long journey he’d just taken.

You will love this book if you love character/crime dramas such as Sharp Objects, True Detective, The Night Of, Breaking Bad, Haunting of Hill House, and Twin Peaks.

Southing is a novel that speaks to mystery and drama lovers who are looking for a poetic but brutal read.

 

The Book - Southing

The book is narrated by five speakers:

Newbury is an unreliable drifter who comes to Carrabelle, Florida, with an unknown agenda. He is haunted by visions of his past as well as the pervasive presence of his dead best friend, Warren.

Atticus is a young boy attempting to understand the nature of grief and loss in the community around him. With the death of Jaime, the girl found in the river, he must face the realities of the sometimes cruel world around him.

Dewey, Atticus’s older brother, is attempting to wrap his head around Jaime’s loss. Dewey, who had secretly admired Jaime from afar, has sunk himself

Callie is another outsider with a mysterious past, pulled into Dewey’s orbit at a high school party that serves as the catalyst for the ensuing events of the novel. After moving back to her father’s home town after a political scandal destroyed her family’s reputation, Callie’s narrative serves as a more stable outsider’s view of the town and some of its most influential figures.

Lastly are a series of chapters narrated by an omniscient figure impartial to the plot and the characters surrounding it. These “interludes,” titled only by the location in which the events described take place, give readers a birds-eye-view of ulterior developments surrounding Jaime’s case that the central four narrators are not aware of.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats.)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my final cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Lily Darling has worked as a contributing writer at Kulture Hub, a community-based platform that reports on young creatives flourishing in their respective fields. Her work has been twice recognized with Honorable Mention awards from the Brooklyn Public Library's Ned Vizzini Teen Writing Contest. She is currently a student at Brandeis University.

From the Author

I wrote this book as a means to explore character dynamics as well as narrative tools in order to further expand upon what could be considered a traditional story: a dead girl’s body is found, so now what? In a lawless world slowing decaying into complete chaos, what are those most affected by personal tragedy supposed to do?

Removed from the world of Southing, I love to read, paint, and talk my friends’ ears off about A24 movies. While I spend 9 months of the year in Waltham, Massachusetts, my heart (as well as my obese Brussels Griffon, Lupa) remains in Brooklyn, New York.

For more information, you can connect with me at lrdarlingbusiness@gmail.com and @lily.darliing on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Southingbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lily Darling

story:
About Before A Fall

My name is Lee Daly and I'm a writer from Dublin, Ireland. I've been a huge PRIDE fan since I got the 2000 Grand Prix on a VHS tape nearly two decades ago and was always captivated by the glamour, grit and grievances that made the promotion so compelling. For years I wondered why there was no book on the history of PRIDE, before deciding to take the plunge and tackle it as a project.

I've been researching and writing for two years and have been very fortunate to have had help from fighters, commentators and journalists, all who have shared unique insights into what made PRIDE so special. Here's just some of the names featured: 

  • Bas Rutten 
  • Stephen Quadros
  • Frank Shamrock
  • Minoru Suzuki
  • Erik Paulson
  • Frank Trigg

Illustrator John Sheehan and I have been working hard to make the book a reality and we now want to share the results of our work with as many of our fellow fans as we can. That's where you come in. 

 

Why Crowdfund? 

With Before A Fall, we wanted to keep the fan ethos of the book intact, whilst also delivering as high a quality of a book as we can. 

That means a fully self-published project and that requires money, so here's a breakdown of what we're fundraising for. 

  • €500 will go toward Indiegogo and processing fees.
  • €2000 will pay for the art work. 
  • €2500 will go toward compiling and printing an initial run of 150 books.

The book will go on general release before the end of September on Amazon, Kindle Store and will be available to order in select book stores.  However the campaign gives a great opportunity for us to share the book directly with you, and on top of the great rewards, you'll be helping us out as well.

 

The Perks

Of course, we're not expecting discerning MMA fans to hand over their money for nothing in return, and there are some awesome perks you'll get in return for your support. You can check them out on the right hand side of the page but the key thing to remember is the version you will get of the book will be unique to supporters of the Indiegogo campaign, with a cover not available on general release. 

 

What You Can Do

  • Contribute to the campaign. Every amount, big or small, helps. 
  • Let us know your memories of PRIDE or what you're interested in.
  • Give the campaign a share or tell a friend! 

 

Credits

Illustrations by John Sheehan john-sportraits.com

Layout and social media design by Eamonn Dalton eamonndalton.com

Video shot and edited by Donnacha Coffey film-grab.com

story:
Camp Omigosh Is Waiting for You... 

Connor's summer is off to a rough start: the camp bus almost crashes, his cabin mates don't trust him, and the girls on the other side of the camp constantly outsmart him. But when he and his friends Tasha, Parker, and Kimberly investigate the mystery surrounding the "Ghost of Dead Billy," they begin a hilarious adventure that is worlds away from your typical campfire story.


What Are You Waiting For?

The novel will be released on June 13th, just in time for summer break. You can be the first to order the e-book version ($5) or the print edition ($25) by ordering one of the perks. If now isn't a good time to be spending more money on yet another awesome middle grade novel, don't worry -- we know what it's like to empty out your bank account while visiting the bookstore. But you can help out Camp Omigosh without spending a dime! All you have to do is spread the word about this project!


Meet the Author: Wade Bradford

I'm a playwright (Promedy, CSI: Neverland, Tomorrow's Wish) and I'm an author of picture books (Why Do I Have to Make My Bed?). My latest work is Camp Omigosh, a middle grade novel filled with humor, mystery, and LOTS of surprises. 

Two years ago, a sixth grade teacher shared the first draft with her students, reading one new chapter every week. The kids had a blast, and it inspired me to further develop and enhance the story. I have partnered up with Skyrocket Press, a new up-and-coming publishing company led by author Laurisa White Reyes. Together, we hope to share CAMP OMIGOSH with the world. But we need a little help to spread the word... That's where you come in! 

 If you help us fund our campaign, we will be able to:

  • Finalize the art work. ($250)
  • Complete the editing process. ($250)
  • Professionally format the text. (+100)
  • Market and distribute the book! (Extra $$$)
Would you like to learn more about me and my creative projects? Visit: www.wadebradford.com 

(This is me, trying to be all smiley.) 
Don't forget to check out the publisher's website: www.skyrocketpress.com


Meet the Camp Counselor: Mr. Warren...



Why Crowdfunding?

Because CAMP OMIGOSH is a wonderful mash-up of genres (comedy, suspense, supernatural, sci-fi, mysetry, you-name-it) it's not an easy book for traditional publishers to embrace. But it is a book that kids will love. (The students of Plum Canyon Elementary have proven this theory. Thanks, guys!)
When you purchase the e-book or print copy of CAMP OMIGOSH you will not only be the first to experience this exciting new middle grade adventure... You will also be developing a new way books are published. Laurisa White Reyes' Skyrocket Press offers a new philosophy to book making, one that develops unique children's books for unique readers. 

Thank you for helping us bring CAMP OMIGOSH to life. 

And when you read the book, loyal campers, don't forget... 

SHARE THE ADVENTURE. KEEP THE SECRETS.

When you purchase the e-book or print copy of CAMP OMIGOSH you will not only be the first to experience this exciting new middle grade adventure... You will also be developing a new way books are published. Laurisa White Reyes' Skyrocket Press offers a new philosophy to book making, one that develops unique children's books for unique readers. 

Thank you for helping us bring CAMP OMIGOSH to life. 

And when you read the book, loyal campers, don't forget... 

SHARE THE ADVENTURE. KEEP THE SECRETS.

story:
Synthèse

    Si vous aussi, vous êtes fatigués et écœurés des propos racistes diffusés par Eric Zemmour, jour après jour, aidez le CRAN à financer une action judiciaire contre ce récidiviste.

    Le Contexte

    Le 6 mai dernier, sur RTL, Eric Zemmour a commenté la criminalité en hausse en dressant le portrait apocalyptique d'une France menacée et terrassée par des « bandes de Tchétchènes, de Roms, de Kosovars, de Maghrébins, d'Africains, qui dévalisent, violentent ou dépouillent ». Et à la question d'Hervé Bazin qui lui demandait alors comment lutter contre cette criminalité, il a répondu en affirmant qu'il fallait une société « homogène », appelant implicitement à mettre en place ce qu'en d'autres lieux on appellerait une « politique de purification ethnique ». 

    Un Projet innovant

    Le CRAN (organisation antiraciste) a décidé d'assigner en justice Eric Zemmour, qui a déjà été condamné deux fois pour incitation à la discrimination raciale. A la suite de cela, il a été débarqué du service public (de France 2 et de France O). Mais il n'a pas compris la leçon, et il récidive sur I-télé et sur RTL. Nous avons interpellé le CSA, qui a en effet dénoncé ses propos.

    Mais il faut une véritable sanction judiciaire. Aidez-nous à financer le procès qui permettra de le condamner lui, mais aussi la chaîne et la maison mère, qui le maintiennent en poste uniquement pour faire de l'audimat et de l'argent. D'autant plus que les chroniques de Zemmour sont toujours visées en amont, selon RTL. Le racisme ne peut pas être un fond de commerce, au mépris des valeurs républicaines. L'égalité est au cœur même de notre devise.

    Argumentaire

    La montée des extrémismes en France, la libération de la parole raciste, la crise politique et morale, tout cela contribue à désigner des pour boucs émissaires, ceux qui sont perçus comme différents. Mais nous sommes tous différents, tous égaux. Tandis qu'Eric Zemmour appelle à constituer une France « homogène », nous tenons à rappeler que la France sans Omar Sy, Audrey Pulvar, Zinedine Zidane, Isabelle Adjani, Michel Platini, Florence Foresti, Charles Aznavour, Anne Roumanoff etc., ce ne serait plus tout à fait la France. Et avec ce poison qu'il distille tous les jours, Eric Zemmour contribue fortement à créer un climat de haine sociale. On ne peut rester sans réagir.

    Un Montant modéré

      Le montant sollicité permettra de financer
        • les frais de consignation et de justice
        • les frais d'huissier pour Eric Zemmour, pour RTL et groupe Bertelsmann (propriétaire de la station en Allemagne)
        • les frais d'avocats
        • les contreparties
        • le pourcentage d'Indiegogo
        • les frais de fonctionnement

        Des Contreparties originales

        Les contreparties sont détaillées sur cette page. Vous pourrez obtenir notamment

        • des cartes postales avec des portraits de personnalités historiques du combat contre le racisme
        • des cartes de sympathisants du CRAN, vous permettant ensuite de participer à nos activités
        • le T-shirt collector portant l'inscription « J'ai Zlatané Eric Zemmour »
        • un livre dédicacé par Louis-Georges Tin sur l'esclavage et les réparations
        • un dîner dans un endroit chic et inattendu avec l'équipe du CRAN
        • un entretien avec vous sur le site du CRAN
        • une participation au Colonial Tour 2015

        Quoi qu'il en soit, n'oubliez pas de faire passer le mot autour de vous.
        Invitez vos amis par vos réseaux sociaux à eux aussi saisir cette occasion de « Zlataner Eric Zemmour »...
