story:
THE VOLTA BOOK OF POETS features an array of talented poets representing a myriad of poetic schools:  

Rosa Alcalá, Eric Baus, Anselm Berrigan, Edmund Berrigan, Susan Briante, Sommer Browning, Julie Carr, Don Mee Choi, Arda Collins, Dot Devota, Tsering Wangmo Dhompa, Graham Foust, C.S. Giscombe, Renee Gladman, Noah Eli Gordon, Yona Harvey, Matthew Henriksen, Harmony Holiday, Cathy Park Hong, Bhanu Kapil, John Keene, Aaron Kunin, Dorothea Lasky, Juliana Leslie, Rachel Levitsky, Tan Lin, Dawn Lundy Martin, J. Michael Martinez, Farid Matuk, Shane McCrae, Anna Moschovakis, Fred Moten, Sawako Nakayasu, Chris Nealon, Hoa Nguyen, Khadijah Queen, Andrea Rexilius, Zachary Schomburg, Brandon Shimoda, Evie Shockley, Cedar Sigo, Abraham Smith, Christopher Stackhouse, Mathias Svalina, Roberto Tejada,TC Tolbert, Catherine Wagner, Dana Ward, Ronaldo V. Wilson, Lynn Xu

From Joshua Marie Wilkinson’s introduction:  “My goal is a relatively modest one: to cite a mere constellation. Indeed fifty stars in the night sky are a fraction of what lurks out there. While that’s a drastic metaphor, anybody familiar with poetry these days is readily stunned by the sheer quantity of poets writing and publishing.”

Each poet offers a statement of poetics to accompany their selection of poems. Contrasting styles, diverse voices, unique obsessions, differing poetic influences and approaches to cultural identity, THE VOLTA BOOK OF POETS is a celebration of contrasts. Think of it less as a unifying, thematic gesture than a starter map -- radiating out to poets, books, journals, reading series, nonprofits, and other organizations committed to the advancement of poets and poetry.

THE VOLTA BOOK OF POETS would not be possible if not for the generosity of the presses who granted permission to reprint the poems collected in this anthology, including: 1913 Press; Action Books; Ahsahta Press; Apogee Press; Birds LLC; Black Lawrence Press; Black Ocean; Black Square Editions; City Lights Publishing; Cleveland State University Poetry Center; Counterpath Press; Dalkey Archive; Dorothy, a publishing project; Edge Books; Farfalla Press / McMillan; Fence Books; Flood Editions; Four Way Books; Futurepoem Books; Kenning Editions; Letter Machine Editions; Litmus Press; Noemi Press; Octopus Books; Omnidawn Publishing; Owl Press; W.W. Norton; and Wave Books. 

What We Need & What You Get

Sidebrow Books, the publisher of THE VOLTA BOOK OF POETS, needs $5,000 to bring this book to print for a Fall release date. This poetry anthology will run approximately 400 pages, and printing will cost around $7,500. We are asking you to help bring this book into the world, it’s worth it and we can’t do it without a little help from each of you. As a thanks for your gift, you’ll be able to write it off, as all donations to Sidebrow Books are tax deductible AND you’ll get an amazing gift of poetry (from Sidebrow Books or Letter Machine Editions) for your contribution, just check out the perks.  

The Impact

Sidebrow Books has been a book publisher since 2008, bringing approximately 2-3 books of fiction or poetry to print each year. Sidebrow is a member of the Intersection Incubator and is fiscally sponsored by Intersection for the Arts and every dollar you contribute is tax deductible.  The Sidebrow editors are volunteers, we don’t get paid to publish books, but we love to do it and are committed to putting out books annually.  For a peek at what we’ve published in the past, check out our catalog: http://www.sidebrow.net/books

Other Ways You Can Help

Help Sidebrow Books raise $5K by spreading the word about THE VOLTA BOOK OF POETS to your network.  Get the word out to YOUR friends so they don’t miss out on this incredible collection of poetry.

story:
Who I am

Hello, I am Elliott DeLine. I am a 25 year old writer who also happens to be a transgender man. I have 2 books, Refuse and I Know Very Well How I Got My Name. In 2011, Refuse was a finalist in the Rainbow Book Awards in several categories . In 2013, I Know Very Well How I Got My Name was the winner for Best Transgender Fiction. I have also written for Original Plumbing, The New York Times, Trans-Genre.net, and other publications.  I had a short story in The Collection, a transgender anthology which won the 2012 Lambda Literary Award.  My work has received favorable reviews from Kirkus Reviews, Out in Print Queer Book Reviews, Lambda Literary, and Publishers’ Weekly, to name a few.  Mark Simpson, a British journalist for The Guardian and the author of Saint Morrissey, called my first novel “irresistible.”  Kirkus Reviews referred to my work as “well written, nuanced…pioneering examples of transgender fiction.” My writing has been read by gender studies and literature classes at New York University, Trent University, The New School, SUNY Fredonia, Onondaga Community College, and more. Despite this, my work remains largely unknown to the general public as well as within the transgender community. This is because I have extremely limited promotional power. I work almost entirely on my own with no budget.

Short Summary

I want 2014 to be the year I take the world by storm. Or at least the literary world. Or at least the queer literary world. I intend to be busy writing, but I also want to travel in order to have a presence at several fancy events in fancy cities. Last year I was able to publish my second book and also make *appearances* in New York, San Francisco, Philadelphia, Ontario, Fredonia, and more, signing my books and reading to audiences. However, I quickly learned was very expensive. Midway through 2013, I was also dealt a blow when I was fired from my day job. It was a very shady situation. The only reason I was able to achieve what I did was because of my readers- either because they set up paid gigs for me, bought my books, or contributed to my previous crowd-funding campaigns in 2013. My current income comes from book sales and odd jobs and usually rounds out to only a couple hundred dollars a month. Luckily I have supportive parents who have been able to house me for quite some time. I don't want pity, because I'm quite fortunate in this regard. I only tell you this so you understand why I'm asking for assistance. 

What I Plan To Do In 2014

1. Book reading in NYC at the Bureau of General Services, Queer Division. January 17, 2013. Round trip by train: $150

2. The Rainbow Book Fair in NYC, March. Round trip by train: $150. Vendor fee, half  table: $50.

3. Philadelphia Trans Health Conference. 3 days in June. Splitting gas cost, parking, lodging, table vendor fee. $200+

4. Lambda Literary Finalist Reading (If I am a finalist!) Unknown Location. Travel and Lodging, $200+

5. Lambda Literary Award Ceremony, Unknown Location. Travel and Lodging, $200+

6. OutWrite Book Festival, D.C. Several days in August. Vendor Fee: $40. Travel and Lodging. Total: $200+

7. Queer Between the Covers Book Fair, Montreal. Several days in August. Vendor fee?, travel, lodging: $200+

8. Southern Comfort Conference. Atlanta. Several days in September. Vendor fee: $150. Travel and lodging: $200+

9. Stocking Books to sell at events. 100 copies of Refuse: $300+ ,100 copies of novella: $300+

And hopefully several other readings at bookstores, colleges, and events around the country. Other expenses I will likely incur in 2014 include: 

1. Printing and shipping copies of my books for bookstores. Because of this expense, I've only been able to stock my books in about 5 bookstores in major cities. 

2. Entering contests and submitting work to publications.

3. Purchasing promotional material such as postcards and business cards. 

4. Purchasing shipping labels, paper, printer ink. 

5. I would like to attend a "Novel Bootcamp" at the Syracuse YMCA's Downtown Writer Center. It's an 8-week course that costs $130. I'm hoping it will help me improve and complete my next book so I can have it available as soon as possible. 

The Impact

1. There aren't a lot of trans authors who have published novels. It's important we are represented at larger LGBTQ literary events. In addition, most books with transgender characters are not written by transgender authors. Mine are among the few exceptions.

2. Few successful queer writers live outside expensive major metropolitan centers like NYC, San Francisco, LA. Millions of queer people live elsewhere but don’t see their lives reflected in queer culture. I am from Syracuse, NY and write from this perspective. It makes for fresh writing. I think that my less than glamorous lifestyle resonates with many people.

3. I receive an estimate of 2 or 3 emails/messages a month from transgender people telling me how important my books were to them. A lot of these people have told me they never read anything else like my books and that it helped them accept themselves. Some of these people have been as young as 13.

4. I find it inspiring to believe that independent artists can succeed despite the climate of the publishing world. I don’t have any of the traditional assistance or funding that most authors possess. It’s just me on my laptop at my parents’ house. And yet the internet has enabled me to reach thousands of readers in the past 2 years. Please help me continue on this journey, and I will continue to write as best and as truthfully as I am able.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don’t donate, you can still help. Please help spread the word! And follow me @ elliottdeline.tumblr.com or facebook.com/authorelliottdeline to keep up to date on my newest projects and when I may be visiting your town.

Thank you so much everybody!

story:
Trojika, A Novel

Chicago attorney John Lester didn't come home last night, and three women are missing him. When the women's lives collide in the back of a Kosovan restaurant, they discover the threads of their existence are woven together by a trauma that occurred a decade ago. As they search for answers to John's disappearance and their own memories, the old ladies who run the restaurant may have some answers....

  • I am a mom, soapmaker, blogger and writer living in the Pacific Northwest. I have three novels in progress and recently received an Honorable Mention in Glimmer Train's Short Story Award for New Writers. 
  • This campaign will help me get a polished copy of this novel self-published as an ebook and paperback.
  • I am happy with my draft, and think that professional editing, formatting and design could really help.

I have always written, and dreamed of 'being a writer.' As I put my work out into the world, I want it to be the best it can be. I'm a grammar nerd, but having another set of eyes for inconsistencies and line editing really helps.

Your generous donation will pay for:

  • A Jason Gurley-designed cover for the paperback and e-book (I'm so excited about this, and it's already in the works), professional proofreading and line-editing. If there is money left over, it will pay for formatting; if not, I will do that myself.
  • You will receive a copy of the book, either in e-book or paperback format, or both, and a hand-written thank you note!
  • Even if I don't reach my goal, the book is in progress and has a tentative release date of April 1, 2014. Help me create a clean, error-free novel! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, forward this to a friend, or check my author page on Amazon on April 1!

story:
Hi, I’m Gemma Stone. I’m writing a book and I’d love to share it with you. It’s called The Art and Science of Designing a Life You Love.

This book is for everyone who feels called to live a truthful and fulfilling life. It’s for everyone who has felt afraid to make the changes they want to make.

The Art and Science of Designing a Life You Love is about how to live & be in the world. But it’s not about my way – it’s about figuring out what your way looks like and how to make that work for you.

I’m a psychologist and the Art and Science of Designing a Life You Love is all about psychology of soulful change.

Within us is the ability to design our lives the way we want them to be. Sometimes we get off course and end up with a life that feels draining. We can feel hobbled and paralyzed, unable to detect the call of our great life. So we resort to what is comfy & familiar -- to-do lists, old habits, busyness and distractions.

We all arrive on this planet with possibility & potential and with a desire to live a great life.

With all the demands we have on us and with all the balls we juggle, our vision for our lives can get off-course and maybe even end up completely in the ditch.

In order to live the lives we want to live, we must carve out time and space to design them the way we want them to be. We must understand how to use and implement tools for authentic change. We must offer ourselves and our lives both love and attention. This is what the Art and Science of Designing a Life You Love is all about. 

You can pre-order your book now or there are other fun perks you can only get through the campaign {a copy of the book with a love-note inscribed, $100 off the Great Life Redesign retreat and I'll even fly to your place for dinner}.

Thank you. For showing up. For choosing love. 

What is the money for?

This campaign is to cover the production of publishing a book and all the behind the scenes expenses of the perks {costs of travel for the dinner parties, retreat venue for the retreat, etc.}.

Logistics.The book is written. The next steps are editing, design, layout and printing. I estimate you'll be cracking open The Art and Science of Designing a Life You Love before March 2015. 

  • editing & copyediting :: $3,000
  • illustration :: $1,000
  • book layout :: $2000
  • printing {for 500 copies} :: $8,000
  • shipping :: $1000
  • perk expenses :: $5000
Why Indiegogo?

I choose crowdfunding to support the creation of this book for a few reasons.

I want to know you. I desire for this book to create a greater connection between us and I think Indiegogo can help make that happen. 

I'm impatient. I've been waiting to write this book for ten years. Now that I'm writing it I want to get it to you ... yesterday. It can take a few years to get a book published through a traditional publisher. I want to share what I know about designing a life you love with you as soon as possible. I think Indiegogo can help make that happen. 


Life has given us each have a precious responsibility. To live as fully, freely and deeply as we can. To move from survive to thrive, from fear to love, from false to true. To follow our hearts and listen to the whispers of our souls. 
You are worthy of living a life you love. I hope this book helps you do just that.

story:
Story of My Book

Pity Partiers is a guide to teach you how to overcome and celebrate failure by using the pity party method. Failure is to be chased and not avoided as it is the route to success. Be a pity partier and celebrate failure!

My name is Daniela Carrasco, and I am the author of Pity Partiers. I wrote this book because we live in a world that does not fully embrace failures. Everyone shows off their success, but very rarely you are demonstrated the lows that were experienced to get to the top of the mountain. I want to help people stop viewing failure as a defeat and start celebrating it. I believe failures are stepping stones to launching success. Stop allowing failure to hold you back. I have experienced a bucketful of failures throughout my life and career, and I am commonly asked how I am able to stay positive and resilient. I do so with my secret sauce, pity parties! Pity Partiers are created when using my three-step pity party method that has helped me overcome failure throughout my life.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that failures are nothing to fear. I hope you actually start chasing them even more. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for failure in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to overcome any obstacle or curveball by becoming an effective pity partier. This book is like a best friend who cheers you on from the sidelines.

In this book, you'll learn about failure and how to use the pity party method to overcome failure:

  • How failure affects our brain, and the reason why people fear it.
  • The creation of the pity party method, and the three parties you can throw yourself to overcome failure.
  • The principals of an effective pity partier.

You will love this book if you enjoy to read personal development books that hit you with the truth, no fluffs sprinkled with a few laughs here and there. Pity Partiers is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults and people of all ages who are looking at failure and how to overcome and celebrate it. While all of the interviews highlight successful women, their stories are relevant to everyone.

The Book - Pity Partiers


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 we start off by getting personal as I share my experience of moving to Seattle and getting let go of what I thought was my dream. job. You will learn how the pity party method was created and the three steps that a pity partier takes to overcome failure. In order to understand how failure affects our minds, we will touch on the science of failure. The creation of emotion and how it affects the brain, mind, and body. In order for us to overcome failure we must understand the areas it affects and the additional emotions it may stimulate.

Part 2 presents the five principles of a pity partier. I will share personal stories of failure and the principles and tactics I gained as I used the pity party method. You will learn how to view failure as new opportunities, stay resilient, and staying confident when difficult times arise. You will learn the steps I take to find gratitude when failure occurs. After you are done with this section, you will be well on your way to become a pity partier.

Part 3 contains Pity Party 101, a three-step guide to becoming an effective pity partier. I will share the exact steps that need to be taken to learn how to celebrate failure. To continue with the celebration, I will finish by sharing failures that successful women have experienced in life, love, and career. You will learn how Sheila Bella build her seven figure business in three years, the failures she experienced, and how she views this topic. In addition, you will read personal stories from Joanna Baumann, VP of iHeart Media and FNGR Podcast co-host, Katrina.
 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

About the Author


I am Daniela Carrasco, a Director of Accounts at Knock. Knock is a Seattle-based startup company that provides the tools multifamily property managers need to convert leads into prospects. Daniela has built her career leading non-profits and startups as they experience many organizational "firsts" in the development of customer success.

I wrote this book because I want people to stop fearing failure and truly start celebrating it. I have seen and heard people hold their dreams and goals back because of the fear of failing. I have been there, and I know what you are experiencing. Failure will hold you back only if you allow it to do so. It is hard, I know, I have been there. However, it is time we change the way we approach failure. Hold my hand, put on that party hat, and throw yourself a pity party. Get yourself back out there! I know you can do it!

I am your regular 29-year-old who is trying to figure out this thing we call life, one failure at a time. I reside in the gloomy city of Seattle, but take every opportunity to fill up my passport with stamps. I am a first-generation American child as both my parents are from Puebla, Mexico. I enjoy knock-knock jokes as much as I enjoy sarcasm and donuts. In my spare time, I enjoy volunteering through young professional groups within my community and going on local foodie tours. I love helping people and spreading positivity one smile at a time.

For more information you can connect with me at pitypartiers@gmail.com and IG: @dcrrasco, FB: www.facebook.com/daniela.carrasco.33, LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/dcrrasco

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #pitypartiers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Daniela Carrasco

In order to understand how failure affects our minds, we will touch on the science of failure. The creation of emotion and how it affects the brain, mind, and body. In order for us to overcome failure we must understand the areas it affects and the additional emotions it may stimulate.Part 2 presents the five principles of a pity partier. I will share personal stories of failure and the principles and tactics I gained as I used the pity party method. You will learn how to view failure as new opportunities, stay resilient, and staying confident when difficult times arise. You will learn the steps I take to find gratitude when failure occurs. After you are done with this section, you will be well on your way to become a pity partier.Part 3 contains Pity Party 101, a three-step guide to becoming an effective pity partier. I will share the exact steps that need to be taken to learn how to celebrate failure. To continue with the celebration, I will finish by sharing failures that successful women have experienced in life, love, and career. You will learn how Sheila Bella build her seven figure business in three years, the failures she experienced, and how she views this topic. In addition, you will read personal stories from Joanna Baumann, VP of iHeart Media and FNGR Podcast co-host, Katrina. 

What I Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: 
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...


About the Author
About the Author
I am Daniela Carrasco, a Director of Accounts at Knock. Knock is a Seattle-based startup company that provides the tools multifamily property managers need to convert leads into prospects. Daniela has built her career leading non-profits and startups as they experience many organizational "firsts" in the development of customer success.I wrote this book because I want people to stop fearing failure and truly start celebrating it. I have seen and heard people hold their dreams and goals back because of the fear of failing. I have been there, and I know what you are experiencing. Failure will hold you back only if you allow it to do so. It is hard, I know, I have been there. However, it is time we change the way we approach failure. Hold my hand, put on that party hat, and throw yourself a pity party. Get yourself back out there! I know you can do it!I am your regular 29-year-old who is trying to figure out this thing we call life, one failure at a time. I reside in the gloomy city of Seattle, but take every opportunity to fill up my passport with stamps. I am a first-generation American child as both my parents are from Puebla, Mexico. I enjoy knock-knock jokes as much as I enjoy sarcasm and donuts. In my spare time, I enjoy volunteering through young professional groups within my community and going on local foodie tours. I love helping people and spreading positivity one smile at a time.For more information you can connect with me at pitypartiers@gmail.com and IG: @dcrrasco, FB: www.facebook.com/daniela.carrasco.33, LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/dcrrasco

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #pitypartiers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Daniela Carrasco

story:
I would like you to be a part of my "Are you ready for the one?" project, that includes my book and live talk show "Dr Georgina on the spot".

 

This self published book is a guide to help women build themselves and allow the right guy into their lives.

It starts with a psychoanalytical section: understand why we end up attracted to some types of men and what our relationship patterns are. Then it takes you through steps to improve who you already are and grow to be the best version of yourself. And finally there is a section giving advice on what to do when you do actually meet someone.

Even if you are a guy, and especially if you are, you hopefully will feel concerned too as a more grounded women, oozing in self confidence but also very nurturing, will bring you to a higher more blissful level of relationship.

 

This campaign has been put together to raise funds for my publicist and talk show production.

Our Story

Since the successful international release of The Spanish Helmet, I have had many requests for a German edition. It makes sense, a Swiss/New Zealand author should have their work available in German too. Especially when parts of the novel take place in ZÃ¼rich. Therefore, I have decided to take a risk and conduct an experiment in self-publishing that I havenâ€™t seen undertaken elsewhere. I have launched a translation project with a qualified and experienced translator and am funding the task myself. The contract is already signed and the work is underway but my translator is working for peanuts. So that she (an expecting mother) can afford to stock up on gherkins   and chocolate, we need your help.

The Impact

Indie authors (self-publishers) have a tough time breaking into the market. It's a shame, because there is some great work out there. If we can successfully launch this translation into the German market, we can illuminate another possibility for indie authors to spread their work. A success in this experiment could also lead to a large increase in self-published works becoming available in the German market, something that German readers will be very happy to see.

I will provide reports on the experiment outcomes to any supporters who would like them.

What We Need & What You Get

The translation is being done at an extremely low rate of approximately $4000. But this isnâ€™t nearly enough income for the three months of work involved. Any over-funding of this project will go to the hands of my translator who plays a huge role in the task of getting The Spanish Helmet (Der Spanische Helm) out to you in German. Any amount under the agreed $4000 will be paid out of my pocket or through other funding sources if I can find them.

I hope that some of the gifts I propose will provoke you to support this literature experiment. If you have other ideas or gift suggestions, please donâ€™t hesitate to make a proposal.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by spreading the word to other indie authors, German readers, Swiss/NZ literature fans and anyone else who wants to get a copy of the The Spanish Helmet in either English or German and support a good cause/experiment at the same time.

Any agents or publishers interested in securing rights to the successful English or future German edition of The Spanish Helmet should contact me.

The Book

A phone call between two friends unleashes a series of events  which threaten to shatter New Zealand's officially accepted history.

Dr. Matthew Cameron travels to New Zealand to investigate a remarkable archaeological discovery. As he follows a trail of clues scattered throughout the country, Matt is thrust into the role of student and learns about trust, love and deception. But can he succeed in revising a nation's history when the Government will stop at nothing to hide the truth?

Five centuries earlier, Francisco de Hoces is lost in the Pacific Ocean after his ship is separated from the rest of his fleet. Fate shipwrecks the San Lesmes on beautiful and mysterious shores. Can he and his crew survive amongst the natives in this extraordinary land?

The Spanish Helmet weaves together the stories of two men whose destinies are set to collide. When they do, the explosive aftermath will change New Zealand's history forever.

Greg Scowen's debut novel is a plot-driven tale of a modern-day treasure hunt and a meticulously researched conspiracy thriller which carefully blends fact and fiction.

Ich hoffe, dass die zur Auswahl stehenden Goodies viele Menschen dazu bewegen werden, dieses schweizerische Literaturexperiment zu unterstÃ¼tzen. Wer andere VorschlÃ¤ge oder WÃ¼nsche hat, kann sich jederzeit an mich wenden.

story:
¿Qué?

La casa del ajo es una novela de misterio acerca de ese muerto en el armario que hay en toda familia.

El descubrimiento de un hombre corrupto sobre el hecho de haber concebido una hija de forma violenta, le hace pensar en la necesidad de deshacerse de ella para no ser juzgado por la sociedad y despojado de la comodidad y bienestar obtenido. Llevar a fin esa idea desencadena una serie de fenómenos paranormales en el bosque, hasta entonces tranquilo, que cambia la vida de todas las personas de Piket Cross durante generaciones.

Sarah Fisher, una descendiente, embarazada y en compañía de su marido y de un hijo de nueve años, que emigrará a América huyendo del periodo de post guerra tras la guerra civil española, pasa a recibir como herencia antes del viaje la granja de su abuela en Piket Cross y una carta perteneciente al tío abuelo Ernes. La carta del tío abuelo Ernes que María Aurora (la madre de Sarah) tenía guardada y que le da en la cama de un hospital en España, ya que no le queda tiempo para explicar todo antes de morir, es el principio que lleva a Sarah a conocer la historia secreta de la familia y el misterio en torno a esos fenómenos paranormales regalándole una vida inimaginable, impensable, más allá de la granja, del pueblo y del bosque.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Carolina López García.

Artista multidisciplinar, vive en Alcalá la Real, pueblo de Jaén aunque nació en Granada y pasó su infancia en Murcia. Es educadora infantil, sin embargo se ocupó de mimar a la tercera edad. Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a escribir y a realizar exposiciones pictóricas con gran éxito. Ha diseñado imágenes publicitarias para pymes.

Enamorada del arte, de la naturaleza que la rodea y debido a una personalidad muy dinámica y extrovertida, es en su niñez cuando comienza a narrar y a dibujar sus primeras historias. El concepto de sus trabajos es el de volver a contactar con la naturaleza, con el ser soñador, con los demás seres soñantes, perdernos en ella y volver a sentirla, a amarla, ya que el mundo en el que vivimos nos aleja cada vez más de nuestro vínculo natural y emocional.

Es una forma de liberación, viajar, sumergirse con los sentidos en la naturaleza real-onírica e intentar plasmarla a través de historias, de dibujos.

Sin duda uno de los mejores regalos que recibió en su infancia fue su primera cámara de fotos que se convirtió en su amiga inseparable y con la que consiguió conservar en cualquier instante, no solo en la memoria, la belleza de los lugares y pequeñitos seres que a ella impresionaban. Le encantaba jugar con las formas y con los colores, crear historias, en ocasiones como prolongación de las imágenes captadas con su cámara dando lugar a relatos y paisajes imposibles, todo era como salido de un sueño.

Desde entonces disfruta con lo que hace mostrando su clara intención de poner en contacto sus sentimientos, sus valores y todo aquello en lo que cree con los demás. Utilizando como fuente de inspiración el gran amor y respeto que siente por la vida. Su creatividad, investigación y perseverancia, han hecho que esta autora se haya labrado un estilo propio e inconfundible.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La casa del ajo que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Carolina López García vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

La casa del ajo es una novela de misterio acerca de ese muerto en el armario que hay en toda familia.
El descubrimiento de un hombre corrupto sobre el hecho de haber concebido una hija de forma violenta, le hace pensar en la necesidad de deshacerse de ella para no ser juzgado por la sociedad y despojado de la comodidad y bienestar obtenido. Llevar a fin esa idea desencadena una serie de fenómenos paranormales en el bosque, hasta entonces tranquilo, que cambia la vida de todas las personas de Piket Cross durante generaciones.
Sarah Fisher, una descendiente, embarazada y en compañía de su marido y de un hijo de nueve años, que emigrará a América huyendo del periodo de post guerra tras la guerra civil española, pasa a recibir como herencia antes del viaje la granja de su abuela en Piket Cross y una carta perteneciente al tío abuelo Ernes. La carta del tío abuelo Ernes que María Aurora (la madre de Sarah) tenía guardada y que le da en la cama de un hospital en España, ya que no le queda tiempo para explicar todo antes de morir, es el principio que lleva a Sarah a conocer la historia secreta de la familia y el misterio en torno a esos fenómenos paranormales regalándole una vida inimaginable, impensable, más allá de la granja, del pueblo y del bosque.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Carolina López García.
Artista multidisciplinar, vive en Alcalá la Real, pueblo de Jaén aunque nació en Granada y pasó su infancia en Murcia. Es educadora infantil, sin embargo se ocupó de mimar a la tercera edad. Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a escribir y a realizar exposiciones pictóricas con gran éxito. Ha diseñado imágenes publicitarias para pymes.
Enamorada del arte, de la naturaleza que la rodea y debido a una personalidad muy dinámica y extrovertida, es en su niñez cuando comienza a narrar y a dibujar sus primeras historias. El concepto de sus trabajos es el de volver a contactar con la naturaleza, con el ser soñador, con los demás seres soñantes, perdernos en ella y volver a sentirla, a amarla, ya que el mundo en el que vivimos nos aleja cada vez más de nuestro vínculo natural y emocional.
Es una forma de liberación, viajar, sumergirse con los sentidos en la naturaleza real-onírica e intentar plasmarla a través de historias, de dibujos.
Sin duda uno de los mejores regalos que recibió en su infancia fue su primera cámara de fotos que se convirtió en su amiga inseparable y con la que consiguió conservar en cualquier instante, no solo en la memoria, la belleza de los lugares y pequeñitos seres que a ella impresionaban. Le encantaba jugar con las formas y con los colores, crear historias, en ocasiones como prolongación de las imágenes captadas con su cámara dando lugar a relatos y paisajes imposibles, todo era como salido de un sueño.
Desde entonces disfruta con lo que hace mostrando su clara intención de poner en contacto sus sentimientos, sus valores y todo aquello en lo que cree con los demás. Utilizando como fuente de inspiración el gran amor y respeto que siente por la vida. Su creatividad, investigación y perseverancia, han hecho que esta autora se haya labrado un estilo propio e inconfundible.
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La casa del ajo que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Carolina López García vea publicada su obra.Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Who we are

Hello all, 

We are Dennis & Maryann Burns. We have been a team going on thirty years. For almost twenty of those years we worked side by side in my families book store. We are proud to say we love books! We loved selling them and having our customers tell us that we were dead on in a recommendation or way off! We love reading them and the way a good book makes you feel or that sad feeling when you finish reading it and think, "That book ended way to soon!" We instilled that love in our now grown children.

In June of this year along with our children we opened a publishing company, to bring quality books at great prices to the public and to help any aspiring authors do the same. We invested all of our money to fund the company and our cost projections showed we had enough to carry us through December. We published 2 small non-fiction e-books and we were off. You can see our site here: Burns Clan Media Company

We were on track to release our first book in a series titled, THE NEXT PLANET OVER a science fiction story about what happens if our planet can no longer sustain us. Where will we go? How will we get there? What will we do with the remaining time on our planet? See more info on both our web-site and the Facebook page below. Our marketing plan was to release this in conjunction with NASA's Curiosity Rover landing on Mars. We had hoped to receive a hugh publicity boost from that. Then follow up with the second book in the series in time for the holiday shopping season. Well, the best laid plans as they say...

Why we are asking for your help

In early August my mom had a serious medical problem hit her. This caused us to postpone the launch of the book for what we thought would be about two to three weeks while we helped her recover. That turned into a much longer time period. Just as we were rounding the bend on my moms recovery, we were hit by a tragic loss on my wife's side of the family, which we are still trying to come to grips with. We now find ourselves in the beginning of October, way behind schedule and our funds have dwindled drastically. We are hoping with your support we can get back on target.

What we need the funds for

We are asking for your help and support so that we may restore some of our funds and stay afloat through December.

Our first two non-fiction books are still finding there footing in the market place.They are not providing enough sales volume yet to offset our costs.

The first book in the series is ninety percent done. With some round the clock work days this week we should be able to finish final edits and proof reading, fingers crossed. The print on demand paperback version should follow.

Based on the limited test marketing we did, on the first book in THE NEXT PLANET OVER series, we should see a tremendous response. If we are able to work full time on the second book in the series, we will be able to get it launched in time for the all important holiday shopping season. The sales from both these books should cover our costs.

Your support will go toward helping us restore our funds and help pay for maintaining our web-site, hiring an editor, proofreader and book cover designer for the second book in the series. Limited print type advertising on-line. The biggest expense wil be starting and maintaining a rather large social media blitz which we have set up on most of the platforms, Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Google+, Linkedn, Goodreads ect.

To the right you will see what we hope are some intresting ways for us to graciously thank you for your help and suport.

Other Ways You Can Help

We more than understand that in todays economy not everyone can donate.

If you would still like to lend a hand, please share this campaign with as many folks as you can, on your Facebook page, Twitter or however you can think of doing so. Thank you and know that we will be forever gratefull for your help.

Don't forget to follow us on the sites below.

story:
Project Description

Canadian Journalists for Free Expression (CJFE) is a non governmental organization which monitors, defends and reports on free expression and access to information in Canada and abroad. Rooted in the field of journalism, we promote a free media as essential to a fair and open society.
 
For the past three years CJFE has published The Free Expression Review, an in-depth analysis of the state of free expression in Canada. It features a report card grading, on an A-to-F scale, of how institutions, governmental departments and public figures have affected freedom of expression and access to information over the past year.  We search out some of the leaders in this field to write insightful pieces about court cases, trends and how these issues affect Canadians. It is the only publication of this kind produced in Canada and has won acclaim for its quality and its coverage. It is distributed online and in hard copy on World Press Freedom Day (May 3).
 

Click on the image below to learn more about CJFE's Free Expression Review 

 

The Impact

Although we live in a democracy which is known for its protection and encouragement of human rights in Canada and around the world, when it comes to free expression – one of the most fundamental of human rights – Canada, once a world leader, is falling behind. The Free Expression Review is an important publication which informs all Canadians about what is happening with this fundamental right.

How can you contribute?

1)      Donate! The Review informs Canadians about how their right to free expression is faring in this country and by engaging them with the critical issues – this is your chance to make sure that happens. It is a big job, and every dollar goes a long way.

2)      Tell others! Crowdfunding isn’t based on large donations, but a LOT of donations. Everyone you can pass this on to is one more person who knows about their right to free expression, CJFE’s work, and the importance of holding those in authority accountable.

Did you know that:

  • Canada was ranked 55th this year, in an international assessment of countries’ Right to Information legislation. 
  • Canada’s scientists who work for the Federal government are being muzzled. Despite the importance of research in crucial scientific areas such as climate change, water and air quality and food inspection, the Canadian Government has placed increasing restrictions on the ability of scientists to speak to the media and the Canadian public. 
  • Canada’s laws are slowly recognizing the important role that whistleblowers play in ensuring accountability of corporations and the state, but in practice, many whistleblowers have been vilified, been fired from their jobs, and years later are still fighting lengthy court battles.
  • Canada treats defamation as a criminal offence in contravention of international human rights standards.

The Free Expression Review helps all Canadians have a clear understanding of their right to free expression and access to information.  We believe that if you take this fundamental right for granted it will slowly erode away.  Canadians don’t spend much time thinking about this right, but it is a right that it is essential in protecting other rights such as the right to shelter and food, clean water and air, access to health care and education.  If you don’t have the information about these rights or the ability to communicate about them, they too will be threatened.

What we need funding for:

This year, our goal is to expand our coverage of issues in every province and territory, and build our team of staff and volunteers to ensure that we are able to respond to these issues throughout the year.  Here is how the money will be spent:

  • Compensation for key people producing The Review including: the Art Director, Managing Editor and Copy editor
  • Distribution of The Review to journalism and communication programs at universities and colleges across the country
  • Targeted follow up with relevant authorities on the critical issues addressed, including interventions,
  • Further research on these critical issues to follow them as they progress throughout the year
  • Hold a public launch event on May 2, which will be live blogged and feature well-known thinkers speaking about free expression.  More details to be announced.  Stay tuned.

 Three reasons why you should donate:

  1. The Review is a key tool in measuring our right to free expression in Canada. We need your help to make sure it reaches as many people as possible
  2. We know what we’re doing. Building on past reviews the amount of experience, energy, and expertise we put into this effort results in an amazing and accessible product for Canadians.
  3. Free expression matters. If we take this fundamental right for granted, it will erode. CJFE’s  job is to monitor the state of free expression in Canada and report back to the public on what we need pay attention to.  

Note: We receive much-appreciated pro bono support for the printing of the Review, public relations and some graphic design work. (Thank you to The Globe and Mail, Media Profile and Juniper Park). We also work with a committee of volunteers who research and write articles for us pro bono. 

Our Goal for Indiegogo: $5,000

This amount will help us to cover the hard costs for this year’s Review and to make sure that we can tell as many people about it as possible.

Stretch Goals: If we made it to $10,000

We rely on volunteers to do a vast amount of research, writing and fact-checking.  In the future, we’d love to recognise the valuable contributions by these many hard-working writers and editorial contributors with moderate honorariums. 

If we made it to $25,000

It’s a big if, but we would love to hire our wonderful part-time Web and Social Media Editor to work full-time so that we can spend more time writing and encouraging Canadians to talk about these issues all year-long.  We would also spend some of the money on doing more in-depth research on key free of expression issues such as how all governments in Canada –federal, provincial and municipal—are providing access to information for journalists and individual Canadians.

Sample Articles from the 2012 Edition

Silenced Scientists

Federal communications policy bars scientists from talking to the media about their research, making it much more difficult to share key findings with the public.

Is the Canadian government freezing out civil society?

Is the Canadian government deliberately withholding funds from dissenting civil society organizations? Maybe, maybe not. But even the perception places a chill on free expression.

Delay, Redact, Refuse, Repeat

Governments continue to give journalists and other information requestors the runaround.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in the value of our work, please tell others about it.  And, don’t forget to read the articles.  Talk about the issues.  Challenge us.  Make us better.  Get involved.

story:
A new deal for private renters 

The Living Rent Campaign is seeking a new deal for private renters in Scotland. We want those who rent from landlords and letting agents to have the same protection as those who live in other types of housing.  Housing is a human right, private tenants deserve secure homes and affordable rent.

Scottish government figures show that average rent has increased by 40% in Aberdeen and 17% in Edinburgh. The number of Scottish households in poverty in the private rented sector has doubled in the last decade, and high rents are one of the main reasons for this situation. We all understand the idea of fuel poverty, and the need for a living wage – we should also understand rent poverty and the need for a living rent. 

The Scottish Government is working toward a new bill on private rented housing. Your money will support tenants to have a voice in this process and allow us to campaign for these three main changes:  

1.  Bring Rents Under Control: In other countries, there are laws that limit how much landlords can charge, we want that introduced here in Scotland.

2.  Protect Tenants From Eviction: Right now, your landlord doesn’t need a reason to evict you. We want to see the abolition of the so-calledno-fault grounds for repossession, and for tenants to have the right to appeal all evictions.

3.  Provide Flexibility and Security: Tenants should know they will have a place to live next month without having to lock themselves into long-term contracts.

What we need

Your money will allow us to:

  • Print posters, placards, flyers
  • Send campaign packs to housing activists across Scotland
  • Organise impactful stunts and protests
  • Enable us to meet with tenants across Scotland

Other ways you can help.

  • Sign our consultation response and share with your friends. http://www.livingrent.org
  • Hold living rent campaign stalls in your area and get consultation responses signed! Contact us to get involved http://www.livingrent.org/contact-us/
  • Join our postcard delivery demonstration outside the Scottish Parliament on Thursday the 18th of December at 12.30pm.

story:
Short Summary

 

We are Bob Stone (author) and Holly Bushnell (illustrator) and we are the creative team behind the "A Bushy Tale" series of children's books. The books tell the stories of the adventures of Squish, the red squirrel and his woodland friends. We self-published "A Bushy Tale", the first book in the series last year and got some very good reviews. Copies ended up in the hands of, among others, authors Cathy Cassidy, Tom Cox, Jacqueline Harvey, Ruth Eastham, James Rice, Luca Veste and Joseph Delaney. The sales of Book 1 covered its costs, but did not put enough in the bank for future print runs. We now want to publish Book 2 "A Bushy Tale: The Brush Off" and reissue Book 1 with a new cover design and extra content.


What We Need & What You Get


 We are looking to raise £2,500.00 to publish "A Bushy Tale: The Brush Off" and to redesign and reissue "A Bushy Tale" with a new cover design and extra content.  
Contributors will, in fact, be pre-ordering a copy of one, or both books.
There are different levels of contribution, from £10.00, which gets  you a signed copy of the book for your choice, to £30.00, which gets you signed copies of both books, a limited edition Holly Bushnell print, and an invitation to the launch.

The Impact


 We love telling the tales of Squish and his friends. We think they're  good, funny stories, but also make important points about conservation. We intend to work with the UK's leading red squirrel conservation charities to promote their valuable work, and will be donating a percentage of the proceeds of all book sales to help them continue this work.
The first book also introduced the world to the artistic talents of illustrator Holly Bushnell, who has since received commissions for books by two other authors. This campaign will help get our books, and as a result, Holly's work wider exposure.

Risks & Challenges


 200 hundred people bought Book 1. Will they all want to buy Book 2? Did at least some of them like it enough to buy another copy of the new edition? Can we find a wider audience for Book 1, and by extension Book 2?

One of the purposes of funding the books in this way, is that every contribution is a guaranteed sale. The risk to you is minimal. If we raise the funds with your assistance, we publish the books, you get your copy. If we don't raise the funds, we'll have to look for another way, but then you'll still be able to buy the books. At least this way you get a signed copy and, depending on your level of contribution, other goodies besides.


Other Ways You Can Help

 

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are lots of ways you can help. To put it simply, spread the word! Like and follow our Facebook page and Twitter feed and tell everyone you know to do so too. But most of all, get out into the countryside and visit areas where wildlife conservation work is going on. Volunteer if you can. If you see a red squirrel, tell them Squish sent you.

 

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary We are Bob Stone (author) and Holly Bushnell (illustrator) and we are the creative team behind the "A Bushy Tale" series of children's books. The books tell the stories of the adventures of Squish, the red squirrel and his woodland friends. We self-published "A Bushy Tale", the first book in the series last year and got some very good reviews. Copies ended up in the hands of, among others, authors Cathy Cassidy, Tom Cox, Jacqueline Harvey, Ruth Eastham, James Rice, Luca Veste and Joseph Delaney. The sales of Book 1 covered its costs, but did not put enough in the bank for future print runs. We now want to publish Book 2 "A Bushy Tale: The Brush Off" and reissue Book 1 with a new cover design and extra content.
   What We Need & What You Get
 We are looking to raise £2,500.00 to publish "A Bushy Tale: The Brush Off" and to redesign and reissue "A Bushy Tale" with a new cover design and extra content.   Contributors will, in fact, be pre-ordering a copy of one, or both books.There are different levels of contribution, from £10.00, which gets  you a signed copy of the book for your choice, to £30.00, which gets you signed copies of both books, a limited edition Holly Bushnell print, and an invitation to the launch.  The Impact
 We love telling the tales of Squish and his friends. We think they're  good, funny stories, but also make important points about conservation. We intend to work with the UK's leading red squirrel conservation charities to promote their valuable work, and will be donating a percentage of the proceeds of all book sales to help them continue this work.The first book also introduced the world to the artistic talents of illustrator Holly Bushnell, who has since received commissions for books by two other authors. This campaign will help get our books, and as a result, Holly's work wider exposure.  Risks & Challenges
  200 hundred people bought Book 1. Will they all want to buy Book 2? Did at least some of them like it enough to buy another copy of the new edition? Can we find a wider audience for Book 1, and by extension Book 2?
One of the purposes of funding the books in this way, is that every contribution is a guaranteed sale. The risk to you is minimal. If we raise the funds with your assistance, we publish the books, you get your copy. If we don't raise the funds, we'll have to look for another way, but then you'll still be able to buy the books. At least this way you get a signed copy and, depending on your level of contribution, other goodies besides.

  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute financially, there are lots of ways you can help. To put it simply, spread the word! Like and follow our Facebook page and Twitter feed and tell everyone you know to do so too. But most of all, get out into the countryside and visit areas where wildlife conservation work is going on. Volunteer if you can. If you see a red squirrel, tell them Squish sent you.   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

HelIo! I'm raising funds to publish a people's history of the organization New Jewish Agenda, and I'm asking friends, community members, and anyone interested in radical Jewish history or People's History in general, to support this project by donating to pre-order the book!

New Jewish Agenda was a national organization from 1980 to 1992. Their slogan was "a Jewish voice among progressives and a progressive voice among Jews."  NJA practiced participatory grassroots democracy with over 45 local chapters. They organized a progressive Jewish voice for every political issue of their decade: working for peace and justice in the Middle East and Central America, Worldwide Nuclear Disarmament, Economic and Social Justice in the US, and they had a powerful Jewish Feminist Taskforce that included work on LGBT issues and the emergence of the AIDS pandemic.  New Jewish Agenda took radical stances on the rights of Palestinians and the rights of Queer Jews. Activists from a wide range of religious and secular communities coalesced, building power and analysis that continue to illuminate our movements today.

I'm a Jewish writer and activist in my early 30's, born two years before NJA's founding conference. My passion for telling this story is informed by my own commitments to feminism, anti-racism, Palestinian solidarity, and queer liberation. I researched this history by digging through archive boxes at NYU's Tamiment Archives, interviewing seven former members, reading every relevant book I could get my hands on, and asking every Jewish activist I met what they remembered about NJA. In 2006, I turned that research into a website to make the information publicly available.  Now, I'm asking for your help to publish a book that can be passed from hand-to-hand to share this crucial people's history of progressive Jewish activism.

The Impact

This book will be published in the Spring of 2012, in collaboration with a small literary press called Thread Makes Blanket and printed by progressive, woman-owned 1984 Printing. The book includes a few original NJA documents and afterword essays by historian/activist Dr. Rachel Mattson and Jews for Racial and Economic Justice board member Daniel Lang/Levitsky. The book will be about 150 pages, standard size (5.5 x 8.5) with original woodcut cover art by Abigail Miller.  Praise for the book is already coming in from reviewers - check it out!

We're printing 1,000 copies, and raising money to pay for printing costs up front by using indiegogo to pre-sell books and posters and other perks.

We are also producing a Celebrate People's History Poster in collaboration with cover-artist Abigail Miller and justseeds Artist Cooperative - check out our poster-in-progress below!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's our estimate of initial project costs:
  • Printing + shipping costs for 1,000 books: $3,000
  • Printing + shipping costs for 1,000 posters: $750
  • Mailing Costs for pre-sold books and posters: $750

The total project budget is around $7,000. Our fundraising goal is $4,000 to have funds up-front for printing costs and shipping for the pre-orders. If we don't meet our goal, we'll have to come up with the printing funds out of pocket, and as a bunch of low-income activists, that means the project will take much longer to produce. If we raise more than $4,000 - even better! The big goal is to get these books and posters out into the world so if a ton of the books are pre-ordered, we'll put any profits towards a second printing!

PLEASE NOTE: Donation amounts including shipping/handling costs.
Downloadable book availability is estimated Feb 15, Books/Posters/etc mailing date is estimated April 15.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word! Please share this fundraising page with your networks. Do you know people that were part of NJA? Let them know about this book or give it to them as a gift! Spread the word to progressives and activists in your life - this history is not only relevant to Jews, but all who work for justice and think about how movements build, evolve, and transform our world. 

  • Are you interested in bulk-ordering (10 or more copies) or helping with distribution? Let us know! 
  • Want to set up an event or book-reading at your organization, synagogue, school, hillel, or chevruta? Let us know! We plan to do initial book-release events in Philly and the Mid-Atlantic region in April or May, and traveling for more events in June-September. 

       

(images shown are design-in-progress cover art and poster by Abigail Miller)

story:
"Todos tenemos un compromiso ético con el otro, sobre todo cuando está en juego la vida" Hna. Olga

(English version below)

La hermana Olga Ruiz, costarricense y misionera Comboniana, trabajó 12 años como enfermera en Teticha, Etiopía.  Ella es testigo de las innumerables situaciones de necesidad en el campo de la salud, principalmente en el área de la niñez.  

En enero regresa a trabajar a este país con un solo fin en mente: construir una consulta de puericultura* para luchar contra las altas tasas de mortalidad infantil del lugar.

Con este proyecto recaudaremos los fondos para que esta consulta sea un motor de vida y esperanza para miles de niños del lugar y sus alrededores. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtenés

  • Necesitamos $20.000 para todo el material y mano de obra que conlleva construir esta consulta y adquirir el equipo médico necesario.
  • Como te contábamos la hermana Olga ya ha trabajado anteriormente en este lugar, este proyecto se insertará dentro de la Clínica de Teticha con la tribu Sidamo, cerca de Hawassa. Lugar en el que ella ya trabajó y a dónde volverá a inicios del 2015.  Esto es de gran ventaja porque ya se cuenta con el lugar y el respaldo para iniciar esta conusulta. Ahora sólo falta nuestro aporte.
"Teniendo la experiencia de ser enferma en Etiopía y Sur Sudán , sentí la necesidad de actualizarme para poder dar un servicio más efectivo.  Así que estoy haciendo una maestría en la Universidad de Costa Rica y mi proyecto de graduación es un modelo de consulta que atienda la necesidad tan grande que enfrenta la niñez en África, específicamente en la zona de Teticha, Etiopía". Hermana Olga

Sabías que:

    • Se estima que 200 millones de niños y niñas en países en desarrollo no llegan a alcanzar su máximo potencial.  De esos niños, 89 millones habitan en diez países, entre ellos se encuentra Etiopía (Series Lancet, 2007).
    • En el África Subsahariana más de 12.000 niños de 0 a 5 años mueren todos los días por causas prevenibles o que son tratables. Etiopía es parte de esta zona de África. La muerte es causada especialmente por desnutrición, enfermedades infecciosas y causas neonatales (Series Lancet, 2007). 
    • De acuerdo a la Organización Mundial de la Salud, Etiopía se encuentra entre los 10 países que tienen mayor índice de mortalidad infantil.

¡Convertite en constructor de esperanza!

También podés colaborar:

  • Contándole a quienes te rodean sobre este proyecto.
  • Sensibilizando sobre como es deber de todos luchar contra la mortalidad infantil.  
  • Buscando nuevos donadores que se unan a esta causa.

*Puericultura es la ciencia que estudia el crecimiento de los niños en una cultura determinada, en el que se involucra a las personas cercanas en el cuido, detectando situaciones de vulnerabilidad a tiempo y así reducir la cantidad de muertes.

English version:

“We all have an ethical commitment with one another, especially when life is at risk”. Sister Olga
Sister Olga Ruiz, born in Costa Rica became a Combonian Missionary and has worked for 12 years as a nurse in Teticha, Ethiopia. She has witness the never ending situations of need that arise in this location, particularly health issues, with children mostly.
She will return this January to that country with only one goal in mind, to build a childcare consult in order to fight the high mortality rates of the country.
This project seeks to gather the funds to make this consult a reality, one that will bring life and hope to thousands of children from that location and its surroundings.


How you can help and what you can get

We need a total of $20.000 in order to get the complete materials and labor costs for this consult and to acquire the proper medical equipment. As you already know, Sister Olga has already worked in this place, so this project will be inserted in the previously existing clinic; this means that the land and the Clinic’s approval are already a reality. The only thing that is missing is our support.

“As I was having the experience of being a Nurse in Ethiopia and South Sudan, I felt the urge to update my knowledge so I could give a more effective service. That is why I am getting a Master’s Degree from Universidad de Costa Rica and my graduation project is to build a consult model that can take in the huge needs that African children have to face, especially in the region of Teticha, Ethiopia” Sister Olga

Did you know that:

It is estimated that: 
  • 200 millions of boys and girls in developing countries never get to reach their real body potencial in terms of height, weight, health related factors… From those children, 89 millions live in 10 specific countries, one of those countries is Ethiopia. (Series Lancet, 2007)
  • In the Subsaharian Africa more than 12.000 children of 0 to 5 years old die every day because of preventable causes or treatable ones. Ethiopia is located in this region of Africa. Death is caused mainly because of malnutrition, infectious illnesses and neonatal causes. (Series Lancet, 2007)
  • According to the WHO (World Health Organization) Ethiopia is among the 10 countries with the highest children mortality rate. 

Let’s build this together

You can also contribute
  • Telling others about this project
  • Spread the word about the importance of fighting children mortality. 
  • Help us find new donors that want to join this cause

story:
What is HANDS?

HANDS is a print-only newspaper - a real, old-man-in-the-park-reading-on-a-bench, newspaper - with the goal of providing a snapshot of local culture through the lens of ordinary people in the thick of it all. Featuring writing, photography, illustrations and more, HANDS is the joint effort of family, friends and friends of friends with a common desire to showcase their work...but more importantly showcase their thoughts, beliefs, and hearts in physical form.

What We Need & What You Get

Some say print is dead. We say it isn't dead...but it does cost money!

  • We are looking to raise $6,000 to cover costs for the first Volume of HANDS - taking us from March 2018 through December 2018. 
  • By contributing to HANDS you will 1) help create something special from the ground up and 2) receive some cool perks that include but aren't limited to special thank you videos, year long subscriptions, shout outs in upcoming issues and more.
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, the funds we raise here will help offset costs...because HANDS is coming out no matter what!

The Impact

Your contribution matters:

  • Everyone who is part of HANDS is volunteering their time and content.
  • We can't pay anyone for their work but with your help, we can make sure their work is seen by the world.

Risks & Challenges

$6,000 will help us get jump-started but it won't last forever:

  • The ultimate goal for HANDS is to develop enough revenue from partnerships with local vendors via advertising and content creation.
  • But to get there we need to develop a product, a following and a track record. So we'll be using this campaign to help build our case to potential advertisers on why they should be part of HANDS.

Other Ways You Can Help

If money just isn't your thing...:

  • Reach out to us about being a content contributor!
  • Help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with people who might say "Hey, money is totally my thing!"

Who are the founders?

Whatsup!

  • Chelsea Trout is a New York native, and truly the definition of an indecisive idealist. She is endlessly inspired and lead by what she sees in forms of photography, illustrations, movies, and TV and what she reads in books, comics, and The New Yorker. She is the heart of the operation because she embodies the idea of acting before you think. With a background in creative writing, photojournalism, and media she brings the visual aesthetic to Hands.
  • Arpan Somani is a New Yorker at his core — all business, grit, and charisma. He sees a vision, sets a goal, and makes it happen. He's driven by his ideas, and impassioned by the idea of working with creators, dreamers, and doers. He's the decision-maker, the reality-checker, and the independent thinker. He's the head of the operation because he keeps all of his affairs grounded. With a background in music business, partnerships, and artist management he brings the structure and formation to Hands.
