story:
¿Qué?

Los sueños viajan en tren aspira a ofrecerte un buen momento de lectura capaz de alejar el tedio del día a día. 

10.03 horas de la mañana. El Acela 2154, uno de los diecinueve trenes que unen diariamente Nueva York y Boston, parte puntualmente de Penn Station. Es 19 de marzo de 2017. El último día del invierno. Alicia, Valen, Fabián y Manuel, llegados desde distintos rincones del mundo, coinciden en un extremo del vagón número cinco. Lo que comienza siendo una conversación casual con los compañeros de asiento se convertirá en un intercambio de pesares, sueños y esperanzas que hará que el trayecto hasta Boston se convierta en el viaje más importante de sus vidas.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Sara Barrena.

Doctora en Filosofía por la Universidad de Navarra, donde coordina las actividades de investigación del Grupo de Estudios Peirceanos. Es autora de diversas publicaciones sobre pragmatismo, creatividad y estética, entre las que destacan los libros La razón creativa (Rialp), Pragmatismo y educación (Antonio Machado) y La belleza en Charles S. Peirce: origen y alcance de sus ideas estéticas (Ediciones Universidad de Navarra).

Desde hace años compagina su actividad investigadora y filosófica con la dedicación a la escritura creativa. Ha publicado un libro de cuentos, Desde el corazón (Huerga y Fierro), y la novela Mi vida según Martín (Edebé). En 2005 publicó Venida de la lluvia. Historia de una adopción internacional, su libro más vendido y ―sin duda― también el más querido, un conmovedor relato sobre la adopción de su hija Sara Yulai, que, en una lejana ciudad del sur de China, comenzó a hacer posible la aventura más creativa de todas, la maternidad.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«La mirada de Valen se extravía otra vez. En el quinto vagón dos hombres, dos mujeres y un bebé guardan un silencio expectante. Quizá solo el bebé sabe, con la seguridad del ser el dueño de todos los secretos del mundo, los que luego perdemos al crecer, que algo está a punto de revelarse.
     —Hablo con los muertos. Tuve que aprender —dice Valen, en voz muy baja. Las palabras salen por la ventana. Atraviesan el cristal.
     En el alma de Alicia, algo camina de puntillas»

«Don Ángel sabía decir las dos frases que más le habían ayudado en su vida. Te comprendo y te quiero. Cuando recibía sus cartas, renacía. Otro salvavidas en el buzón. Cada día es una epopeya. Hay que sobrevivir. Cada día un desembarco, una batalla, las Termópilas, Maratón, San Quintín, Salamina. Normandía, la Guerra de los Treinta Años, o la de los Cien.
     Estamos en una travesía por el desierto. Sin agua. Pero sobreviviremos.
     Don Ángel enseñó a Valen a buscar señales. Los regalos. Sácales fotos, le decía. Y mándamelas. Marcos le regalaba trozos de arcoiris y un poco de fe. Valen enviaba cartas con las fotos. Don Ángel Valencia Salazar, Catedral de la Inmaculada Concepción. Barichara, Colombia. Y llegaba por correo aéreo un lagarto amarillo y sonriente. Una mariposa con alas de lunares. Una morsa gigante y barbuda. También dragones marinos.
     Todos le preguntaban por Marcos. Todos los peces, los pájaros, el azul del mar y todas las notas de la escala musical, desde el Do hasta el Si»

«Hay mujeres que nunca se rinden.
     Valen siguió adelante. Al llegar la primavera compró miramelindos en Gary Page, en la calle 28. Un día, sin saber cómo, se dio cuenta de que estaba volviendo al mundo cotidiano, aquel en el que habitaban las demás personas. La losa que llevaba encima pesaba un poquito menos, aunque fuese solo unos gramos que hacían más ligera la carga. Marcos la acompañaba siempre, y su presencia era por fin alegre. Quizás había vencido al invierno con las tropas de don Ángel.
     Hay que saber esperar. Estate atenta a la eternidad. No te despistes»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Los sueños viajan en tren que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sara Barrena vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?
Los sueños viajan en tren aspira a ofrecerte un buen momento de lectura capaz de alejar el tedio del día a día. 
10.03 horas de la mañana. El Acela 2154, uno de los diecinueve trenes que unen diariamente Nueva York y Boston, parte puntualmente de Penn Station. Es 19 de marzo de 2017. El último día del invierno. Alicia, Valen, Fabián y Manuel, llegados desde distintos rincones del mundo, coinciden en un extremo del vagón número cinco. Lo que comienza siendo una conversación casual con los compañeros de asiento se convertirá en un intercambio de pesares, sueños y esperanzas que hará que el trayecto hasta Boston se convierta en el viaje más importante de sus vidas.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Sara Barrena.
Doctora en Filosofía por la Universidad de Navarra, donde coordina las actividades de investigación del Grupo de Estudios Peirceanos. Es autora de diversas publicaciones sobre pragmatismo, creatividad y estética, entre las que destacan los libros La razón creativa (Rialp), Pragmatismo y educación (Antonio Machado) y La belleza en Charles S. Peirce: origen y alcance de sus ideas estéticas (Ediciones Universidad de Navarra).

story:
Praise for Russell Rowland

This heartfelt exploration of the lives and hard times of a prairie ranch family fairly pulses with the intrigues of existence. Russell Rowland has given us a vivid and distinctive piece of homespun to take its proper place in the literary quilt of the West.

Ivan Doig, National Book Award winner, This House of Sky

Fifty-Six Counties, a book I read with pleasure and admiration, is a great companion for those who already love Montana and for those anxious to get a real sense of the place without the salesmanship."

 --  Tom McGuane, author of The Cadence of Grass and Gallatin Canyon

Russell Rowland is fiercely devoted to the atonement and beauty that are the hallmarks of all great works of art.  Rowland names our collective loneliness, but does so with a fierce and tender devotion to the mothers and fathers of all races, all cultures.  Fifty-Six Counties is animated by the numinous even as it humbles us, makes us more sane, and draws us into a new and invigorating experience of the essence of life. This is a book for Montana, for the nation, and for the world." 

-- Shann Ray, Author of American Masculine, Balefire, and American Copper

I can’t wait for others to discover this book. Thoughtful, wise, funny, sincere, and deep: those are the words that come to mind when reading this treasure. Rowland is a humble observer, but he’s also willing to dig deep and bravely, offering astute reflections on the state, its resources, its peoples, its history, and its charm and its dangers. In a voice all his own, Rowland proves to be warm and personable, and yet cutting and real—basically, one couldn’t wish for a better guide to the state of Montana. This book is utterly unique. A gorgeous accomplishment.

-- Laura Pritchett, author of Stars Go Blue

Everything about Montana is big: its proverbial sky, its mountains, its wide open spaces. And yet, Russell Rowland has managed to capture all that grand landscape--and the people who inhabit it--into the intimacy of a single book. Fifty-Six Counties is a remarkable book: a macro-focused narrative using a wide-angle lens. If you have room for only one book about Montana on your shelf, make it this one.

  -- David Abrams, author of Fobbit and Brave Deeds

Charged with dramatic tension -- a joy to read.

   -Ha Jin, author of Waiting, winner of the National Book Award

"[An] outstanding debut...Rowland's examination of family dynamics is poignant and revealing...."

 -Publishers Weekly (starred review)

"A family epic that has a muted elegance....A gracefully understated novel."

-New York Times Book Review

"In Open Spaces is sage, humane, and immensely readable."

 -C. Michael Curtis, senior editor, “The Atlantic Monthly”

"A heartfelt debut...[An] unpretentious, involving story told with unfaltering authority."

-Kirkus Reviews

"As a lifelong reader of books written about the west, particularly those about Montana, Russell Rowland's In Open Spaces is as good as it gets....a powerful book."

 -C.J. Box, author of Open Season and Savage Run

Like Norman McLean's A River Runs Through It,...Rowland...brings [Montana's] unique beauty alive....

 -Denver Post 

Richly and intimately told, High and Inside is a raucous tragicomedy, infused with the desire we all feel in the face of our greatest mistakes: to somehow win redemption, no matter how large our flaws.

--Kim Barnes, author of In the Kingdom of Men

At times funny, at times tragic, often wise and always moving, this wonderful novel is a grand slam of indelible characters and infectious drama, and a flat-out great read."

--Alan Heathcock, author of Volt

Arbuckle and The Difference Between Us

When you find yourself in the position of having many wonderful friends, including writers you greatly admire, tell you that the work you’re doing is important (and even good!), but every overture you make toward agents and major publishers is met with a solid chorus of cricket noises, you basically have three choices:

  1. Whine incessantly to your friends about the publishing business and how unfairly you are being treated.
  2. Spend way too many hours obsessing about writers who are simply not very good but who have made a fortune from their books.
  3. Somehow find a way to take control of your own career trajectory.

 

Monty, is it possible to pick all three doors, you may ask? Yes, it is. But I’m going to break out of the first two and focus on number three. So I have two finished novels, and because I have kind, generous, talented friends in the world of ‘small’ publishing, I have some options to help me get them out into the world. The problem is that I will need to help with design and production costs. So…I have created this Indigogo fund to help pay for those costs. This is essentially preselling my books, because if you donate, you will receive signed copies of several of my books. I’m offering a few different packages.

The first of the new novels is called Arbuckle, and it’s the prequel to In Open Spaces, so it forms the third leg of the trilogy of the Arbuckle family, with the sequel being The Watershed Years. Arbuckle is the story of the meeting and early years of the marriage between George Arbuckle, a wagon boss for a big cattle outfit, and Catherine Boland, the first woman to own a business in Belle Fourche, South Dakota. An early tragedy in their marriage puts a strain on their relationship, especially when Catherine decides to make the incident public, against George's wishes. 

 

The second novel, The Difference Between Us, is the story of a murder that takes place in a small ranching community. A new family moves into the community, and on their first day of school, the young boy from this family gets into a fight with another boy, hitting him with a bat. That evening, Tom Butcher, a powerful but controversial rancher in the region, stops by the new family's house to warn the father about making a bad first impression. Later that evening, Tom is murdered, beaten to death by a baseball bat, which immediately draws suspicion on thenew man. But as the events unfold, we learn that many people in the community had reason to want Tom Butcher dead, and there is another twist, in that during the course of the investigation, sheriffs realize that Tom was actually a cross-dresser.

What Russell Needs & What You Get

As an incentive to contribute to this campaign, you will be receiving signed copies of Russell's books. There are several options. 

  • Russell needs to raise at least $5000 to help finance the development and production of these novels, as well as the promotion.
  • Your contribution will net you signed copies of one or more of Russell's books, shipped directly to you.

The Impact

If Russell is able to meet this goal, he hopes to release both Arbuckle and The Difference Between Us in the next year. It's been two years since Russell had a new book published, so his fans are eager to see something new. 

Risks & Challenges

If Russell does not reach his goal, he will still find a way to get these books published, so you will still receive your reward. It will probably just take longer. But for Russell's last book, Fifty-Six Counties, a Kickstarter campaign raised $7000, so it's likely he will reach his goal and you'll be able to receive your copies of his books in the next year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass along this information to friends of yours who are avid readers, especially fans of Montana literature. Russell could use all the help he can get.

story:
Great Science Fiction seeking wider audience

My name is Michael Brachman and I am a science fiction writer. My books are doing well but I get a lot of requests for the books in audio book format. I have contracted with a professional recording studio to record my first novel, Rome's Revolution, as an audio book but unfortunately they want to be paid to do this.

In the modern world, people are so busy that they don't have time to just sit and relax and read a really exciting, robust novel for hours at a time. They want to have the book loaded on their iPhone or iPad or on CDs so they can listen while they drive or work. When recorded, the 167,000 word novel Rome's Revolution will take about 18 hours to enjoy. 

Here is a synopsis of the book:

Rome's Revolution chronicles the adventures of Rei Bierak, a twenty-something male from the very near future. Rei, along with 542 other humans, is frozen and launched in the Ark II toward the stars with the hope of establishing a colony on a habitable world in the Tau Ceti system. During Rei's long trip, modern civilization has collapsed, and society has reformed into a decidedly different model. The 24-chromosome mind-connected humans of the future called the Vuduri are efficient, indifferent, and emotionally deficient. The Vuduri have conquered faster-than-light travel and have established an outpost in the Pi3 Orionis system (aka Tabit) to study why certain stars are disappearing. Awakening 1388 years in the future, Rei meets Rome, a beautiful half-breed Vuduri woman, who is eventually ostracized for consorting with him. Rei and Rome are joined by OMCOM, a super-computer with delusions of omnipotence. Together, they fend off a hostile society, saboteurs, and technology indistinguishable from magic. The fate of humanity, perhaps even life itself, hangs in the balance.

Sound exciting? Interesting? You can read more about it at the Rome's Revolution Website. Would you like to listen to this as an audio book? Well here is your chance to help.

What's it going to take to get this done?

The studio wants $3600 to professionally record and produce the novel as an audio book. They will be using a professional voice artist. It will take an additional $1000 or so to get a cover made, CDs stamped and market the book. After accounting for the fees it takes to fund this drive and the cost of the perks, it comes to about $5000.

Some of the perks being offered are truly unique. For example, you can get personally signed copies of the entire Rome's Revolution trilogy. One perk lets you name a character, describe their characteristics and they will be integrated in the upcoming novel The Vuduri Knight which will be released late this year.

I am committed to doing this so any funds raised will be used to help defray the costs. Whether I reach my goal or not, the money will go to the studio and production costs.

Other ways you can help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help by sharing news about this campaign with your friends and family.  If you are electronic in nature, that means Twitter, Facebook, Instagram even email. Word of mouth can't hurt. Indiegogo provides many tools for you to share this campaign so take advantage of them.

By the way, if you want to check out my other books, you can read about them on my "umbrella" web site MichaelBrachman.com. Thanks for looking.

One perk lets you name a character, describe their characteristics and they will be integrated in the upcoming novel The Vuduri Knight which will be released late this year.
I am committed to doing this so any funds raised will be used to help defray the costs. Whether I reach my goal or not, the money will go to the studio and production costs.

Other ways you can help
Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help by sharing news about this campaign with your friends and family.  If you are electronic in nature, that means Twitter, Facebook, Instagram even email. Word of mouth can't hurt. Indiegogo provides many tools for you to share this campaign so take advantage of them.
By the way, if you want to check out my other books, you can read about them on my "umbrella" web site MichaelBrachman.com. Thanks for looking.

story:
Short Summary

What pops into your mind when someone talks about God?  What if I told you that God might not be like what you learned in church?  What if I said you could have a relationship with Him that is both deeply intimate and wonderfully creative?  In my book Formed in Secret, I share my journey with God into a life of love and wonder that may well be a whole new revelation of who God can be in your life.  

Perhaps you have already experienced how really enjoyable knowing God can be, and your life has been forever changed by the love of Jesus.  Whether you have questions about God, and would like to see if there is journey to discover in Him that you have never imagined, or you have come into a place of intimacy and you would like to see if there is a way to go even deeper, my hope is the Formed in Secret would stir something in you that inspires you to find out who God really is for you.  


What We Need & What You Get

At this point I am under contract with a great Christian publisher called Creation House.  We are into the editing process and developing my original manuscript into a publishable format.  

I have already raised the money needed for the original deposit with the publisher through more grass-roots, person-to-person fund raising, but still need funds to complete this project.  I am looking for help from people who feel this book might be helpful to them on their personal journey, and from people who are passionate about who God is in their lives, and feel that this book can help people discover a path to greater depths in Jesus.  

Even if we do not reach the goal of $6,000.00, which will cover the remainder of the contract cost and shipping costs for the book, whatever money we do raise will go toward the cost of this book's publication and distribution.  And for anyone who contributes a minimum of $15.00 to this work we will send you a copy of the book once it's finished.      


The Impact

I think the best way to share the impact I believe my book can have is for you to read some endorsements from people who have already had a chance to read it:

There is no “formula” to successful Christian living. But one trait stands out among those who are accessing the grace to engage God's promises as a daily reality: identity. Who He is, and who He created each of us to be. Sean Harvey understands this as one who truly has been formed in secret. In this timely book, he shares many Biblical truths that spring to life when described by a man clearly overtaken by the love and affection of his Heavenly Father through all of life's circumstances. Every time I read, I am more encouraged in my understanding of God’s sovereign plan, and my created value. You will be too!

Mike Massé

Pastor and author of #iamholy


Formed in Secret will take you on a journey of spiritual transformation as you experience the passion and transparency of Sean’s walk with the Lord.  It will challenge you to think outside of the box called religion and cause you to dig deeper into the areas of your life that have been held captive.  Sean’s story will inspire you to live a life surrendered to the Lover of your soul and will ignite your heart to be consumed by the only relationship that can unlock your God-given identity.

Cindi Korman

Pastoral Care and Deliverance Ministry

King of Kings Worship Center, Basking Ridge, NJ 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel you can help with this project, or simply don't have the money to contribute, we would very much appreciate anyone who is willing to share this and get the word out in any way you can.  
We also covet your prayers, and any words of encouragement, as this work comes to completion and my wife and I tackle the task, along with the publisher, of marketing this book. 
Thanks again for checking out our story!  God bless.

story:
Short Summary

In October 2012, I became unemployed. As terrifying as that was, I realized that it was an opportunity to change my life for the better. My last few jobs left me feeling empty and miserable, and I always knew there was more out there for me. As a writer and a voracious reader, I dreamed of getting into the publishing business. Call it luck, call it fate, call it perfect timing or whatever you choose... but a friend who owned a small press was looking to move on to other adventures in her own life. She approached me with an idea. And here I am, taking over a small press with a good reputation that I have much bigger plans for in the future. This is my dream. Help me achieve it and forever change my life.
 

What We Need & What You Get

While the company is established and comes with a great catalog already, there are a few start-up costs that I have to absorb. Being unemployed, this is going to be a challenge for me, to say the least. I have a fixed income that doesn't give me much wiggle room for extras. I'm not one to give up though and hope that starting this company will help me achieve greater financial success. I have no doubt it will be self-sustaining in the near future, I just have to get over this initial hurdle.

Some of these start-up costs include purchasing ISBN numbers, the cost of printing new books, the cost of setting up the business itself as well as necessary supplies/programs to start off strong.

ISBNs come in bundles of 10 for $250, or bundles of 100 for $575. Currently, I am looking to start off with the bundle of 10 and growing from there, but if I raise enough, it would be worth it to start off with a larger bundle. They are more affordable per ISBN and would save me money in the long term. 

I'm also looking at purchasing an affordable refurbished desktop PC to replace my worn out seven year old Mac laptop. This helps me be more efficient with my day-to-day business activities. I have some of the programs needed to work on cover art and so forth, but they are all for PC and will not work on my Mac. Others I may need to purchase if I am able to.  I've already priced refurbished PCs and believe this should cost me no more than $200-300. I'm a frugal girl by nature and have looked around to find the best deals possible. I will not be looking to buy top-of-the-line anything, just a standard desktop PC to help me conduct my business with ease.

In addition, I'd like to raise funds to get started on the cover designs, editing and marketing of the first two books I will be releasing. This will ensure that I hit the ground running and produce products that maintain Fey's dedication to quality books.

Anthologies

I've already started accepting submissions for two anthologies listed here. Fey Publishing will always look to promote nontraditional heroes, and we are a LGBT friendly publishing company. We look to publish books that include characters that are LGBT. We also want to promote strong female characters and will always look for books/short stories that include them. This is a something I'm very passionate about. 

If I surpass my goal, I can pay cover artists to design these covers as well as pay authors a small payment to be included within the books. 


$1 E-Book Promotion!


From now until the end of the campaign, I have many great e-books that have been donated to my campaign and I'm offering them for $1 each. Or 6 for $5 and 12 for $10. Plus you get the perks, entered into the raffles... so A lot of good stuff for the money. There's everything from romance to horror, YA to mainstream fiction. There's truly something for everyone there. Please check out my page for more details and a list of the books.


Perks

Several perks are my products. Kevin Saito has published his book of shorts, From the Edge of Darkness, with Fey already. In his first collection of short stories, Kevin Saito presents you with thirteen terrifying and macabre tales that will make the shadows around you seem much darker and the movement in the corner of your eye infinitely more sinister. In "Tending the Flock," you will see the lengths that faith and devotion will drive a man to. "Tiebreaker" shows what happens when your family turns out to not be who - or what - you thought they were. Logic and reason only takes you so far in "Proof Positive" while in "One Shot Deal," you'll discover what desperation really looks like. Terrifying legends, paranormal horrors and the dark depths of human depravity... All of this and more awaits you within the pages of "From the Edge of Darkness." So step up, gaze into the abyss and see if the abyss truly does gaze back at you.

We are also publishing his debut novel. His first book was met with rave reviews, and he kindly offered up both his books as perks for the campaign. He's offering up advanced copies of his upcoming novel. 

Shattered Honor is a dark psychological thriller. Danny Perkins returns home from Afghanistan, a broken man scarred by the horrors of war in the grips of a deep depression and dark, violent urges. He is haunted by the memories of the thing he witnessed and the things he was forced to do in the name of country and duty. As he struggles to piece his life and his fraying relationship with his girlfriend Shannon back together, he is inevitably drawn toward a dark path in which he must confront his past to reclaim his life and his future.

I'm also offering up my own writing. I will offer up a PDF version of my shorts, which are a variety of stories already written. There is everything from gritty horror to cutesy fairy tales and everything in between. I primarily write dark speculative fiction that features strong female characters in the starring role. You may read a sample of my work at my personal website (http://www.kristenduvall.com).

A few friends have also offered perks for my campaign, which I am eternally grateful for them doing so. Please take the time to check out their pages if you can. 

The following items are limited in quanity and will be updated as they run out. If you're interested, please get them while you can. There's only one of each item available.

Professional editor Rogena Mitchell-Jones has offered up editing for a 5-10K document. Please visit her websitefor more details. 

Sophie Childs, former owner and editor of Fey Publishing, has also offered to do a personalized story. You will get to pick the title and she will write the story for you.


No longer available! Sorry guys, it was snatched up! Author Kate Allen has offered two wonderful options. For those living in the United States, she will send you three dozen of her famous Russian Tea Cookies. If you are not in the U.S, or you just prefer books over sweets, then you may also get a signed copy of her forthcoming book Life. Love. Liturgy. You may read about her book here: http://www.lifeloveliturgy.com.

No longer available! Sorry guys, it was snatched up! Thellies Jewelry, Etc has donated a $20 credit to be used in her shop to purchase jewelry or to go toward a custom order. Most of her items are around $20, so this could mean a getting a piece of jewerly from her shop for half price.

No longer available! Sorry guys, it was snatched up! Author A.D Sams (writer of Bayou L'Abeille which was put out through Fey Publishing) is offering a personal fairy tale that she will write for the person who chooses that perk.

No longer available! Sorry guys, it was snatched up! Ninette Swan has kindly offered up one electronic copy of her new dystopian romance novel, "Direct Contact". Ninette is a very talented and well established romance writer, and her latest novel combines romance with science fiction for something truly unique. You can read more about the book on her website: http://www.ninetteswann.com/

No longer available! Sorry guys, it was snatched up! Author Elizabeth Hawksworth has offered a copy of her book, "Break for Beauty" (which can be found here: http://www.amazon.com/Break-for-Beauty-ebook/dp/B009JVMENW). She's also kindly offered to write a personalzed story for someone that will be included in her upcoming book. Her next book will showcase historic photos of Toronto and tell fictional stories about each one. I've read some of the pieces going into it and it's going to be a great book.

Alternate Plans

If I don't reach full funding by the end of the campaign, the company is still going to move forward as planned. I will focus my attention on acquiring ISBNs and printing costs first and foremost. Beyond that, the additional money will be used to hire both an editor and an artist to help present a professional quality book.

There are also fees that Indiegogo takes out that I'm also looking to cover in the amount requested.

 

The Impact

I'm a very strong willed and ambitious woman. When I put my mind to something, I find ways to make it happen. I grew up in poverty and still fought my way through college and graduate school, against all odds and working my butt off to pay for it. When I decided I wanted to move across the country to California, I made it happen within two weeks and all by myself. I've always dreamed of owning my own publishing company, and I am making that happen right now. I am forging a new life for myself, one step at a time. I don't have to just live life on fast forward, wishing away my days because I hate what I do. I want to love what I do. I love books. I love writing. And I love promoting people and helping them succeed. The idea of finding new talent and helping launch their careers is something that brings me immense joy.

That's the thing with Fey, I don't plan on making it benefit just me. I want to find new talent, writers that haven't been published before but who have the skill to create something beautiful.  I'm not looking to stick with the mainstream, I want to find new voices and fresh stories that the world can appreciate. I want to help the writers I work with and help build their careers up so they also can one day enjoy doing what they love most and getting paid for it as well.

After all, life is too short to constantly be wasting the days we have, wishing for Friday. We should all be so lucky as to do something that makes us happy and fulfilled. Not only do I aim to find that, I aim to help others find that as well.

As mentioned above, the company already comes with a wonderful catalog. I'm very proud to working with these fine authors and want to make sure I can get their books in the hands of as many readers as possible. More will be added as I talk to each author about what they'd like to include about themselves.

Alison Rogers - In Darkness and Light

Tracy Evans - The Chalice and The Blood Crown (The first two books in the Vampire Relics Trilogy. The third in the series will likely be the first book I put out through Fey Publishing).

Bill Kte'pi - Low Country

Nicole Berman - Home

A.D Sams - Bayou L'Abeille

Kevin Saito - From the Edge of Darkness

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand times are tough for most of us. I've tried contributing to several campaigns and sometimes could only give a little or merely just spread the word to hopefully get others to donate. Every little bit helps me. No gesture is too small and I will be eternally grateful for all your support.

Even if you can't donate money at this time,  there are still ways to help if you'd like. For example, if you're someone who is able to do so, you could donate a perk. Perks can be books you've written (both electronic and physical copies), artwork, baked goods... you name it. I'm willing to offer up a "Thank You" section in the first anthology as well as on Fey's website to anyone who donates a perk. If you own a business and trying to sell your product, I'm happy to promote you as well. I'm all about finding ways to help each other out.

If there's nothing you can contribute at this time, even simply sharing my campaign with others would mean the world to me. The more people that hear of my campaign, the more likely I am to reach my goal. I appreciate any and all support you can offer me at this time, even if it's simply sharing it on your Facebook or blog. Thank you for all your support.

Bill Kte'pi - Low Country
Nicole Berman - Home 
A.D Sams - Bayou L'Abeille 
Kevin Saito - From the Edge of Darkness
 


Other Ways You Can Help
I understand times are tough for most of us. I've tried contributing to several campaigns and sometimes could only give a little or merely just spread the word to hopefully get others to donate. Every little bit helps me. No gesture is too small and I will be eternally grateful for all your support.
Even if you can't donate money at this time,  there are still ways to help if you'd like. For example, if you're someone who is able to do so, you could donate a perk. Perks can be books you've written (both electronic and physical copies), artwork, baked goods... you name it. I'm willing to offer up a "Thank You" section in the first anthology as well as on Fey's website to anyone who donates a perk. If you own a business and trying to sell your product, I'm happy to promote you as well. I'm all about finding ways to help each other out.
If there's nothing you can contribute at this time, even simply sharing my campaign with others would mean the world to me. The more people that hear of my campaign, the more likely I am to reach my goal. I appreciate any and all support you can offer me at this time, even if it's simply sharing it on your Facebook or blog. Thank you for all your support.

story:
Why We're Here

We—a group of one hundred women and non-binary writers—love bringing fresh, varied comics criticism and culture commentary to you. From fashion, to sex, to family, to discrimination, to geek culture, we speak frankly about all aspects of women’s lives. 

And we love what we do. We love it so much, in fact, that we’re all doing this for free! Currently we’re members of a small advertising network, but our ad revenue pays for site hosting and administrative costs, and that’s it. But we want WWAC to grow. We’re looking for funds to dramatically increase our reach and pay our hard-working writers. Our ultimate goal is to become a self-sustaining, independent publishing company.

That’s a pretty big goal! But we’re confident that with your support, we can get there.

Who We Are

WWAC is a group of geeky, feminist writers lead by Megan Purdy, Editor-In-Chief,  Wendy Browne and Claire Napier, Assistant Editors, Amanda Vail, Marketing Manager, and Section Editors Laura Harcourt, Kayleigh Hearn, Desiree Rodriguez, Al Rosenberg, Christa Seeley, and Ginnis Tonik.

We’re a good bet. As it is, Women Write About Comics has grown fast. We’re just three and a half years old, and already we’ve raised awareness and fostered change toward a diverse, inclusive industry. Just what have we done? Check out this list:

  • We provide critical analysis of controversial issues

  • We examine fashion and character design in relation to representation and presentation

  • We promote health and positive body image

  • We share tips on geek crafting, cooking, and parenting

  • We call out and discuss harassment and questionable practices

  • We shed light and support upon illness

  • We don’t let comics writers get away with transphobia (again, and again)

  • We speak openly about insecurity and abuse

  • We discuss the history of racist casting in Hollywood (often!)

  • We call out white privilege and the silencing of marginalized voices

  • We present problems with queer representation in comics and other media

  • We aren’t afraid to criticize popular industry icons

We’re proud of all that we’ve done so far. Right now, we have many wonderful staff writers and contributors, not to mention editors, copyeditors, and the leadership team. Many, many thanks to all of our staff and contributors for their hard work and dedication!

What We Need

To realize our goals, we need your support. And by your support, we mean your financial support. Today, we’re asking you to back us. Chip in your dollars, pounds, and cents so that we can build a bigger, better Women Write About Comics. In return, we promise to not only continue bringing you stellar content every day, but we promise to grow.

Our highest priority is being able to pay our writers. However, before we start paying any of writers, we want to be able to pay all of our writers.

How will we do that? We’ve broken our goal into steps, and here they are.

Step One

Here we are, at step one. What we're asking for today is funding that will help us increase our reach and build a loyal audience.

We believe in our content. Not only do we want to bring it to more people, but we need to! We need to get the word out about Women Write About Comics. Unless we build a bigger audience, our revenue stream won’t enable us to begin paying our writers or publishing in print. 

Our first step with accrued funds is going to involve outreach: postcards, posters, online advertisement, and maybe even WWAC tables and sponsored panels at conventions.

We've already started experimenting with postcards - here's one we gave out at FanExpo Canada, and Teen Wolf actor Tyler Hoechlin signed - but we want to do more. 

What's Next?

Step Two: Work with a lawyer to create contracts for our staff and contributors outlining our and their rights to ensure that we all get a fair deal. 

Step Three: Launch a campaign to support our ongoing publishing efforts. 

We’re going to begin our adventure into print publishing. That’s right, 2016 will be the inaugural year of the WWAC zine. Four issues of hard copy content will hit the stands beginning in January. Some of the funds we raise from now until then will be set aside for printing costs. 

We've already started work on our first zine, Blood, edited by Megan Purdy and Claire Napier, and featuring original commentary, fiction, comics, and poetry from Kelly Kanayama, J.A. Micheline, Ginnis Tonik, Sarah Richardson, and Al Rosenberg. 

With the campaign and zine subscriptions along with our increased ad revenue, we will begin to pay our writers. All writers—both contributing and staff, print and online—will be paid for their work.

Step Four: Pay our editors and support staff. 

Once we’ve hit a steady amount of revenue from steps one and two, we’ll refresh our Patreon offerings and begin managing our own online and print advertising. With this, we hope to be able to pay all of our WWAC staff!

Our editors and support staff may often be behind the scenes, but they’re an integral part of bringing our writers’ words to you. Let’s show them some love and pay them for their hard work.

Step Five: Take over comics. 

You knew it was coming, right? What else did you expect from an organization like Women Write About Comics that’s grown so much since our 2012 inception? Look out, world!

Risks & Challenges

We may have broken our trajectory out into steps, but we know growing into a fully fledged publishing house is far from an easy task. But we have a great team with web, zine and book publishing experience, and a lot of determination. 

What we're asking you to fund today is a seed money campaign. We're just getting started. We have designs for our outreach materials and are simply waiting on printing costs. Risks we anticipate running into with this stage are fairly minimal: printing issues, mainly. Because we're an all-volunteer outfit, staff time and energy may mean our projects become delayed, but we do not anticipate anything that would derail them completely. 

Regardless of the timeline of promotional and zine content, our main efforts will continue to go toward bringing you fresh, in-depth articles and reviews on our website. Women Write About Comics is here to stay!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can help! Here are some things you can do:

  • Read and share our content! Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Google+ and other social media channels.
  • Get the word out about our campaign. Whether you like sharing things via social media, email, or in person, please tell others about us and what we're trying to do.
Thank you for reading this! And thank you so much for your support, whatever that support may look like. We appreciate you!

story:
About the book

Between 2012 and 2013 I spent 17 months walking across the United States to raise money for St.Jude Children's Research Hospital. I started my walk on the Santa Monica Pier in Los Angeles, CA on May 7, 2012 and ended in Portland, ME on October 30, 2013. Over that 17 month period I raised $13,000 for St.Jude. 

In the book you'll read about places I walked through, experiences I had, people I met, the challenges of raising money for a cause, how walking across the U.S. changed my life, visiting St.Jude Children's Research Hospital in Memphis, TN, and much more. 

I see this book an opportunity to do something that will have a positive lasting effect on people's lives. What I have decided to do is donate all the proceeds from the book to numerous charitable organizations and schools. Contributing to my Indiegogo campaign and spreading the word will help me to raise a lot of money and help many of those in need.

My Operation:Cheer blog has links to newspaper and TV interviews. On Tripline you can see my route and the states I traveled through. 

• If this campaign reaches $10,000 I will randomly select a campaign contributor and bring them out to Los Angeles for the weekend. We'll go sight seeing, enjoy dining out, and maybe even hang out with rockstars. 
* Available to U.S. residents age 18 and over.

• For every person you refer that selects a perk I will send you a free copy of my as of yet untitled book signed by me. In addition you'll get one of the t-shirts, mugs, or pint glasses. The person must mention your name in the comment section along with information on how to reach you.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $7500 to help the following:

• Hiring an editor.
• Hire a photographer or artist to create the cover.
• Create a music video to accompany the book release.
• Getting the book published and out into the world.
• T-shirts, mugs and or pint glasses.
• Marketing. 

What do you get? Depending on the perk you choose you will receive a copy of the book in multiple formats along, a special thanks in the book, a signed copy, a t-shirt, mug or pint glass, and downloadable Podcasts so you can hear what's going into the book. Not only do you get all those things, you will also get the satisfaction of knowing that by purchasing the book you will be helping charitable organizations and schools for years to come. 

The Impact

Why do I feel you should buy my book. First and foremost the proceeds from the book will go to benefit numerous charitable organizations and schools in poor neighborhoods. Did I also happen to mention that all of the money is getting donated. I'm not keeping one red cent for myself. Walking across America changed my life in more ways than you know. This is my way of paying it forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help if you can't make a monetary contribution? Stand on top of the highest mountain or building and shout, buy Mario's book about walking across America, it's for a good cause(s). Or you can email people a link to this campaign page, Tweet it, post it on Facebook, text it, make flyers, put a sign on your car, whatever. Get creative, but let's all do what we can to help our fellow human being.

story:
The University of South Florida art history organization Art Research Forum (ARF) is looking to raise funds in order to publish MFA catalogs for the graduating class of 2018!  Our goal is to raise $3,000 so we can print 500 copies of a professional, high quality 50-page catalog.

The publication of this catalog will offer us the opportunity to collaborate with our sister organization, the Masters of Fine Arts Organization (MFAO), and gain experience interacting with and writing about contemporary artists.  The publication of an MFA catalog is an academic and fine arts initiative that supports the exemplary work created by graduate students at USF. Furthermore, this is a group project where everyone will have a critical role in designing, writing, or editing the catalog. The funds allocated to this project will provide a clear and resounding voice for USF’s graduate students while serving as a tangible reminder that USF is an advocate for the fine arts within the larger Tampa Bay area, and the international arts community.  Only you can help make this happen!

Over the past three years, we were able to implement successful fundraising initiatives and meet our goal of publishing catalogs for previous classes. The professional confidence gained through the realization of this endeavor has been invaluable. USF’s College of the Arts began a tradition of artistic collaboration and excellence that we hope to build upon this year.

Our team of graduate art historians includes:  James Cartwright, Richard Ellis, Erin Hughes, Victoria Mann, Amanda Poss, SK West, and Ashley Williams. (*See examples of their professional accolades below under "Getting to know our writers.") 

Supported also by graduate editor Ashley Williams, who pulled double duty on our project.

Take a look at the exemplary work of our featured artists by viewing their websites containing past and ongoing artistic explorations.

Samir Bernardez Cabrera

Nestor Capparos- http://www.nestorcaparros.com/

Gloria Ceren-  https://www.gloriaceren.com/ 

Will  Douglas -http://www.willwdoug.com/  

Ben Galaday- https://bengaladay.squarespace.com/

Zakriya Rabani- https://www.zakriyarabani.com/ 

Kim Turner Smith- http://kimturnerphotography.com/

 

*Getting to know our writers:

Our graduate art historians are enthusiastic and active researchers in their respective fields. Their scholarship has been selected for both national and international conferences, including such recent selections as "Crossing Boundaries: Creation of a Christian Identity and Negotiation of Religious Space in Armenian New Julfa," at the CEMS International Graduate Conference in Budapest, Hungary (Cartwright, 2017) and “Contemplating God Through Light: The Mosque Lamp of Karim al-Din within the Cross-Cultural Contexts of Abrahamic Religions,” at the Midwest Art History Society Conference in Cleveland, Ohio (Williams, 2017). Several historians have pursued their interests across the globe in study abroad programs in Paris, France and bi-annual excursions to the Venice Biennale. 

All proceeds will support the funding of this catalog. Art Research Forum will allocate any remaining funds toward publishing future catalogs and supporting further collaborations between practicing artists and art historians. Your generous donation will help make this catalog an enduring tradition in our community. Thank you!

story:
Living With a Broken Heart

My name is Paul O'Rear.

My daughter Ashley was diagnosed with a malignant brain tumor when she was nine years old. She went through a year-and-a-half of radiation and chemo treatments, and it looked like she had beaten her cancer. She was cancer-free for a little over three years.

Then in the fall of 2001, her cancer came back. It was much more aggressive this time around, and about two-and-a-half months later, Ashley died. She was fourteen years old.

My grief journey has been nothing like I had expected. My wife Susan and I didn't go through a pre-packaged "grief process" like I had always heard about, with Stage 1 followed by Stage 2, and so on. In fact, we completely skipped a step or two in the classic progression of "grief stages", and amost felt a little guilty because of it!

As our grief journey continued, I discovered some very important and completely unexpected truths about grief.

  • Hearts broken by grief cannot be fixed.
  • Each person grieves in their own way.
  • Grief and happiness can peacefully co-exist.
  • "All things work together for good to those who love God."

Some of these ideas run completely counter to what people expect from grief. Sometimes people place unrealistic expectations on the griever, based on the classic myths about grief. I think it is important for there to be a voice in the middle of all the noise saying, "Hey, it's OK if your grief experience isn't like everyone else's, or like you expected it to be. It's OK if your heart is still broken months, or even years, down the road."

That is why I have written Living With a Broken Heart, and that is why I feel compelled to get it into as many people's hands as I possibly can. Not only can it help the person who is grieving, it can help the person whose friend or loved one is grieving, and who wants to know what to do to help them.

What I Need, and What You Get

PRIMARY NEEDS

I need $600 to purchase the necessary software, training and support to get my manuscript ready for publishing to Kindle. The vendor for this bundle provides online training and support to help navigate through all the technical and formatting requirements necessary to produce a manuscript that is Kindle-ready. The software package they provide includes a cover art program and a propietary word processing program that has Kindle formatting built-in to streamline the process.

The remaining $300 covers the cost of running the IndieGoGo campaign (processing fees, partnership perks, etc.).

SECONDARY NEEDS

If I raise more than the $900 listed above, I will put the extra money toward:

  • additional fees associated with additional donations.
  • purchasing a Kindle for purposes of testing the e-book on an actual Kindle device. Otherwise, I will just use the Kindle reader app on my laptop to test it.
  • marketing expenses to promote the book.
  • Caramel Macchiatos from Starbucks! :o)

If the funding gets really crazy (or I just get tired of Caramel Macchiatos), I'll use the left-over funds for other stuff, like maybe upgrading office equipment to help with this or future projects.

THE PERKS

I have assembled an assortment of tantalizing perks for the various partnership levels shown in the right column. Pick your level and enjoy your perks!

The Impact

I believe Living With a Broken Heart has the potential to bring a measure of peace to those who are grieving.

  • It will help those who are grieving understand that they are not alone.
  • It will be a voice of support for whatever they are experiencing in their grief.
  • It will reassure them that it is OK to experience things in grief that are unique.
  • It will validate the fact that it is OK for their heart to stay broken.
  • It will give them hope that happiness can still be part of their lives, even when their hearts are broken.

The positive impact that this can have on a grieving person's life is incalculable!

I believe Living With a Broken Heart also has the potential to be a source of inspiration for those who know someone else who is grieving.

  • It will give them ideas for things they can do to help out their grieving friend.
  • It will reassure them that they don't have to figure out "the right words" to say to relieve their friend's suffering.
  • It will help them understand that simply being there and loving their friend is the best gift they can give.

Your participation in this publishing project can help make a huge difference in people's lives!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help this project be successful!

Make some noise! Let other people know about this project and encourage them to check it out and consider supporting it.

  • Post a message on Facebook with a link to this page.
  • Tweet about the project (again, with a link to this page).
  • Write about this project on your blog.
  • Talk about this project in actual face-to-face conversations with people.
  • Tell your minister about this project, or others who counsel people in grief and might benefit from knowing about the book.

Helping to create a buzz about the book and about this project would be a tremendous help, and would be greatly appreciated! Be sure to let me know how you have promoted it, so I can go check out your stuff.

Oh, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

As our grief journey continued, I discovered some very important and completely unexpected truths about grief.

Hearts broken by grief cannot be fixed.
Each person grieves in their own way.
Grief and happiness can peacefully co-exist.
"All things work together for good to those who love God."
Some of these ideas run completely counter to what people expect from grief. Sometimes people place unrealistic expectations on the griever, based on the classic myths about grief. I think it is important for there to be a voice in the middle of all the noise saying, "Hey, it's OK if your grief experience isn't like everyone else's, or like you expected it to be. It's OK if your heart is still broken months, or even years, down the road."
That is why I have written Living With a Broken Heart, and that is why I feel compelled to get it into as many people's hands as I possibly can. Not only can it help the person who is grieving, it can help the person whose friend or loved one is grieving, and who wants to know what to do to help them.
What I Need, and What You Get
PRIMARY NEEDS
I need $600 to purchase the necessary software, training and support to get my manuscript ready for publishing to Kindle. The vendor for this bundle provides online training and support to help navigate through all the technical and formatting requirements necessary to produce a manuscript that is Kindle-ready. The software package they provide includes a cover art program and a propietary word processing program that has Kindle formatting built-in to streamline the process.
The remaining $300 covers the cost of running the IndieGoGo campaign (processing fees, partnership perks, etc.).
SECONDARY NEEDS
If I raise more than the $900 listed above, I will put the extra money toward:

additional fees associated with additional donations.
purchasing a Kindle for purposes of testing the e-book on an actual Kindle device. Otherwise, I will just use the Kindle reader app on my laptop to test it.
marketing expenses to promote the book.
Caramel Macchiatos from Starbucks! :o)
If the funding gets really crazy (or I just get tired of Caramel Macchiatos), I'll use the left-over funds for other stuff, like maybe upgrading office equipment to help with this or future projects.
THE PERKS
I have assembled an assortment of tantalizing perks for the various partnership levels shown in the right column. Pick your level and enjoy your perks!
The Impact

I believe Living With a Broken Heart has the potential to bring a measure of peace to those who are grieving.

It will help those who are grieving understand that they are not alone.
It will be a voice of support for whatever they are experiencing in their grief.
It will reassure them that it is OK to experience things in grief that are unique.
It will validate the fact that it is OK for their heart to stay broken.
It will give them hope that happiness can still be part of their lives, even when their hearts are broken.

The positive impact that this can have on a grieving person's life is incalculable!
I believe Living With a Broken Heart also has the potential to be a source of inspiration for those who know someone else who is grieving.

It will give them ideas for things they can do to help out their grieving friend.
It will reassure them that they don't have to figure out "the right words" to say to relieve their friend's suffering.
It will help them understand that simply being there and loving their friend is the best gift they can give.

Your participation in this publishing project can help make a huge difference in people's lives!
Other Ways You Can Help


If you are unable to contribute, you can still help this project be successful!
Make some noise! Let other people know about this project and encourage them to check it out and consider supporting it.

Post a message on Facebook with a link to this page.
Tweet about the project (again, with a link to this page).
Write about this project on your blog.
Talk about this project in actual face-to-face conversations with people.
Tell your minister about this project, or others who counsel people in grief and might benefit from knowing about the book.

Helping to create a buzz about the book and about this project would be a tremendous help, and would be greatly appreciated! Be sure to let me know how you have promoted it, so I can go check out your stuff.
Oh, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!

story:
Hi Everyone, 

I'm Erin, a Canadian living in England.  5 Years ago, I decided to move my whole life from Vancouver, BC, Canada to Exeter, Devon, UK, completely on my OWN!  I had ONE friend where I was moving to!   I've struggled, I've had challenges, I thought I'd failed (on more than one occasion, I even gave myself a timeline for moving back to Vancouver. 

And then something incredible happened...I started to meet people - Incredible People - friends that you do not find everyday, friends that help you through things that make or break you.  These friends are now my family, My UK Family.  

So I decided to stay! 

Now it's time to apply for my Citizenship so I can stay!  I'm looking to raise £1100 to help pay for the fees associated in accomplishing my goal. 

It costs almost £900 for just my CItizenship, £50 for the test (to prove that I know my British History..I wonder how many questions would stump a Brit?) and £50-£100 for a "Checking service" which ENSURES I get everything right & don't mess up the "due date" or documents I fill out for submission.  There is no back up plan, I must be successful, it has always been my goal, from the moment I decide to move to the UK, to have Dual Citizenship.  

The Impact

2013 was an exceptionally difficult year!!!  I had more trials & tribulations that I EVER anticipated when I was so close to my end goal!  Which has meant a fair few setbacks.  The BIGGEST were: Black mould in my flat which made me incredibly sick & meant I had to move; I left my job for a variety of reasons (including but not limited to horrible Work/Life balance.  I had no life, I was too stressed!) I have struggled to find a role which challenges my skills and abilities but also pays the bills.  There have been more challenges but there have also been some lovely events which have nicely balanced out the negatives.  Friends had a beautiful baby; I went to a couple weddings; and I've found a job, albeit temporary, which is a great combinations of all the things I was seeking!

It's incredibly difficult for me to ask for help, let alone ask for help with finances.  So here goes....If you are able to assist in any way possible, I would be incredibly grateful!  Any currency is accepted.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, please consider sharing with anyone who you think would be able too!

story:
¿Qué?

Viaje de ida y vuelta es una historia que profundiza acerca de las segundas oportunidades, de cómo idealizamos vivencias y personas del recuerdo, empleando en todo momento un estilo ágil y ameno.

Manuel, un hombre común, amigo de sus amigos, inicia un viaje para
reencontrarse con un amor del pasado. Durante su periplo se cruzará con personajes variopintos, sacados de las realidades sociales de distintas nacionalidades, cuyos intereses, inquietudes y sentimientos se entrecruzarán con los suyos. Hará nuevas amistades y el amor encontrará nuevos caminos y formas para mostrarse.

Un viaje de ida y vuelta, desde España hasta Brasil, en el que hay tiempo para el erotismo, los celos, el deseo y otras grandes y pequeñas pasiones. Un viaje de encuentros y desencuentros, de amor y desamor, de ilusión y melancolía, donde los personajes se quitan las máscaras y se muestran tal como son, redescubriéndose a sí mismos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Antonio López Vallejo.

Madrileño de nacimiento, allá por el '76, y granadino de adopción desde hace la friolera de veinte años, ha cultivado su pasión por la escritura compaginándolo con las más diversas actividades.

Porque Antonio ha sido peón en un molino de aceite, pero también técnico microinformático, además de conserje o repartidor entre otras muchas. Ha escrito numerosos relatos (cosechando algún que otro premio) y aspira a que esta, Un viaje de ida y vuelta, sea su primera novela publicada.

Vamos a esforzarnos para que Antonio López Vallejo lo consiga...

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Un viaje de ida y vuelta que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Antonio López Vallejo vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Founders' stories from the trenches

  • How do you get a $6 million investment based on a single tweet?
  • Who provided shelter to the founders of Kazaa, chased by recording industry lawyers, while they built their next project - Skype?
  • Why did two Swedes decide to move from Stockholm to Berlin and start SoundCloud there?

As a cofounder of the technology blog Tech.eu and a writer for publications such as Forbes, Mreza (in Croatia) and others, over the past several years I've interviewed some of Europe's most ambitious and successful technology entrepreneurs. They have created amazing companies such as SoundCloud, Prezi, Last.fm, Mendeley, Fon, Deezer, Supercell and many others - yet they are often overlooked by the media in favor of American founders and CEO's.


After years of interviews and research, I've collected stories and interviews with 30 of these entrepreneurs, from all across Europe, in a book: "The European Startup Revolution". Four years in the making, the book covers their experiences, failures and successes. In covering such a long time span, it gives the reader a unique perspective of how they started out and where they are today.


Victor Henning -  Elsevier / Mendeley


You'll want to read this book if you're a:

  • Startup founder wise enough to learn from other people's mistakes - not just her own :-)
  • User of one of the many products created by these entrepreneurs who's curious about the back stories behind them
  • VC or angel investor who wants to help her or his investees on their difficult journey
  • Professional trapped in a corporation who needs just that additional bit of inspiration to take the plunge and - finally - go for the entrepreneurial dream
  • None of the above - but still curious about the stories and experiences of the women and men in the book

Lesley & Nigel Eccles - FanDuel.com


With my work nearly complete, I need your support to finalize production and publication of the e-book and print editions. Users of these companies' products, startup founders and entrepreneurs from Europe and worldwide will find inspiration in these stories.

Europeans still burn with the passion that led our ancestors to navigate the globe. Join me as I report on their journeys and let's create The European Startup Revolution together!

Who am I?

I'm Ivo Spigel. Based in Zagreb, Croatia, I'm an entrepreneur myself, cofounder of an IT company called Perpetuum Mobile. I'm also a longtime writer about technology and society. I've written for the Croatian edition of Forbes magazine as well as the Croatian IT publication "Mreza" ("Network").

Late in 2013 I co-founded the technology blog Tech.eu with the mission of reporting on companies, trends and players in the high-tech and startup ecosystems throughout Europe.

I've also co-founded Croatia's leading startup accelerator, ZIP, and have been a mentor at Seedcamp, a leading European accelerator and early stage investment fund.

**

The book is nearly done. I still need to do a few followup interviews with some of the entrepreneurs as well as have the book copy edited and the design and layout work done.

Then it will be time to produce both the e-book and printed versions.

There could be hiccups and obstacles along the way but - honestly - I don't expect any major issues.

The main problem might be my other obligations - helping to manage my IT company with my partners, running ZIP and writing for Tech.eu in parallel with finishing the book.

I'm confident, however, that the book will be published, with your help and support, in late April or early May of this year!

***

Stretch time!

The campaign goal was met in the late night hours of Saturday, Feb 21! A huge *thank you* to everyone who contributed and helped spread the good word. Now, of course, it's time for a stretch goal! The stretch goal for this campaign is

                                                      $11,333

Why, you may ask? Well... I'll leave that answer to your inner geek, and you're always free to ping me if you can't figure it out by yourself (but of course you can).

What's my commitment if we reach this new goal?

I will add three additional chapters to the book, featuring yet more amazing entrerpreneurs, at least one of which will be from my native Croatia.

I will also donate 128 printed books to 128 Croatian high schools. Maybe some kid out there gets inspired – you never know!

Five more days, people – no sleep 'till Brooklyn!

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Andrew Bozeman. I am a minister, writer, teacher, speaker, consutant. My mission and purpose in life is to help transform African American communities from symbols of poverty, frustration and pain to centers of propsperity, power and pride. I have been a minister since 1982. I have been a corporate trainer since 1988. I have operated and managed training operations that trained thousands of people. At one time in my life, I was also an award winning ad copywriter/producer for such clients as McDonalds, Budweiser and Coca-Cola.

I feel that it is now time to focus on my people -- African Americans -- and apply my talents and skills and experience to helping our communities revitalize.

The vehicle through which I will do this work is this project for which I am raising funds. It's title is HEAL THE PAIN OF RACISM...and Tear Down the Barriers to Success. It consists of 4 parts 1) a book to analyze and clarify the hidden effects of racism, racial discrimination and racial disparagement on African Americans; 2) a workbook to provide step-by-step guidance in self-healing; 3) a live workshop to provide in person training and 4) a DVD to provide continuous reinforcement for the viewer.  


By helping fund this project, you become a part of a movement that can change the world not only for African Americans but for all minorities. For as the African American community porspers, so to will the minority communities and sympathetic white communities with whom we have relationship. This is a time of rising consciousness. It is a time of joining together for the betterment of our world.

Our Budget

Our goal is to raise $28,875 to cover the costs of publishing, design, promotion and production of the entire project.The first element to be produced is the book because it is the basis of everything else. That is followed by the workbook which supports the workshops. The DVD is a videotaped version of the workshops. This will provide continual reinforcement of the lessons learned in the workshop  plus any additional exercises or activities which are of value to the viewer. Our initial budget is below:

Project Budget:  
Paperback Publishing $5,250
Print 500 extra copies $5,000
Workbook Design & Creation w/graphics $1,500
Workbook Publishing $3,900
Print 100 extra copies $1,000
Video Production $7,500
Marketing/Promotion $3,000
Admin Expenses $2,500
   
Publishing Subtotal $29,650
Contingency (10%) $2,965
Publishing Total $32,615
 
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   
   

Perks:

We will accept any contribution of any size because we want to invite the participation of everyone who may have an interest in this effort but not necessarily the resources. Whatever is given is of significance and we are truly grateful. Everyone who donates any amount will be listed in our book as a valued contributor.

$25 Donation will receive a free copy of the book (limited to 200 books)

$75 Donation will receive a combo pack of the book and the workbook (limit 100 packs)

$150 Donation will receive a combo pack of the book, workbook and DVD (limit 50)

Other Ways You Can Help

We will greatly appreciate your sharing your knowledge of this campaign with your circle of friends and family. This is a way for us all to rise in consciousness and in love as we try to make this world a better place for us all.

Thank you very much,

**Andrew
