Books Still Available!

Although this IndieGoGo project has closed, you can still pre-order a book by visiting my webste, artfisher.com

You can reach the order page directly at celebratefiesta.com

Summary

Above is a video which summarizes this project in a few minutes.

Book Specifications:

  • 12 x 12 inch Hardbound, Coffee Table Book
  • 240 Pages, Printed in Full Color on High Quality Paper
  • HiFi Color, Laminated Dust Jacket
  • Over 600 High-Quality Photographs
  • Fully Captioned Photos
  • Over a Decade of Fiesta Photography
  • Beautiful Panoramas
  • Iconic Santa Barbara Locations
  • Some 1,500 Faces Captured
  • Colorful Graphic Design
  • Quotes by Prominent Fiesta Participants

About the Project

Your contribution to this project will help cover the printing costs.

A minimum of 100 books from this project will be donated to the Old Spanish Days non-profit, the organization who puts on Fiesta each year. If we reach $30,000 in funding, we will donate at least 200 books to them!

This 240 page, 12 x 12 inch coffee table book takes you through Old Spanish Days’ annual Fiesta celebration in Santa Barbara, California. This world-renown, annual festival first began in 1924. The book contains more than 600 intriguing photographs from a plethora of interesting perspectives and historic locations. For three years, I served as the Official Old Spanish Days photographer, which benefited me with privileged access. From front row and on-stage with the dancers, to middle-of-the-street parade shots, to back-stage and behind the scenes, you’ll experience Fiesta like you’ve never seen it before.

The purpose of this book is not to be a historical retrospective but rather to provide a colorful documentation of what you might see if you tried to take in all the major Fiesta events of today.

See the "Gallery" tab above for a slideshow of 635 images, which pretty well represents what's included in Draft 4 of the book.

Table of Contents

The Special Edition Postcard

 

Certificates for Prints

Many of the pledge options include a certificate for a print of any image in the book. (All measurements are in inches.) The certificate will be delivered around the same time as the book, so this gives you an opportunity to peruse the book before deciding which image you'd like printed.

In case you want a smaller print, you may choose an image size up to the size offered on your certificate. The size on the certificate represents the maximum size for which it is redeemable, and it includes shipping to the USA.

Keep in mind that over the eleven years of photography covered in this book, I used at least ten different cameras. Photos became increasingly better as the technology improved. That said, some images in the book, especially the older ones, might not be suitable for print at very large sizes. I can help you choose an excellent image to fulfill your print certificate.

I am a certified digital print-maker, so these prints will be made with the highest-quality equipment and materials. You can read more about prints on my website, http://artfisher.com.

History of Old Spanish Days – Fiesta

Santa Barbarans have long been proud of their city’s heritage from Spanish founders and from the Spanish, Mexican and North American pioneers who first settled here and built the city. The tradition of colorful music, dance and song, together with a spirit of friendliness, hospitality and tolerance are part of this heritage, which Fiesta, Old Spanish Days In Santa Barbara, seeks to preserve and perpetuate.

In the year 1924, the first Fiesta celebration took place to provide Santa Barbara with an annual summer event to entertain and attract visitors. The city had come to be a favorite place for winter tourists, but these visitors had not been drawn here in any considerable number during the summer months.

Since then, Fiesta has grown to become the largest annual celebration of California's Spanish heritage found anywhere in the state.

Fiesta Today

Over the years, the Fiesta celebration has come to embody more than a dozen distinct events and locations, budding with Santa Barbara’s local color, tradition and heritage.

Iconic locations, such as the Santa Barbara Mission, Santa Barbara Courthouse, State Street, El Paseo Restaurant, Paseo Nuevo, Santa Barbara Bowl, Earl Warren Showgrounds and the classic mercados & cantinas have all become home to Fiesta’s multitude of popular events.

Each year the grand finale of Fiesta takes place for a full week around the beginning of August. For months before that, however, the city ramps up with fundraisers, dance contests, costume sales and float building. Tens of thousands of people flock to Santa Barbara to watch and participate as hundreds more sing, perform historic dances, and ride horses & carriages in parades.

Local businesses close their doors early to celebrate one of the largest equestrian parades in the country. Hundreds of children and adults, decked in authentic costume, dance flamenco, folklórico, salsa, and ballet on stages throughout the city. The bars and mercados go crazy with locals and out-of-towners. And two different parades fill the streets with colorful entertainment.

Large Pledges

The CORPORATE, BUSINESS and GENEROUS level pledge amounts are not intended for resellers. These levels are designed for organizations who want to reward their employees, patrons or friends with the book as a gift.

If you are interested in reselling the book, please contact me through my website, http://artfisher.com

The Numbers

My goal is to print 3,000 books. The out-of-pocket production costs to do so will total nearly $40,000. Including expenses already incurred, I have personally set aside a at least $12,000 to invest in this project.

In addition to my investment, the $20,000 project goal is the minimum amount needed to produce 2,000 of these books, which is the smallest feasible press run. If we can raise more money, we can print more books, so don't hesitate to pledge just because we've reached our goal!

If you order books online after this project has closed, you will likely pay additional charges for shipping.

Schedule

This isn't my first publication. I've worked on books twice the size; although, this is the biggest book project I've done without another publisher involved.

The book production process is nearly complete. The process (excluding the eleven years of photography) began last June, and I have already created four sets of full-size, fully bound drafts. (Draft 4 is on display at the El Paseo Restaurant in Santa Barbara.) The project is already very mature, so we don't expect any delays in going to press. For the last three months, most of the production has revolved around perfecting things.

I'm very confident in the final color and technical aspects of the book. I'm still working on proofing the dust jacket, which will be printed in four-color process plus two touch plates to maximize the saturation of the reds and blues. It will take at least two rounds of proofing, each taking a full week, but I don't foresee any problems that would delay this process beyond the close date of the funding stage.

We have a best case and worst case schedule scenario worked out with our printer. We will probably end up somewhere in between them, but the worst case scenario puts the books in our hands on July 15th, which is still a couple weeks before the main Fiesta events begin.

Barring any circumstances that are out of my control, we should be on schedule to begin book delivery by late July.

Payment Through PayPal

This project is setup to process payments via PayPal, who implements certain limits on the amount of money that you can send. If you're paying as a guest in PayPal (no account necessary), you will not be able to contribute more than $500. You will also only be able to use PayPal's guest checkout process up to 15 times with a total spending limit of 4,000. Once you reach PayPal's maximum, you will be prompted to upgrade to a full PayPal account.

Setting up a PayPal account is free, but spending over $5000 requires a verified account, which can take a couple days. Please don't hesitate to call me if you're having problems contributing: 805-564-2428

Browser Errors: Internet Explorer

IndieGoGo is not optimized for Internet Explorer 8.0 or earlier, so we recommend switching to Mozilla Firefox or Google Chrome. You can download both browsers for free at the following links:

  • Mozilla Firefox: http://www.mozilla.com/
  • Google Chrome: http://www.google.com/chrome/

story:
Indiegogo InDemand

J'ai été invitée à m'inscrire au programme InDemand d'Indiegogo, ce qui signifie que maintenant que mon objectif a été atteint et que mon livre a été publié, vous pouvez continuer de vous procurer votre copie par le biais de cette page!

Mon roman n'est disponible dans aucune librairie. Jusqu'à maintenant, il était seulement possible de le commander par le biais de mon site Internet. Je suis maintenant contente de pouvoir offrir une deuxième option d'achat.

Si vous aimeriez en savoir plus sur mon roman, ou si vous aimeriez consulter la liste des détaillants qui le vendent en version numérique, rendez-vous ici:

http://myriamplante.com/dragon.htm

Vous pouvez aussi voir ci-dessous le texte et les photos de ma campagne de financement, qui est s'est terminée avec succès le 4 Novembre 2014.


Bref résumé

Le Parfum du Vent est un roman fantastique, dont l'histoire est racontée du point de vue unique d'un dragon. Ce dragon n'a aucun pouvoir magique, il ne crache pas de feu et son existence ne consiste pas à amasser des trésors. Il s'agit plutôt d'un animal sauvage, doté d'intelligence, qui a beaucoup de mal à comprendre les humains qui partagent son monde.

Ce dragon, accompagné d'un magicien, partira à la recherche d'une humaine avec laquelle il a vécu pendant plusieurs années.

Pour lire gratuitement un extrait du roman, rendez-vous ici: http://myriamplante.com/dragon.htm

Bonjour! Je m'appelle Myriam Plante. Depuis que je sais tenir un crayon et que je sais ce qu'est un livre, je rêve de devenir une écrivaine. Après plusieurs années d'apprentissage et de travail, mon rêve est sur le point de devenir réalité: je m'apprête à publier mon tout premier roman, Le Parfum du Vent!
Vous pouvez précommander mon roman, et m'aider à le faire publier!

Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous pouvez obtenir

Mon livre sera publié par la maison d'édition Les Carnets de Dame Plume, et il devrait paraître au début du mois de Décembre 2014. La publication se fera à compte d'auteur, ce qui signifie que je dois payer moi-même les frais. En toute honnêteté, je n'ai pas suffisamment d'argent pour payer la totalité de ces frais sans faire de trou de la taille d'un dragon dans mon fragile budget.

J'ai donc décidé de lancer cette campagne de financement, afin de donner la chance à ceux qui sont impatients de lire mon livre depuis longtemps, ainsi qu'à ceux qui sont maintenant curieux de le lire, d'être parmi les premières personnes à recevoir leur copie. En précommandant mon livre, vous m'aidez à le faire publier et à réaliser mon rêve... et tout le monde est content!

Cette campagne de financement se terminera le 4 Novembre, le jour de ma fête. J'ai choisi cette date car elle me semblait idéale pour célébrer la joie d'avoir atteint mon objectif, ou la déception de ne pas l'avoir atteint!

Peu importe ce qui arrivera, l'argent amassé m'aidera à payer les frais de publication de mon livre, mais aussi à payer les frais d'impression de certains des cadeaux exclusifs que vous pouvez obtenir en supportant ma campagne, ainsi que les frais de poste de mon roman, et des autres cadeaux.

Vous pouvez donc commander Le Parfum du Vent, en format papier ou en format numérique, mais ce n'est pas tout! J'ai aussi préparé plusieurs cadeaux exclusifs, appelés contreparties, que vous pouvez vous procurer afin de supporter mon projet.

Il vous est possible de choisir plus qu'un cadeau, mais vous ne pouvez qu'en payer un à la fois. J'ajouterai le nom de chaque personne qui supportera mon projet sur la page Internet de mon roman, en guise de sincère remerciement. Veuillez noter que la livraison est incluse dans les prix.

Descriptions des cadeaux exclusifs:

1$ - Chanson Le Parfum du Vent
La chanson de la bande-annonce de mon roman (le vidéo en haut de cette page) a été créée par un musicien appelé Brad Podray, alias Maximalism. (Vous pouvez découvrir ses nombreux projets musicaux ici: http://maximalismmusic.com/)
Pour 1$, vous recevrez la chanson Le Parfum du Vent en format mp3.

3$ - Aimant Dragon  *Nouveau!*
Je vous enverrai par la poste un aimant pour frigo de la taille d'une carte d'affaire. Cette image, que j'ai peinte moi-même, sera utilisée pour la page couverture de mon roman.


5$ - Ensemble de 2 signets

Je vous enverrai par la poste un signet personnalisé avec des dessins et quelques extraits de mon roman. Chaque signet sera unique et créé par moi, spécialement pour vous! Vous recevrez aussi un signet de Gontrand le Chevalier, mon héros de bande dessinée. (http://www.gontrandlechevalier.com/)

10$ - Livre numérique
Vous recevrez mon roman en version numérique, en format PDF, ou autre format de votre choix.

15$ - Affiche Le Parfum du Vent
Vous recevrez une affiche, de format 11" x 17". Cette image, que j'ai peinte moi-même, sera utilisée pour la page couverture de mon roman.


15$ - Dessin caricature
Je dessinerai votre caricature, à partir d'une photo et selon vos instructions. Le dessin final vous sera envoyé par courriel en format jpeg.
Visitez ce lien pour voir des exemples des personnages que je dessine: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/personnages.htm

18$ - Sac
Vous recevrez un sac de coton mettant en vedette un détail de la page couverture du roman. Le sac mesure 13" x 14", pour une largeur d'environ 2".


20$ - Bébé Dragon (Déjà vendu!)
Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!
Il mesure environ environ 12" de long, sans compter l'attache.


25$ - Roman
Précommandez votre copie de mon roman, Le Parfum du Vent!

25$ - Dragon Albinos (Déjà vendu!)
Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!
Il mesure environ 17" de long, sans compter l'attache.


28$ - Dragon Brun
Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!
Il mesure environ 21" de long, sans compter l'attache.


30$ - Assiette décorative Dragon sous la lune  *Nouveau!*
Cette assiette décorative a été peinte par mon amie Marilyn Pellerin, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement.
L'assiette a un diamètre de 8 1/4".


30$ - Assiette décorative Dragon sous l'arbre (Déjà vendue!)
Cette assiette décorative a été peinte par mon amie Marilyn Pellerin, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement.
L'assiette a un diamètre de 8 1/4".


30$ - Dragon Bleu (Déjà vendu!)
Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!
Il mesure environ 24" de long, sans compter l'attache.


35$ - Dragon Noir (Déjà vendu!)
Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique, et il a beaucoup de dents!
Il mesure environ 20" de long, sans compter l'attache.

55$ - Petite Oeuvre d'art  *Nouveau!*
Je peindrai une toile de format 6" x 6" spécialement pour vous, selon vos instructions et au meilleur de mes capacités. Je vous la ferai ensuite parvenir par la poste.
Visitez mon portfolio pour voir des exemples de mes oeuvres: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/illustrations.htm

65$ - Portrait au plomb
Je dessinerai votre portrait avec mes crayons de plomb, à partir d'une photo. Le dessin vous sera envoyé par la poste.
Visitez ce lien pour voir des exemples de portraits que j'ai dessiné:
http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/portraits.htm

300$ - Oeuvre d'art
Si vous êtes prêt à me donner 300$ pour la publication de mon livre, je suis prête à peindre une toile spécialement pour vous! Je peindrai le sujet de votre choix, dans les couleurs de votre choix et au meilleur de mes capacités. Le format de la toile sera également à votre choix. (Puisque je devrai vous faire parvenir votre oeuvre par la poste, je crois qu'un format de 9" x 12", au maximum, serait idéal.)
Bref, je communiquerai avec vous afin de vous créer une oeuvre d'art à votre goût!
Visitez mon portfolio pour voir certaines de mes oeuvres: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/illustrations.htm


L'impact

Ceci est ma toute première expérience sur Indiegogo. En fait, j'ai déjà supporté plusieurs campagnes de financement, mais c'est la première fois que j'en gère une pour un de mes projets.

J'aime Indiegogo, et le site m'a semblé être la plateforme parfaite pour commencer à partager mon roman avec le monde entier. J'ai déjà commencé à écrire la suite de Le Parfum du Vent, et j'ai plusieurs autres idées de romans en tête... En supportant mon projet, vous supportez en fait une grande étape dans la réalisation de mon rêve, et je vous en suis immensément reconnaissante!


Risques et défis

Si je n'atteins pas le montant fixé au terme de ma campagne de financement, je ferai tout de même imprimer au moins 100 copies de mon livre. Il n'y a donc aucun risque pour vous: si vous précommandez mon roman, vous recevrez votre copie peu de temps après la publication. Si vous commandez une affiche, un sac, ou quoi que ce soit d'autre, vous recevrez votre cadeau exclusif tel que prévu, et ce, même si je n'atteins pas mon objectif.

Si jamais je dépasse mon objectif (on peut toujours rêver!) je ferai imprimer plus de copies de mon livre, tout simplement!


D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous désirez supporter la publication de mon livre, n'hésitez pas à partager cette page avec toute personne de votre connaissance qui aime les dragons, les magiciens, les livres contenant des dragons et des magiciens, et les livres en général.

Vous pouvez aussi me visiter au http://www.myriamplante.com/, ou suivre mon blogue au http://myriamplante.wordpress.com/ pour faire plus ample connaissance avec moi et avec mes différents projets.

J'ai choisi cette date car elle me semblait idéale pour célébrer la joie d'avoir atteint mon objectif, ou la déception de ne pas l'avoir atteint!Peu importe ce qui arrivera, l'argent amassé m'aidera à payer les frais de publication de mon livre, mais aussi à payer les frais d'impression de certains des cadeaux exclusifs que vous pouvez obtenir en supportant ma campagne, ainsi que les frais de poste de mon roman, et des autres cadeaux.Vous pouvez donc commander Le Parfum du Vent, en format papier ou en format numérique, mais ce n'est pas tout! J'ai aussi préparé plusieurs cadeaux exclusifs, appelés contreparties, que vous pouvez vous procurer afin de supporter mon projet.Il vous est possible de choisir plus qu'un cadeau, mais vous ne pouvez qu'en payer un à la fois. J'ajouterai le nom de chaque personne qui supportera mon projet sur la page Internet de mon roman, en guise de sincère remerciement. Veuillez noter que la livraison est incluse dans les prix.Descriptions des cadeaux exclusifs:1$ - Chanson Le Parfum du VentLa chanson de la bande-annonce de mon roman (le vidéo en haut de cette page) a été créée par un musicien appelé Brad Podray, alias Maximalism. (Vous pouvez découvrir ses nombreux projets musicaux ici: http://maximalismmusic.com/)Pour 1$, vous recevrez la chanson Le Parfum du Vent en format mp3.3$ - Aimant Dragon  *Nouveau!*Je vous enverrai par la poste un aimant pour frigo de la taille d'une carte d'affaire. Cette image, que j'ai peinte moi-même, sera utilisée pour la page couverture de mon roman.

5$ - Ensemble de 2 signetsJe vous enverrai par la poste un signet personnalisé avec des dessins et quelques extraits de mon roman. Chaque signet sera unique et créé par moi, spécialement pour vous! Vous recevrez aussi un signet de Gontrand le Chevalier, mon héros de bande dessinée. (http://www.gontrandlechevalier.com/)10$ - Livre numériqueVous recevrez mon roman en version numérique, en format PDF, ou autre format de votre choix.15$ - Affiche Le Parfum du VentVous recevrez une affiche, de format 11" x 17". Cette image, que j'ai peinte moi-même, sera utilisée pour la page couverture de mon roman.
15$ - Dessin caricatureJe dessinerai votre caricature, à partir d'une photo et selon vos instructions. Le dessin final vous sera envoyé par courriel en format jpeg. Visitez ce lien pour voir des exemples des personnages que je dessine: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/personnages.htm18$ - SacVous recevrez un sac de coton mettant en vedette un détail de la page couverture du roman. Le sac mesure 13" x 14", pour une largeur d'environ 2".
20$ - Bébé Dragon (Déjà vendu!)Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!Il mesure environ environ 12" de long, sans compter l'attache.
25$ - RomanPrécommandez votre copie de mon roman, Le Parfum du Vent!25$ - Dragon Albinos (Déjà vendu!)Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!Il mesure environ 17" de long, sans compter l'attache.
28$ - Dragon BrunCe capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!Il mesure environ 21" de long, sans compter l'attache.
30$ - Assiette décorative Dragon sous la lune  *Nouveau!*Cette assiette décorative a été peinte par mon amie Marilyn Pellerin, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement.L'assiette a un diamètre de 8 1/4".
30$ - Assiette décorative Dragon sous l'arbre (Déjà vendue!)Cette assiette décorative a été peinte par mon amie Marilyn Pellerin, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement.L'assiette a un diamètre de 8 1/4".
30$ - Dragon Bleu (Déjà vendu!)Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique!Il mesure environ 24" de long, sans compter l'attache.
35$ - Dragon Noir (Déjà vendu!)Ce capteur de rêves a été créé par mon amie Marie-Ève Simard, spécialement pour cette campagne de financement. Il est donc unique, et il a beaucoup de dents!Il mesure environ 20" de long, sans compter l'attache.
55$ - Petite Oeuvre d'art  *Nouveau!*Je peindrai une toile de format 6" x 6" spécialement pour vous, selon vos instructions et au meilleur de mes capacités. Je vous la ferai ensuite parvenir par la poste.Visitez mon portfolio pour voir des exemples de mes oeuvres: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/illustrations.htm65$ - Portrait au plombJe dessinerai votre portrait avec mes crayons de plomb, à partir d'une photo. Le dessin vous sera envoyé par la poste. Visitez ce lien pour voir des exemples de portraits que j'ai dessiné:http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/portraits.htm 300$ - Oeuvre d'artSi vous êtes prêt à me donner 300$ pour la publication de mon livre, je suis prête à peindre une toile spécialement pour vous! Je peindrai le sujet de votre choix, dans les couleurs de votre choix et au meilleur de mes capacités. Le format de la toile sera également à votre choix. (Puisque je devrai vous faire parvenir votre oeuvre par la poste, je crois qu'un format de 9" x 12", au maximum, serait idéal.)Bref, je communiquerai avec vous afin de vous créer une oeuvre d'art à votre goût!Visitez mon portfolio pour voir certaines de mes oeuvres: http://www.myriamplante.com/fr/illustrations.htm

L'impact
Ceci est ma toute première expérience sur Indiegogo. En fait, j'ai déjà supporté plusieurs campagnes de financement, mais c'est la première fois que j'en gère une pour un de mes projets.J'aime Indiegogo, et le site m'a semblé être la plateforme parfaite pour commencer à partager mon roman avec le monde entier. J'ai déjà commencé à écrire la suite de Le Parfum du Vent, et j'ai plusieurs autres idées de romans en tête... En supportant mon projet, vous supportez en fait une grande étape dans la réalisation de mon rêve, et je vous en suis immensément reconnaissante!Risques et défis
Si je n'atteins pas le montant fixé au terme de ma campagne de financement, je ferai tout de même imprimer au moins 100 copies de mon livre. Il n'y a donc aucun risque pour vous: si vous précommandez mon roman, vous recevrez votre copie peu de temps après la publication. Si vous commandez une affiche, un sac, ou quoi que ce soit d'autre, vous recevrez votre cadeau exclusif tel que prévu, et ce, même si je n'atteins pas mon objectif.Si jamais je dépasse mon objectif (on peut toujours rêver!) je ferai imprimer plus de copies de mon livre, tout simplement!

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous désirez supporter la publication de mon livre, n'hésitez pas à partager cette page avec toute personne de votre connaissance qui aime les dragons, les magiciens, les livres contenant des dragons et des magiciens, et les livres en général.Vous pouvez aussi me visiter au http://www.myriamplante.com/, ou suivre mon blogue au http://myriamplante.wordpress.com/ pour faire plus ample connaissance avec moi et avec mes différents projets.

story:
En el archipiélago de Puerto Rico existe una efervescente escena literaria independiente que produce anualmente cientos de libros. La mayoría de esta producción es autogestada o con editoriales independientes. Muchas de estas editoriales funcionan en situaciones de precariedad, pero, a pesar de las carencias, producen libros de calidad incuestionable. La Secta de los Perros es una de ellas, editorial que ha publicado recientemente mi primer poemario el mundo no es otra cosa.

(Foto de José Raúl Ubieta Santiago en la Feria de Libro Independiente y Artesanal, 5ta edición, Viejo San Juan, PR)

Por 17 años he estado publicando mi trabajo literario en periódicos y revistas, tanto impresas como cibernéticas, haciendo mi trabajo un poco al margen de lo que se espera de los escritores, que es publicar en formato de libro. Finalmente en julio, Rafael Acevedo, editor de La Secta de los Perros y entusiasta de mi trabajo, publicó el mundo no es otra cosa, que, entre otras cosas, es una reunión del trabajo realizado en esos 17 años de producción.

Para este primer poemario, me interesaba producir un libro acompañado de ilustraciones que abonaran una dimensión visual al trabajo poético, influída mayormente por La sílaba en la piel, de José María Lima. La ilustradora Nieves Pumarejo, con un trabajo hermoso, accedió a colaborar produciendo ilustraciones específicamente para el poemario, inspirada en este.

(Ilustración para sección "azul balada", por Nieves Pumerejo, para el mundo no es otra cosa)

el mundo no es otra cosa cuenta con 12 ilustraciones a color y un sinnúmero de imágenes en palabras que sitúan el mundo entre nosotros, entre nuestros cuerpos, entre nuestras miradas.

(Ilustración para el poema "el hombre de las barbas de madera", por Nieves Pumerejo, para el mundo no es otra cosa)

Después de la primera tirada de libros que asume la editorial, el autor —autora, en este caso— tiene la libertad de imprimir ejemplares adicionales de manera que se pueda distribuir en librerías, ferias y universidades, y poder hacer presentaciones dentro y fuera del archipiélago. La estructura de impresión es print-on-demand. Puesto que es un libro a color, y que se aporta a la economía del País, porque se imprime en Puerto Rico, el costo de imprimir libro es inaccesible para mí en este momento para hacer la cantidad de ejemplares que merece hacer su distribución amplia. Como anduve todos esos años por revistas y periódicos, lecturas y festivales, el libro es uno muy esperado. 

Confío en que con tu aportación, para principios de febrero el mundo no es otra cosa pueda estar en todas las librerías del país, e incluso algunas del exterior, además de permitir que se pueda difundir ese cantito de "mundo" a festivales y ferias fuera del país a los que ya he sido invitada.

story:
WE DID IT!

LIT IN THE LOU is Done.

We had close to 100 authors from St. Louis and the region over 2 days, with 6  reading/panel/options every hour, in 4 tents in Ackert Park and various off site venues including the Library, Star Clipper, Fro Yo, Componere Gallery, Blueberry Hill's Duck Room, Vintage Vinyl and Craft Alliance Gallery. 

  Our funding campaign   still needs YOU!  

Say thanks with a donation today.

OUR GOAL IS $6,000 TO SUPPORT AUTHOR AND VENUE EXPENSES
(If we meet our goal, INDIEGOGO takes 4%, if we don't, they take 9%, YIKES.)

A HUGE THANKS

goes to our volunteers, supporters and donors.  You know who  you are... get a friend on board today!

 

                 Brought to you by University City Arts & Letters Commission and   the St. Louis Literary Consortium (SLLC), The Independent Bookstore Alliance, all the vendors who braved the cold.  Thanks.

  HELP FUND THE Finished FESTIVAL!

If you already gave, your perk is ready, contact us at litlou@stlouispoetrycenter.org

  • Thesaurus: a $5.00 gets your name on the festival bookshelf
  • Dictionary: a $10.00 - same as above and on our website 
  • Picture Book: a $25.00 - same, PLUS a shout out on Twitter (if you want)
  • Chapter Book: a $50.00 - same, PLUS a shout out on Twitter AND Facebook
  • Middle Grade: $100.00 - same, PLUS a festival book bag
  • Young Adult: $250.00 - same, PLUS your name in the NEXT festival program
  • Great American Novel: $500 - same, PLUS your logo, book cover, or photo      in the festival NEXT program
  • International Best Seller: $1000.00 - same, PLUS your message/or ad space in the NEXT festival program
* if your donation comes in after the festival, you'll be recognized next year!
GO TO STLLIT.BLOGSPOT.COM FOR MORE ON LIT IN THE LOU -- AND YOU!
Founding members of SLLC include: St. Louis Poetry Center, St. Louis Writers Guild, PenUltimate Press, Blank Slate Press, and Walrus Publishing

story:
I have blog page which contain poem,story.I always think that ı can publish my poetry.İf enough fund is gathered,ı will have my poem book.People will read my poetry,touch these in page of  book.ı can realize my dream.Thanks everybody for yours support!

This is the one of my poetry:

There is a little house on the mountain,

Mountain was white and snow fallin,

Snow flake is like a big coin,

It is warm,the house we are in,

The most beautiful thing is your eyes,

I can see in them the light of fireplace,

Your face is looks like angles,

They are jealous of your smiles,

I want to kiss you at outside,

Till your hair became white,

If you feel cold,hold my hand,

I am ready to give you my heart...

story:
About Us

At Tarotcollectibles, we are well known for creating several versions of cards during our Tarot projects. Following on the heels of our runaway success The Trippin Waite Tarot, which was inspired by the late 60's early 70's psychedelic art, The Groovy Waite is comprised of a few great artworks and concepts that did not make it into the Trippin' Waite along with all new works inspired by working on that deck.


Ever since the huge success of our Trippin Waite, people have been asking if there would ever be any bonus images or even a spin-off project from the original Trippin' Waite campaign. With the Groovy Waite, we've amped up the imagery even more. More bell bottoms, more beautifully patterned clothing and more trippy scenes.


 

What We Need & What You Get

The chart above is a rough estimate and is based on being fully funded.

Ideally we need $2,600 for card printing, which will include shipping and customs fees to Ireland. We estimate roughly 20 percent of our funds will go towards campaign fees (this includes, but is not limited to, all transaction fees, a reserve fee that Indiegogo places on campaigns for the purposes of refunds, Indiegogo's initial campaign fee, and because we’re in the UK, we have to pay £25 as a transfer fee. (Roughly 30 U.S Dollars). Anything extra will be reserved for hidden fees (which usually make an appearance)

If we make more than this, some of it will go towards a future print run on another project we have on the horizon.

*A further $600 towards shipping costs will be required to ship our rewards to backers but we've decided to handle these ourselves. We're using Indiegogo to raise funds for the initial card printing.

About The Cards

Card size : 70mm x 121mm (similar in size to our Trippin' Waite)

Card stock: 350gsm (this card stock has proved popular with our Trippin' Waite, so we're opting for a similar thickness)

Printer: If we're fully funded, we plan on using Shenzen Wanjing Printing Company (WJPC), the great company that printed our Trippin' Waite.

* Full funding will guarantee we can provide a full color box with each deck.

We will opt for a PDF rather than a little card meanings book. This will be created soon after the deck has been printing and will be fully printable from our website.

Perks

Some of the perks are very limited in number. We are only interested in raising enough funds to print the cards. Being able to crowd fund a deck not only helps us continue to produce new and exciting works of art for you and others to enjoy; it also gives us an indication if a project is popular enough to warrant a much bigger print run.


*PLEASE NOTE that the decks will probably not be signed if we are not fully funded, only because if we opt for print on demand, these decks usually ship from the manufacturer, not our studio.

Tier 1 (Early Bird Special) will receive a signed copy of the Groovy Waite at 30% off the regular price of decks on our site. We can guarantee that we will never sell this deck at this price after the campaign. Limited to 50 decks, our early bird special is our way of saying thank you to those who pledge early.

Tier 2 will receive a signed Groovy Waite deck and a set of 18 stickers based on some of the images from our popular Trippin' Waite deck. 3x Page of Swords, 3x The Hermit, 3x The Magician, 3x The Hanged Man, 3x The High Priestess and 3x the 2 of Cups. (Normally retailing on our site at $13.00)

Tier 3 will receive both a signed copy of the Groovy Waite and a signed copy of our very popular Trippin' Waite. Limited to 20 entries, this is your chance to own the Trippin' Waite if it's not part of your collection already. For the great price of $30 each, you can receive these two independently produced psychedelic style decks. I foresee the possibility of this tier selling out quite quickly, so act now! (Our Trippin' Waite stock is currently very low but these 20 decks are set aside to aid the funding of this campaign)

SHIPPING

We usually always include free shipping all the way from Ireland, but this time around we have decided to add £4.00 (which converts to roughly around $5.00 U.S) to the price of shipping perks to anyone outside of Europe, The United States, Canada and the UK. While shipping has risen increasingly over the past few years, we're always doing our best to factor shipping into the price of the product itself.

What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go towards the printing of the deck. If we reach most of the funding, we'll add the rest to get a decent print run. If we make much less, we will still deliver the rewards to our backers, but will have to use a print on demand source to achieve this. If you look at every one of our previous campaigns; Dead Waite Tarot, Trippin' Waite, Twisted Tarot Tales and Kiddy Katz/ Spooky Cats, you will see that we've always honoured backer rewards regardless of if we reach full funding or not (but of course it will be much easier if we receive full funding to do this)

How You Help Us

It can be difficult to make a living by being a self published, self promoting artist, but your contribution allows us to keep making original art at an affordable price* . Over the years, our backers' support have allowed us to make some of our decks even more affordable (through bulk printings on some of our decks) allowing the market to open up for us, but also allowing us the opportunity to serve customers from further afield.

*when compared to many other indie artists.

Risks & Challenges

Because we draw a lot of our own images, some of our past projects have taken a few months longer than we had initially anticipated. While we do our very best to stick to a deadline, in the past we have had occasions where we've run over the deadline. Sometimes we spot a card or two that we could've done better on, and we don't feel it's ready to be officially printed. Other times, when we have not reached our goal, we will have to negotiate a little longer with printers and supply companies to get the best deal with the budget we have. Being funded early in our campaign will give us more reassurance that we can proceed with printing with less haggling on the horizon!

Unless funding is dismal, we usually try to go above and beyond what we promise backers, but again, we always deliver on our campaigns because we always price our reward tiers accordingly.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help our campaign along by sharing our page with your friends too. Word of mouth is always a big help to us as indie artists who don't have the power of a big publisher behind us.

Limited to 20 entries, this is your chance to own the Trippin' Waite if it's not part of your collection already. For the great price of $30 each, you can receive these two independently produced psychedelic style decks. I foresee the possibility of this tier selling out quite quickly, so act now! (Our Trippin' Waite stock is currently very low but these 20 decks are set aside to aid the funding of this campaign)
SHIPPING
We usually always include free shipping all the way from Ireland, but this time around we have decided to add £4.00 (which converts to roughly around $5.00 U.S) to the price of shipping perks to anyone outside of Europe, The United States, Canada and the UK. While shipping has risen increasingly over the past few years, we're always doing our best to factor shipping into the price of the product itself.

What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?
If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go towards the printing of the deck. If we reach most of the funding, we'll add the rest to get a decent print run. If we make much less, we will still deliver the rewards to our backers, but will have to use a print on demand source to achieve this. If you look at every one of our previous campaigns; Dead Waite Tarot, Trippin' Waite, Twisted Tarot Tales and Kiddy Katz/ Spooky Cats, you will see that we've always honoured backer rewards regardless of if we reach full funding or not (but of course it will be much easier if we receive full funding to do this)

How You Help Us
It can be difficult to make a living by being a self published, self promoting artist, but your contribution allows us to keep making original art at an affordable price* . Over the years, our backers' support have allowed us to make some of our decks even more affordable (through bulk printings on some of our decks) allowing the market to open up for us, but also allowing us the opportunity to serve customers from further afield.*when compared to many other indie artists.

Risks & Challenges
Because we draw a lot of our own images, some of our past projects have taken a few months longer than we had initially anticipated. While we do our very best to stick to a deadline, in the past we have had occasions where we've run over the deadline. Sometimes we spot a card or two that we could've done better on, and we don't feel it's ready to be officially printed. Other times, when we have not reached our goal, we will have to negotiate a little longer with printers and supply companies to get the best deal with the budget we have. Being funded early in our campaign will give us more reassurance that we can proceed with printing with less haggling on the horizon!
Unless funding is dismal, we usually try to go above and beyond what we promise backers, but again, we always deliver on our campaigns because we always price our reward tiers accordingly.

Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help our campaign along by sharing our page with your friends too. Word of mouth is always a big help to us as indie artists who don't have the power of a big publisher behind us.

story:
Greetings!
This is Nilesh Desai, a veteran social entrepreneur passionately working on the revival of sick MSME units in India for the last 39 years.

There are around 6.3 crore MSME units currently operating in India of which 10% are sick. When MSME fails due to financial difficulty, it’s not only an economic loss for its owners but it also leads to the loss of employment of people working in it. 

Unemployment not only have an obvious economic impact, but it also creates greater skepticism and pessimism at individual level creating ‘erosion of skills’, increasing crime rates and ultimately resulting in social unrest and disgruntlement. Entrepreneurs’ suicides due to financial distress are reported to be higher than farmers. Unfortunately, this harsh truth often remains concealed and is never spoken of in the real world. 

Now I am at that stage of life where I trying to give back to society. I am pretty sure I can create a great impact using my knowledge and experience and this is what drives my passion towards reviving sick MSMEs. I again believe my goal can affect thousands of lives in a positive way.

I am putting this culminated knowledge both at a personal and organizational level in this book, "The Unexplored Goldmine - The opportunities in the revival of sick MSMEs". The book will be a journey through case studies, and real-life stories of entrepreneurs who struggle to tackle difficult problems to keep their firms up and running. It would be a chance for social entrepreneurs to realize the opportunities that lie hidden in the revival of sick MSMEs. Additionally, the book will be an eye-opener to students who aspire to be entrepreneurs in the future, and also for stakeholders in the MSME sector.

I am also planning on sending copies of the book to all the colleges and institutes libraries as well as MSME institutes, associations.

This project requires a large scale of market research, awareness campaign and human resource intensive industry outreach to succeed, which is currently undergoing. Your support can make the difference and help us to reach every corner of the MSME sector, providing knowledge and revive the industry. Your backing would be highly appreciated.

The book will be available for both pre-sale and sale. Pre-sale is only available for the first 45 days (till 17th June). The book will cost:

INDIA:

Sale: Rs. 350

Pre-sale: Rs. 250

*Shipping charges will be added 

REST OF THE WORLD:

Pre-sale: $5

Sale: $7

*Shipping charges will be added

story:
Why 'Hopeless Romantic'?

If you've noticed over the past year, there's been many discussions revolving about the history of Ethiopia. But more times than not, these discussions or debates about the country's history is from a biased or incomplete vantage lens. People mixing folklore that's been passed down to them or stating second or third hand accounts of rumors as historical facts. What I've noticed seeing all these debates is that people are hungry to learn about their history and where they come from! And as a PhD student in Ethiopic and Arabic Studies, I've been given the unique opportunity to learn a great deal about this history and feel compelled to share with the world what I've learned.

 

 

Why Do You Need All That Money?

Ever wonder what it takes to write a book? It takes a good amount of money. I totally get it, $15,000 is a lot to ask! But between costs for editing, formatting, translation and publishing (for both here in the United States & Ethiopia), the expenses to prepare this book it adds up pretty quickly.

Your contributions to this project, would go directly towards these expenses and allow the world to read, learn, and understand the history of Ethiopia that hasn't been discussed about in public forums.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you're not able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • SHARE THIS LINK: Use → https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/hopeless-rom... to all your family and friends.
  • SPREAD THE WORD: On the minute, on the hour, every day!

And most importantly...

  • PRAYER: Seeing the youth become so divided, truly breaks my heart and it's my hope that this book, while a small step, might become an important step for us all to come together, so I ask for your prayers that this book does come to fruition.

story:
Suffering seems to belong to man’s transcendence: it is one of those points in which man in a certain sense is destined to go beyond himself, and he is called to this in a mysterious way... (Salvifici Doloris, 2).

A couple of years back God took us through tremendous suffering.  I did not ask for this suffering. I did not ask to watch my child go through suffering.  But God's permissive will allowed it. And He took us on a journey...

Then He did what He often does in the formula for my life, He taught me how to endure, He taught me how to cling to Him, and He taught me how to walk my own Gospel of Suffering united with His Son. Then, He asked that I teach it.

Through this suffering, there were revealed principles of suffering and practical steps on how to suffer well. My suffering was transformed in the process, and I have never been the same...

I developed a healing workshop for individuals experiencing tremendous suffering, and I have heard their stories, and we have healed some wounds. During the Covid pandemic, the world came to a halt and through providence, I was inspired to write out the contents of the workshop into a book form.

This is a book about witness and testimony and healing and God, all while suffering.

My name is Dr. Sue Ellen Nolan, MTS, EdD. This project is meant to go out into the world and transform suffering for all those who come in contact with the message.

 

Our Goal

I am crowd-sourcing for publication expenses like:

  • editing
  • formatting
  • cover design
  • publishing 
  • marketing

What You Receive

Unfortunately, I cannot offer any tax incentives; however, we can offer:

  • Autographed copies of the book-(think pre-sale)
  • YOUR NAME mentioned in the acknowledgments
  • The chance to host a Book launch

The Audience

This book was formed from a period of intense, unrelenting suffering. It is written for anyone who suffers which is everyone in some form. The theology is fundamentally Catholic, but transcends all of Christianity and goes directly to our nature and our soul. These principles and practical steps fit the essence of our being...

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can make a financial donation or not, please help spread the word by telling your friends about The Truth of Love in the Truth of Suffering, coming MAY 18, 2021

Of course, don't forget to share this with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+.

story:
At the Drumlummon Institute, our mission is "to promote and publish art and literatures created in Montana and the broader American West". We've reprinted and rejuvenated interest in many neglected Montana authors, including Grace Stone Coates and Thomas Savage. We are delighted to offer our patrons and supporters the opportunity to help fund a reissue of this quirky but quintessential Montana novel. To learn more about Drumlummon, please visit

http://www.drumlummon.org/html/learn-more.html. (Please be patient with our website, as it is currently under construction. Most links should work, though!)

Rick DeMarinis is one of Montana's finest and most versatile writers. He won the prestigious Drue Heinz Contest for his stunning collection, Under the Wheat in 1986. His short story "Gent" (a version of which appears in The Burning Women of Far Cry) was selected by John Updike as one of the top 100 short stories of the century. He's published a dozen novels and countless short stories, and he taught writing as a craft for many years at various universities. In 2016, Rick received a lifetime achievement award from the University of Montana:

 http://missoulian.com/news/local/rick-demarinis...

We love The Burning Women of Far Cry because while it tells a distinctly "Montana" story, it is does not fit into the general category of what people think of when they hear the word "Montana" or think of "Montana literature." This book is in a class alone: it is outrageously funny, deeply tragic, and philosophical in ways that are unusual for any novel, especially one involving a young man working in a sawmill in Montana in the 1960s. We love this novel not just because it tells a great story, but because it stands unique on the landscape of the state's fiction, a singular monument to a class of people seldom noticed who nevertheless epitomize what the great critic (and UM professor) Leslie Fiedler referred to as "The Montana Face."

The new edition will feature an introduction by president of Drumlummon (and University of Great Falls English Professor), Dr. Aaron Parrett, author of  Montana Then and Now (2014); Literary Butte: A History in Novels and Films (2015); and the forthcoming Maple and Lead, a letterpress fiction collaboration with printmaker Seth Roby. 

Here's what this campaign is all about and what we're raising money for: a handsome, affordable, paperback edition of The Burning Women of Far Cry . We want to get this book back in the hands of readers across the state! 

Here's what we think it will cost to make that happen: 

$2000 to remunerate the author for a new edition; 

$1000 to have a copy of the first edition scanned into document form, so that we can edit and redesign the text (no electronic file of the book exists presently);

$2000 for layout and design and editing. 

$4500 for 1000 copies (factory printed, perfect bound). 

$500 for shipping. 

That's it, in a nutshell. 

Why are we crowdfunding this? All of our previous projects have relied on the generosity of our donors and patrons, many of whom have supported Drumlummon from its inception in 2006. Like most nonprofits, we fund our publishing efforts out of the funds we raise throughout the year. But for this project, we wanted to try something different. We want to extend our invitation for a chance to support getting this book back in print to all of Rick's fans, and to all fans of Montana's rich literary tradition, to folks who may not hear about it otherwise.  This volume will be Volume 7 in the Drumlummon Montana Literary Masters Series (previous titles include Thomas Savage's The Pass, Grace Stone Coates' Clear Title, and the selected poems of Roger Dunsmore [forthcoming]).  

We're hoping that people with whom we share this page will not only contribute to it, but that they will spread the word and pass the link along! 

What we're offering you: while we will welcome any and all contributions to our campaign, we're offering some excellent premiums and rewards to contributors at various levels. Whether you pre-order your copy of The Burning Women of Far Cry, or you choose one of the other premiums we're offering, we want contributors to get something tangible for supporting literature and the arts in Montana. (Of course, we are grateful and deeply appreciative to donors who are generous enough to just contribute to the cause without signing up for a reward also!)

As our board president has conducted two very successful crowdfunding campaigns of his own, we are reasonably confident that this effort will succeed, and that within a few months we will be distributing copies of this amazing book to ours and Rick's fans,  patrons, and benefactors, we acknowledge that the reality of publishing books involves certain risks. But everyone on the board at Drumlummon has been involved with non-profits and the arts in Montana one way or another for decades, and we feel we can rely on our extensive networks of logistical support to head off any crises as we carry this project to completion. 

We're tremendously excited to see this book back in the hands of readers who love Montana fiction, and we are sincerely grateful for your interest in and support of this project!

story:
Story of My Book

My Song to Sing explores my personal journey through early adulthood to find themes and wisdom from what is a very transformative time for us all. I share my experiences, thoughts, and impressions from high school and college to ultimately reflect on my personal development and how we all do truly encounter the same, significant questions when determining the trajectory of our lives.

My name is Adam Brock and I am the author of My Song to Sing. I wrote this memoir because I’ve always enjoyed doing things a little differently from the norm, or what’s traditionally expected of us as we grow up and discover who we want to be. Now that the dust has finally settled since my graduation from college this past spring, it’s clear that my path from a young ice hockey player and referee to a clarinet performer, then to an engineering major, and finally to an English teaching assistant in Austria is no accident. People sometimes ask me, “Adam, how can an engineer go teach English in Austria?” I like to think that this book is my most comprehensive attempt at giving them an answer.

In reading this memoir, you will discover how you truly have the power to take a leap of faith on your ambitions, passions, and dreams. All I ask is that you travel back in time with me in my book to see how analyzing our pasts is the key to transforming today’s uncertainty into the future we desire. You will love My Song to Sing if you have an interest in understanding how my transformative journey shares themes and messages which resonate from mine to yours. We'll prove together how you too can make the change you want to see in your life.

Ultimately, I hope that my memoir inspires reflection on questions such as:

  • What are the necessary building blocks for facilitating effective and intentional change?
  • How do we navigate uncertainty and external pressures?
  • What will bring us peace and happiness with our contributions to society?
  • How do we take a leap of faith to pursue our ambitions and dreams?

 

I very much look forward to exploring these questions in my memoir and taking you along for a ride in the passenger seat of my car as we travel on the long, winding road that brought my life to where it is now in Austria.

My Song to Sing in 7 Parts

Part 1 contains the introduction and my experiences with ice hockey and music performance during high school that facilitate the beginning of my self-discovery.

Part 2 describes my first year as a student at Temple University, a time where I find that our expectations in life don’t always match the impending reality. I learn in this period about the power of dissent and it’s role in starting what would be four years of personal transformation.

Part 3 takes us across the Atlantic ocean to Derry, Northern Ireland. Only after significant exploration of Ireland’s green, picturesque countryside and the culture of a people divided in their struggle for unity do I discover that international education is one of the most powerful tools for understanding our complex, modern world.

Part 4 sheds light onto the culture and realities of the ice hockey officiating community. After learning about the fundamental principles of achieving success as an ice hockey referee, I find that it is through building relationships that I can give back to the sport I love and realize connections between my passions for officiating and music.

Part 5 transitions to my junior year in the late-fall of 2018. The time of reckoning has come; my future after college hinges on the outcome of a few major decisions and the attitude with which I am to make them. Only one question remains: am I ready to take a leap of faith?

Part 6 brings us to the German city of Leipzig. It is on my second study abroad program that my love of international education focuses to the power of language instruction and cultural exchange in Germany. The German phrase of ohne Bedenken (without reservation) proves to be critical as I prepare for the culminating language experience of this trip.

Part 7 concludes my memoir with recent events from 2020, a year like no other. Despite a raging pandemic and drastic changes to society, I achieve catharsis and contentment with my leap of faith and personal transformation during college. I leave Temple in the summer of 2020 and begin traveling towards a future whose uncertainty is perhaps greater than ever before.

What I Need & What You'll Get

I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the cost of publication. Money raised will go towards:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish.

My goal is to sell at least 200 copies to fund to fund publication as an ebook, paperback, hardcover, and audiobook. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order My Song to Sing such as:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book and a thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

About the Author

Adam Brock lives in Graz, Austria and works as a US Teaching Assistant with Fulbright Austria and the Austrian Federal Ministry of Education, Science, and Research. He teaches lessons on American culture, history, politics, music, arts, and the English language to Austrian high school students at the Bundesrealgymnasium Leibnitz and the Höhere Technische Bundeslehranstalt in Kaindorf a.d. Sulm.

He decided to write this memoir because he has a story to tell, one which shares themes that translate from his life to yours. Adam also aims to inspire his audience that, though their lives differ from one to another, we all have stories and need to tell them. Who knows: they might just find their way into a book.

When he’s not teaching English lessons or spending time writing his memoir, Adam enjoys learning jazz piano, reading about American and European history, practicing German, and exploring the city of Graz and surrounding areas in Austria. For more information, you can connect with Adam Brock at adamnbrock@gmail.com and the following social media platforms:

Facebook: @adambrock.author
Instagram: @adambrock_author
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/adam-brock32

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a memoir is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order.
I will also be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone, publishes, and is ready to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #mysongtosing and tag me as well as my publisher.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! It’s been quite the journey to this point and I can’t wait to see what lies ahead with this new memoir.

Adam Nicholas Brock
story_txt:
Story of My BookMy Song to Sing explores my personal journey through early adulthood to find themes and wisdom from what is a very transformative time for us all. I share my experiences, thoughts, and impressions from high school and college to ultimately reflect on my personal development and how we all do truly encounter the same, significant questions when determining the trajectory of our lives.My name is Adam Brock and I am the author of My Song to Sing. I wrote this memoir because I’ve always enjoyed doing things a little differently from the norm, or what’s traditionally expected of us as we grow up and discover who we want to be. Now that the dust has finally settled since my graduation from college this past spring, it’s clear that my path from a young ice hockey player and referee to a clarinet performer, then to an engineering major, and finally to an English teaching assistant in Austria is no accident. People sometimes ask me, “Adam, how can an engineer go teach English in Austria?” I like to think that this book is my most comprehensive attempt at giving them an answer.In reading this memoir, you will discover how you truly have the power to take a leap of faith on your ambitions, passions, and dreams. All I ask is that you travel back in time with me in my book to see how analyzing our pasts is the key to transforming today’s uncertainty into the future we desire. You will love My Song to Sing if you have an interest in understanding how my transformative journey shares themes and messages which resonate from mine to yours. We'll prove together how you too can make the change you want to see in your life.Ultimately, I hope that my memoir inspires reflection on questions such as:
What are the necessary building blocks for facilitating effective and intentional change?
How do we navigate uncertainty and external pressures?
What will bring us peace and happiness with our contributions to society?
How do we take a leap of faith to pursue our ambitions and dreams?
 I very much look forward to exploring these questions in my memoir and taking you along for a ride in the passenger seat of my car as we travel on the long, winding road that brought my life to where it is now in Austria.My Song to Sing in 7 PartsPart 1 contains the introduction and my experiences with ice hockey and music performance during high school that facilitate the beginning of my self-discovery.Part 2 describes my first year as a student at Temple University, a time where I find that our expectations in life don’t always match the impending reality. I learn in this period about the power of dissent and it’s role in starting what would be four years of personal transformation.Part 3 takes us across the Atlantic ocean to Derry, Northern Ireland. Only after significant exploration of Ireland’s green, picturesque countryside and the culture of a people divided in their struggle for unity do I discover that international education is one of the most powerful tools for understanding our complex, modern world.Part 4 sheds light onto the culture and realities of the ice hockey officiating community. After learning about the fundamental principles of achieving success as an ice hockey referee, I find that it is through building relationships that I can give back to the sport I love and realize connections between my passions for officiating and music.Part 5 transitions to my junior year in the late-fall of 2018. The time of reckoning has come; my future after college hinges on the outcome of a few major decisions and the attitude with which I am to make them. Only one question remains: am I ready to take a leap of faith?Part 6 brings us to the German city of Leipzig. It is on my second study abroad program that my love of international education focuses to the power of language instruction and cultural exchange in Germany. The German phrase of ohne Bedenken (without reservation) proves to be critical as I prepare for the culminating language experience of this trip.Part 7 concludes my memoir with recent events from 2020, a year like no other. Despite a raging pandemic and drastic changes to society, I achieve catharsis and contentment with my leap of faith and personal transformation during college. I leave Temple in the summer of 2020 and begin traveling towards a future whose uncertainty is perhaps greater than ever before.What I Need & What You'll GetI set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the cost of publication. Money raised will go towards:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish.
My goal is to sell at least 200 copies to fund to fund publication as an ebook, paperback, hardcover, and audiobook. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order My Song to Sing such as:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book and a thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
About the AuthorAdam Brock lives in Graz, Austria and works as a US Teaching Assistant with Fulbright Austria and the Austrian Federal Ministry of Education, Science, and Research. He teaches lessons on American culture, history, politics, music, arts, and the English language to Austrian high school students at the Bundesrealgymnasium Leibnitz and the Höhere Technische Bundeslehranstalt in Kaindorf a.d. Sulm.He decided to write this memoir because he has a story to tell, one which shares themes that translate from his life to yours. Adam also aims to inspire his audience that, though their lives differ from one to another, we all have stories and need to tell them. Who knows: they might just find their way into a book.When he’s not teaching English lessons or spending time writing his memoir, Adam enjoys learning jazz piano, reading about American and European history, practicing German, and exploring the city of Graz and surrounding areas in Austria. For more information, you can connect with Adam Brock at adamnbrock@gmail.com and the following social media platforms:Facebook: @adambrock.authorInstagram: @adambrock_authorLinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/adam-brock32Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a memoir is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order.I will also be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone, publishes, and is ready to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpPlease share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #mysongtosing and tag me as well as my publisher.You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.Thank you so much for all of your love and support! It’s been quite the journey to this point and I can’t wait to see what lies ahead with this new memoir.All my best,Adam Nicholas Brock

story:
What will be achieved?

        

                                                    The Diary

An historic  WWII diary will be returned to the country where it was written - Thailand.  The diary will be housed at the Thailand-Burma Railway Center (TBRC), preserved indefinitely for future generations to read.  My father, Dr. Edward Emery was a physician in the British Royal Army Medical Corps when he was captured by the Japanese Imperial Army in December 1942.  Initially incarcerated in the infamous 'Changi' jail in Singapore, he was later moved by rail up to Thailand, where he spent two years in three separate POW camps, including Chaunggahla-ya, Thanbaya and finally at the Tarsao hospital in Kanchanaburi where he cared for men working on the "Death Railway".  Dr. Emery secretly kept this diary at great personal risk; the Japanese would torture, even kill, any POW found writing a journal or documenting daily events.

I have dreamed of returning my dad's diary to the place where it was written ever since he bequeathed it to me upon his death in 2002.  It is something I feel destined to do.  To visit and quietly reflect for a moment in the places where he wrote these pages, often in such unimaginable desperation, means the world to me.  The diary pages are fragile, beginning to disintegrate; placing it in a museum is the right thing to do, especially one located so close to where it was written and dedicated to preserving the history of this terrible time.  The compassionate medical attention that my father was able to provide the countless men under his care will not be forgotten.  Edward Emery's account is a rare and important historical document.  This journey will help me return it to where it belongs and to protect it for posterity. 

                                                     The Novel

                                                                                 

After reading my father's diary, I was moved to write a novel inspired by his journey.  I began to research the Pacific War and was astonished at how little information has been written about it.  I learned of atrocities carried out by the Japanese Imperial Army that were comparable to those of the Nazis, yet most of these were virtually undocumented in the 'West'.  Inadvertently I stumbled upon the 'Golden Lily'.  The ramifications of this covert Japanese operation still linger 73 years later.  Clandestine deals made in 1945  between the OSS (former CIA), the Japanese Mafia and the Imperial family continue to impact global financial and political arenas.  Of course, it is hotly denied by the implicated governments, however, thanks to the dedication and courage of a few individuals, unearthed documentation proving its validity is now being brought to light and accepted more widely. 

This predicament gave me an even more compelling reason to create a novel that not only documented the historical journey of my father, but provided an authentic backdrop for an exciting story that could entertain, while educating the public.  And, because social issues are so close to my heart, the story weaves in timeless themes, still sadly prevalent today, such as sex trafficking, exploitation of the environment and Indigenous peoples, all fueled by corruption and greed.  The novel is completed.  I am actively seeking a Literary Agent/Publisher.  This campaign will help me to promote my novel to prospective parties.  If I am not able to publish through those channels, I will self-publish in 2016.

Your contribution

  • Will fund the return of the diary to where it was written, where it will remain encased in a museum.  
  • Will enable me to promote and market my new novel, inspired by the diary, to attract the interest of prospective agents and publishers.
  • Will raise awareness about prevailing social issues in the region (and globally) such as sex trafficking; the displacement of Indigenous peoples and the importance of the region's biodiversity.  
  • Will allow me to volunteer at centers in Thailand and Malaya for children and girls rescued from sex trafficking.

I will also be Live-BLOGGING the journey.  The BLOG will facilitate:

a)  Highlighting of locations featured in the novel: temples such as the Temple of the Golden Dragon,  ancient Khmer cities and The Royal Belum State Park

b)  Introductions to admirable people we meet along the way such as  Sudarat who is working with several NGO's to help victims of sex-trafficking as many young girls are kidnapped from the Hilltribes.

c)  Sharing information about the Orang Asli Indigenous people of the Malay Peninsula who have made this region their home for 55,000 years.

d)  Illumination of Sustainability projects happening in the Malay Peninsula.  

                                  Who am I?

                                

My name is Rosie Emery.  I was born in Kuala Lumpur, Malaya, grew up in Sherwood Forest, U.K., and currently split my time between Canada and the US.  Between birth and now… I’ve chalked up a few miles and done a variety of things along the way: 

I’m an… author, singer/songwriter,television writer, producer & director as well as an environmental education program creator & facilitator amongst other things.  I have set out to accomplish many projects in my lifetime, I am proud to say, they have all been realized.  I am anxious to see this latest endeavour through to fruition as well.

In my thirty-year career as a creative artist I have touched many lives: through my international children’s musical tours, my children’s music CD’s and the award-winning children’s television shows I've been privileged to write and produce.  None of it would have been possible without the support of family, friends and individual donors.  If you’d like to learn more, please visit my website at: www.rosieemery.com (full bio @ bottom left corner).

Budget

Estimate for 42 days of promotion/marketing & volunteer work:

  • RT-Flight Miami-Bangkok-Singapore-Montreal      2500.00 
  • Travel within Thailand/Malaya                                        500.00
  • Per diem (Hotels/food) 42 days @ $75 a day          3150.00
  • Pre-trip: Publicist/graphics/marketing                      1850.00
  • TOTAL                                                                        8000.00

                                                                                       

                                                      

                                           A signed copy of the book

                                                 

                             A personally tailored WWII Memorial Album

                                                

   A pack of 5 original gift cards          A week's stay at La Casa Resort, B.C.


                                                       

        Be a 'Feature' character in the Sequel to "Pursuit of the Golden Lily"

                          

                                A week's stay at Casa Karma, Puerto Vallarta, Mexico

                                      

                          Set of two, autographed copies of Robert Hilliard's novels                                           

             

                  Digital Downloads of Rosie Emery's Fun Children's Music                                  

                                    Thank you!

                                                  

Thank you.... for taking the time to learn about my father's story and mine ... for your contribution if you have made one, and even if you haven't, it means a lot to me that you stopped by.  We all give what we can in different ways.

story:
My Story....

I'm Chad Almquist, I have been a photographer for 20+ years. Over the past 5 years,  I have done freelance work for 97.3 Kiro Radio's MyNorthwest.com, 99.9 Kisw.com and have covered many events. I have also covered tryouts and games for the Seattle Mist Lingerie Football team. Which my images have appeared on Linda Thomas's blog on MyNorthwest.com. 

Last year I started doing modeling photography. I have done Vintage Pinup, glamour, beach, goth, zombie, and much more. 


My Plan....

My Plan for 2012 is to launch YumeUniverse.com to a new level. With an accompanying magazine,

Featuring  woman, art, stories, and etc. It's aimed toward a male audience. Similar to other men's magazines. Yet set to a higher level of sexiness and class. Also a Sci-Fi/action/horror mag slated for late 2012, hopefully before the world ends.

Also to offer photography services for events, as in weddings, parties, and much more.

 

With Your Support........

I will be able to upgrade my equipment. This will take the magazine and other projects to the next level. I need more up to date technology that will free up the constraints and to make me more competitive.  I.e. Lens,speedlights and etc.

Also to be able to get the prints,calendars,posters and the Magazines, so my Girls can start making some money. Which is one of the most important aspects to my 2012 plan.  

 

This is a breakdown of the planned equipment:

Nikon D7000/D700

Nikon 50mm 1.8 Lens

Nikon 28mm-70mm 2.8 lens

Nikon 80mm-200mm 2.8

2 Nikon SB900 speedlights

Battery Grip

Blackrapid Strap

Service Costs

With this equipment, it will open up a new dimension of creativity and what I can offer in photography services.

Also, I just learned on 6/26/2012, My Mom has Breast Cancer!  I have been out of work for a long time. I still live with her. I need to build my business to help support her.  I totally believe in what I do. I love my Mom dearly and want her to be proud of me. I want her to see me succeed. 

This is why your help is so needed and appreciated. 


What's in it for You?

I have created different perk levels. Just check the side to see the various
incentives to the fundraiser

I know not everyone can help out financially, but by posting a link to this campaign on your Facebook ,Twitter, Google+ or even by word of mouth,  you’re really helping out. Thank you!
