story:
Wow!!  Thank you, everyone!  The campaign is over, but you can still pre-order the book on our website:

www.bluebirdhillhomestead.com/peter-and-the-owl/

 

I did it!  I finished the book!!  And all the illustrations too!!!

You can pre-order your Hardcover copy of this children's book at 25% off the cover price!  I am raising the money to publish the book myself and have it printed locally.

The Book

The idea for this book came to me when I was sitting on top of the ridge on the backside of the Anahola Mountains on Kauai.  I was there to ask permission for Jonathan and I to renew our wedding vows on top of the tallest peak, Kalalea.  The answer, of course, was of course!  And in that space of listening I heard Peter introduce himself and share his story.  This is the first in a series of children's books about kids connecting with a power animal.

What does this mean?

An animal totem often comes into our life when we are struggling with something or are just out of balance, like when we have been hyper focused on some issue and we see a majestic bald eagle flying overhead, reminding us to take a step back and look at the bigger picture.  Peter's friends have betrayed him at school, and he meets an owl in the forest behind his house that teaches him several lessons, including compassion for himself and the courage to face his friends.  This deals with the issues around bullying, and self confidence, as well as the real magic of nature connection.

How You Can Help

Ordering Peter and the Owl now means I can go ahead and have it printed and you will receive your signed copy by mid-January.  There is a slight chance that they will be able to complete the printing by Christmas, but I can't guarantee it for this campaign. 

I am also offering a box of books at a deeper discount for those of you that would like to sell it through your store.

The book is written with elementary school aged kids in mind, but it's the kind of story that all ages will appreciate.  I'll be posting more updates with the actual story in the layouts as we prepare them for the printer.

My amazingly talented friend, Rachel Navarro, is helping me layout the book and prepare the files for the printer.  She has her own self-published children's book called Jellybean and Herbert, in case you want to check it out!

Wow!!  Thank you, everyone!  The campaign is over, but you can still pre-order the book on our website:
www.bluebirdhillhomestead.com/peter-and-the-owl/
 
I did it!  I finished the book!!  And all the illustrations too!!!
You can pre-order your Hardcover copy of this children's book at 25% off the cover price!  I am raising the money to publish the book myself and have it printed locally.
The Book
The idea for this book came to me when I was sitting on top of the ridge on the backside of the Anahola Mountains on Kauai.  I was there to ask permission for Jonathan and I to renew our wedding vows on top of the tallest peak, Kalalea.  The answer, of course, was of course!  And in that space of listening I heard Peter introduce himself and share his story.  This is the first in a series of children's books about kids connecting with a power animal.
What does this mean?
An animal totem often comes into our life when we are struggling with something or are just out of balance, like when we have been hyper focused on some issue and we see a majestic bald eagle flying overhead, reminding us to take a step back and look at the bigger picture.  Peter's friends have betrayed him at school, and he meets an owl in the forest behind his house that teaches him several lessons, including compassion for himself and the courage to face his friends.  This deals with the issues around bullying, and self confidence, as well as the real magic of nature connection.
How You Can Help

story:
ATTN: Fellow Indiegogo-ers looking for exposure, recognition, and & the opportunity to help entrepreneurs and startups on a budget.

I'm offering you a special dedication, global exposure in the entrepreneurial community, and a chance to invest in future entrepreneurs in return for helping me publish The Shareable Advertising Manual:

How will the $10,000 be spent?

  • Purchasing my remaining research,
  • Taking time away from my desk to finish writing the manual,
  • Hiring a professional editor to proofread the chapters.

Why are you writing The Shareable Advertising Manual?

Because nearly 50% of startups fail within the first 4 years due to:

  • inexperience
  • the entrepreneur loses hope
  • lack of market awareness
  • the entrepreneur falls in love with product/business
  • lack of clear focus
  • inadequate research and development
  • bad advice from family and friends
  • a bad product idea to begin with
  • wrongly anticipated costs
  • strategic marketing mistakes. (Source)

Two major problems are that many entrepreneurs and startups:

  1. don't know how to build an effective branding strategy to anticipate and avoid failure and/or
  2. don't have the budget to hire professional agencies to advise them. 

What makes The Shareable Advertising Manual unique:

Starting from scratch, The Shareable Advertising Manual takes you step-by-step through every aspect of a professionally-made branding strategy. It blends candid interviews with professionals from the advertising, public relations, law, and other industries with books, case studies, and research from behavioral economics, sociology, psychology and other related fields.

Included alongside the research are 400+ questions for you to answer that will become your complete professional branding strategy.

The Shareable Advertising Manual is ideal for small businesses who don't yet have the budget to hire professional advertising agencies, and the ideal introduction into the branding process for innovative and up-and-coming entrepreneurs.

  1. It's 4 manuals in one: Branding, Advertising, Earned Media, Strategic Planning
  2. It's predominantly psychologically-based, focusing on understanding your consumer and then building your brand upon those insights
  3. It blends over 2 years of in-depth investigative research with candid interviews with award-winning creative directors, copywriters, strategic planners, and other experts from top agencies around the world such as Ogilvy, Y&R, HAVAS, TBWA, KBMG, AR NEW YORK as well as TED speakers to name a few.
  4. It's 1,000s of professional advertising and branding tips, techniques, and advice.
  5. It's written for startups and businesses who can't yet afford to hire professional agencies.
  6. It's your branding strategy wrapped up in 400 questions.
  7. It's solutions that matter to up-and-coming startups on a budget.
  8. It asks all the questions you would ask the industry leading professionals if you had the opportunity to sit down with them and pick their brain over coffee for an hour.
  9. Much, much more...

What do contributors get?

Depending on the contributor status you pledge at...

1.) Global exposure for your brand and a steady stream of new visitors to your website:

  • A permanent special dedication in the preface of EVERY edition of The Shareable Advertising Manual with your photo, website, name, and country.
  • A permanent special dedication on my website in the form of a 125x125 screenshot linking to your website along with a corresponding facebook like button.

2.) Exclusive access to The Shareble Advertising Manual before it's made publically available:

  • An exclusive copy of The Shareable Advertising Manual sent to you chapter-by-chapter as they are finished and BEFORE the manual is made publically available.
  • A one-on-one skype session with myself and Ivan Pejcic, Strategic Planner for Ogilvy to answer your questions and help you build a branding strategy.

It’s my way of saying thank you for helping me make The Shareable Advertising Manual possible, and a way of sharing the credit with you to all the future startups and small businesses who will have a professionally branded strategy.

The Shareable Advertising Manual's proposed timeline

(Actual dates may vary depending on the amount of money raised)

STEP 1: JUNE-JULY 2013 - Crowd funding to obtain the money needed to publish the manual. 
STEP 2: JULY 2013 - Contributors reserving website dedication added to website 
STEP 3: AUG 2013 - Purchase remaining research to finish the manual
STEP 4: AUG 2013- SEPT 2014 - Chapters will be sent to contributors as they are finished. 
STEP 5: OCT 2014 - The Shareable Advertising manual made publically available

The Shareable Advertising Manual Table of Contents:

The Shareable Advertising Manual is organized thematically into 4 individual manuals:

MANUAL 1: THE (RE)BRANDING STRATEGY

CHAPTER 01 The Consumer Brain Dissected
CHAPTER 02 Consumer Psychology & Purchasing Habits
CHAPTER 03 Industry Analysis & Market Research
CHAPTER 04 Disruptive Business Models
CHAPTER 05 Creating your Branding Strategy
CHAPTER 06 Product and Package Design

MANUAL 2: THE ADVERTISING STRATEGY

CHAPTER 07 Advertising Campaign Overview
CHAPTER 08 Brief and Goal Formation
CHAPTER 09 Idea Brainstorming and Development
CHAPTER 10 Idea Implementation
CHAPTER 11 Running Advertising Campaign Analytics
CHAPTER 12 Common Misconceptions
CHAPTER 13 Advertising on a Budget

MANUAL 3: THE EARNED MEDIA STRATEGY

CHAPTER 14 Communication Management
CHAPTER 15 Content Management
CHAPTER 16 Public Relations Management
CHAPTER 17 Customer Relationship Management
CHAPTER 18 Legal Situations

MANUAL 4: THE BRANDING WORKBOOK

About the author

Joshua Smith is a Paris-based American entrepreneur in the advertising, marketing, and public relations industries.

His position gives him rare access to creative directors, copywriters, strategic planners, and other branding experts from some of the most influential agencies around the world such as Ogilvy, Y&R, HAVAS, TBWA, KBMG, and AR NEW YORK to name a few.

Read his interviews with some of the industry leaders: shareableadvertising.com

story:
The Chulita Story

About the Author

I am a single Mom of a wonderful girl!  Born and raised in El Paso, Texas I had a wonderful childhood growing up in a colorful, creative, loud, crazy and funny Latino family full of great food, music and love.  Always positive, my family encouraged us creatively and with me, it was a huge impact on my life. 

I studied and received a degree in Fashion Design and moved to Dallas to begin my creative goals.  I realized my dream of becoming  a fashion designer, however, in the back of my mind always wanted to do more and give more to the world.  I was greatly influenced by my daughter.  Raising her alone made me want to pass on the stories, culture, music and recipes I grew up with.

As the economy changed, I saw manufacturers close and businesses dissolve..the climate of design jobs and companies diminished when everything moved overseas, I needed to reinvent myself and keep positive.  I began telling my daughter stories of a character named Chulita and her friends.  This kept me positive and my daughter loved the stories. As the stories evolved, I started to develop and draw the characters.   I was excited to share my stories and wanted to share these books with the world, books that I wish I had when I was little  Characters that I could relate to.

The Goal!

I am in need of $2500.00 to complete the printing of this book.   I have been able to begin the process, but need help in getting the final printing done.  My ultimate goal is to build this into a brand.  With my background in design I have also designed bookmarks, posters, clothing, accessories and even toys based on the characters I have created!  All these are positive and fun influences for children.  I have also created several characters for future development of an animated series which I hope to produce once the books get off the ground!  These are all ideas in the works, but my books will be the first goal I would like to reach.

If I don't reach my entire goal, whatever I receive will go towards the printing of the first book in the Chulita series. Every little bit counts and no matter what you can give, it will be greatly appreciated!

The Impact

I truly believe this will be a positive catalyst for educators and parents. I would like to help lower the dropout rate for latinos in our communities and  feel that if parents  could read to their kids in English as their children are learning to read and speak English; they would be able to participate in the learning process with their young children.  An important part of school is how much parents are involved and I believe these books will truly make an impact. I also feel for English speaking kids and their families this will be a wonderful and fun learnng experience in a new language and culture! And while their kids are learning Spanish....so will they! Not only learning the language but learning about the Latin culture.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute ....you can still help!  Spread the word about these books to educators, parents and anyone you feel would help or be interested in this project!

Like it, post it and please share it...  Thank you so much for all your help!

story:
The little Giraffe Fili

Fili is a very special little giraffe, because none of her legs is the same size as the others! But because Fili loves to run and jump just like all young giraffes, this is a big problem for her... Until she finds a new friend in clever Shoemaker John. 

  • Lovely little story with impressive drawings
  • perfect for Kindergarden children
  • explains about that not everyone is the same but should be treated the same 
  • by the Austrian author Wolfgang Stricker

Help translating and publishing this book for English speaking children. 

What´s the aim? 

We want to publish the book in English and reach a wider audience this way.

  • Therefore we want to crowdfund 1,500 USD. This is approximately the sum we calculate for translation, some adaptions on the pictures. (there will be additional drawing sketches for the English version too) and of course the publishing process. 

The Impact

The little giraffe Fili is specially written for children who may feel a bit lonely in their heart and shall help them to overcome those feelings. The nice book is telling the story of Fili, a giraffe, which feels also lonely sometimes, because she is different than the other giraffe kids, but then finds a friend on her own also.

  • Fili is already published in German and reached many kids and parents also
  • Now also children with English as mother tongue shall have access to the book, which is perfect for learn reading also.
  • The wonderful pictures at each page help them to understand the story, even if they can not read perfectly yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, please fund Fili´s campaign. You can also support us by 

  • join the facebook group of the little giraffe Fili
  • use the Indiegogo share tools
  • and make other people aware of the campaign 

Thank you so much!

story:
The Cupbearers

                              


The Cupbearers features some of the most well documented gay relationships in ancient Greece, Rome and the Middle East. This book began as an illustrated project of my paintings, and developed into a collection of stories. Some of the paintings in The Cupbearers started out as an exhibition project called House of the Faun. Though these stories are factual, this is not academic gay history. It’s more creative nonfiction. I’ve found that most books written about gay history are scholarly and can be difficult to follow for the nonacademic reader. For that reason, I wanted to keep these adventures short and enjoyable.

For LGBT people, much of their history is hidden, manipulated or ignored. It’s important for this information to become mainstream. Many people, gay and straight, are unaware of the rich and varied heritage of the LGBT people, the numerous contributions they have made, and the crucial roles they have played in history. People struggling for equality draw strength from their shared culture, traditions and history. If we are to continue to change the future for LGBT people, we must also reclaim the past. Please help me to make my small contribution to re-envisioning LGBT history by supporting this project.

Pre-order With Your Contribution Now!

A BIG THANKS TO THOSE WHO HAVE ALREADY GIVEN. WE ARE GETTING SO CLOSE TO OUR GOAL!  WE ARE IN THE LAST WEEK OF THE CAMPAIGN AND NEED YOUR HELP FOR THIS LAST PUSH.  PLEASE DO NOT DELAY IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT CONTRIBUTING AND FOR THOSE WHO ARE NEW TO THIS SITE, ANY SIZE DONATION IS VERY APPRECIATED.  TOGETHER WE CAN ACCOMPLISH THE PUBLICATION OF THIS ILLUSTRATED-GAY HISTORY-SHORT STORY BOOK!!

Below you'll see all the fun perks we've put together. By choosing to donate $100 ("King of Kings" level) or above, you'll ensure your pre-ordered copy of The Cupbearers. Please choose one of the many levels below*  If you cannot make a donation at this time, please help us by sharing with your friends, family and coworkers.  

If you have any questions, just ask in the "comment" section or drop me a line at LLRAY01@aol.com

WE HAVE MADE OUR GOAL! THANKS TO THE GENEROUS DONORS!!!!

Donation Levels

Hero -$10 - An acknowledgement on The Cupbearers Facebook page and IndieGoGo

Prince -$25 - A poster of The Cupbearers cover

King -$50 - A poster and a tote bag 

King of Kings -$100 - A signed copy of The Cupbearers and poster 

Pharaoh -$250 - A signed copy of The Cupbearers, poster and mug 

Emperor -$500 - A signed copy of The Cupbearers, poster, mug, and an original drawing 

Demigod -$1,000 - A signed copy of The Cupbearers, poster, and a choice of one of four original pieces from the book (painting choice determined by ordinal donation)

*varying dollar amount donations other than shown, will be "perked" 

at closest lower level.


                    

                                    Antinous as Osiris-House of the Faun


                                                         Credentials

Linda has been painting since she was ten years old, a skill she learned from her father. Over the last 20 years her painting interest focused on gay historical subjects. Her first LGBT project, House of the Faun debuted at the University of Chicago for the Future of the Queer Past, a major historical conference. House of the Faun  traveled next to Chicago's Gerber Hart Library for a month long exhibition. She was then offered an exclusive exhibition at the C. Montgomery Ward Gallery (University of Illinois)  for LGBT Pride Month. Linda holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from Columbia College in Chicago where she double majored in Fine Art and Illustration. 


My Personal Story

 

                  


My name is Linda Larson, and I am the author and Illustrator of The Cupbearers.  In my lifetime I've witnessed the progression of modern gay history from Stonewall to Marriage Equality. While I love all kinds of history, my true passion is LGBT history in antiquity.

My interest in lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) history began in my teens, at 15 years old, when I found a book called Child of the Sun tucked in a bag in my dad’s closet. This little book changed my life. It was a paperback novel about a Roman emperor named Elagabalus. This young man was only 14 when he became emperor and was just 18 when he died. The book was pretty racy, but it piqued my curiosity about his life. While I searched in vain for information on him, I was drawn into the lives of other historical figures, and before I knew it, I became a full blown history nerd. 


                                                                    Elagabalus


Back then it was difficult to find documented information about gay men and lesbians. So while concentrating on the mainstream history of the eras which interested me, I picked up some information about various artists and well-known people who were gay. With the advent of the Internet I was able to easily find historical sources about them. I also discovered many surprising and famous figures on gay history websites. Most of the names mentioned were people that I had always felt drawn to as well.

Unfortunately, I find that in mainstream history, the lives of great artists, writers, statesmen and kings are often portrayed inaccurately. Socrates, Alexander the Great, Richard the Lionhearted, Leonardo Da Vinci, and Michelangelo are just a few well-known figures who are often portrayed as heterosexual. Frequently, their homosexuality or bisexuality is ignored, while any whisper of heterosexuality, no matter how faint, is exploited. Even in mainstream media, this trend persists. Those who try to accurately portray the bisexuality of a great figure still face an onslaught of criticism and malice.


Take Oliver Stone, for an example. When he attempted to portray Alexander the Great (accurately), as bisexual in his film Alexander, he was bitterly criticized for it. The Greek government refused to let him film his epic in Greece, while a band of Greek lawyers threatened a lawsuit against Warner Brothers if Stone portrayed Alexander as bisexual. There were many critics on the home front as well, and Stone was forced to cut homoerotic love scenes.  A year or so before the release of Alexander, a conference about Alexander in Greece was overrun by protestors and a speaker had to be removed by the local police. The speaker was about to present a paper on Alexander’s sexuality. 

 The real Alexander fell apart when his boyhood lover Hephaestion died of typhus. His generals had to remove him by force from Hephaestion’s body after a prolonged fit of grief. Alexander demanded Hephaestion be given divine status, and threw him the most expensive funeral in history. Less than a year later, Alexander died. His 20-year relationship with Hephaestion is one of the most well documented in history, but Alexander is still portrayed as implausibly straight in many films and books.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the current status of  The Cupbearers?

The book is within a few weeks of completion. The layout needs to be designed, and six illustrations need to be completed.

What is completed?

Forty plus illustrations have been photographed. The manuscript has been edited and finalized.

How will the money be used?

Layout and design of the book and cover; payment for the proofreaders and photographer; and publication.

What is this book about?

The Cupbearers  is about well-known rulers in antiquity and their male favorites. It covers a period of history from approx. 2500 BCE (BC) to 225 CE (AD) in Greece, Rome and the Bible lands. Soon after this period, in the early 4th century CE, Christianity became the dominant religion in the West and changed forever the sexual dynamics of the ancient world. 

What is a "Cupbearer?"

In antiquity, a cupbearer traditionally represents a trusted servant who serves a king or noble. In Greek mythology, Ganymede became the cupbearer and favorite of Zeus. The role of cupbearer and the name Ganymede became synonymous with the ideal of the young male favorite.

What is The Cupbearers' message?

The book dispels the modern prejudices against same sex love by telling the truth about gay rulers in antiquity. It documents an important segment of history that is frequently ignored, or distorted.

How did  The Cupbearers become illustrated?

The narrative is told through a combination of illustration and text, working in tandem while creating a mood. Like previous projects, The Cupbearers began as an artistic project. I began writing narrative to accompany the paintings. Also, as an illustrator, I’ve always been drawn to picture books. I love to collect books with great illustrations. 


Book Excerpt: Elagabalus and Hierocles

219 CE (AD)

The following excerpt from the book illustrates the remarkable meeting between the two youths that led to Hierocles’ incredible power.

                            

On a sunny day in August, 219 CE, 15 year-old emperor Elagabalus was enjoying a day at the races. He was an avid fan of chariot racing, and loved to watch the Greens, his favorite team, compete in the Circus Maximus against the Blues, the Reds and the Whites. The races were exciting, and often deadly to the participants. The chariots, made of flimsy, lightweight wood that barely reached the charioteers’ waists, were built for speed, not safety. Powerful stallions were harnessed in pairs or fours and trained to gallop relentlessly around the sanded track. It took immense strength and skill for the charioteer to round the corners without spilling out. Those who fell were often trampled by the oncoming chariots. 

The rival teams, the Blues and Greens, were competing viciously on the track. Rounding the spina, the center of the track, a Green charioteer named Hierocles lost control and crashed his chariot in front of the imperial box. He was thrown into the air and landed directly across from where the emperor was sitting. The astonished emperor rose from his seat. Hierocles had lost his helmet during the fall and Elagabalus saw that he was, “…still-beardless and adorned with a crown of yellow hair …” 1.


The emperor was instantly smitten. On his orders, Hierocles was rushed to the palace. His injuries were probably minor since they are never mentioned and he soon recovered from his fall. Dio Cassius, Elagabalus’ contemporary and most reliable biographer, wrote:

“…and there by his (Hierocles’) nocturnal feats he captivated Sardanapalus more than ever.” 2.

(Dio refers to the emperor as “Sardanapulus," to disparage him. Sardanapulus was a decadent king of Assyria.)                                    

Notes

  1. Cassius Dio LXXX 15:2 
  2. Ibid 15:3

The Cupbearers                              The Cupbearers features some of the most well documented gay relationships in ancient Greece, Rome and the Middle East. This book began as an illustrated project of my paintings, and developed into a collection of stories. Some of the paintings in The Cupbearers started out as an exhibition project called House of the Faun. Though these stories are factual, this is not academic gay history. It’s more creative nonfiction. I’ve found that most books written about gay history are scholarly and can be difficult to follow for the nonacademic reader. For that reason, I wanted to keep these adventures short and enjoyable.

For LGBT people, much of their history is hidden, manipulated or ignored. It’s important for this information to become mainstream. Many people, gay and straight, are unaware of the rich and varied heritage of the LGBT people, the numerous contributions they have made, and the crucial roles they have played in history. People struggling for equality draw strength from their shared culture, traditions and history. If we are to continue to change the future for LGBT people, we must also reclaim the past. Please help me to make my small contribution to re-envisioning LGBT history by supporting this project.Pre-order With Your Contribution Now!

Montgomery Ward Gallery (University of Illinois)  for LGBT Pride Month. Linda holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from Columbia College in Chicago where she double majored in Fine Art and Illustration. My Personal Story 
                    My name is Linda Larson, and I am the author and Illustrator of The Cupbearers.  In my lifetime I've witnessed the progression of modern gay history from Stonewall to Marriage Equality. While I love all kinds of history, my true passion is LGBT history in antiquity.
My interest in lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) history began in my teens, at 15 years old, when I found a book called Child of the Sun tucked in a bag in my dad’s closet. This little book changed my life. It was a paperback novel about a Roman emperor named Elagabalus. This young man was only 14 when he became emperor and was just 18 when he died. The book was pretty racy, but it piqued my curiosity about his life. While I searched in vain for information on him, I was drawn into the lives of other historical figures, and before I knew it, I became a full blown history nerd.                                                                     ElagabalusBack then it was difficult to find documented information about gay men and lesbians. So while concentrating on the mainstream history of the eras which interested me, I picked up some information about various artists and well-known people who were gay. With the advent of the Internet I was able to easily find historical sources about them. I also discovered many surprising and famous figures on gay history websites. Most of the names mentioned were people that I had always felt drawn to as well.
Unfortunately, I find that in mainstream history, the lives of great artists, writers, statesmen and kings are often portrayed inaccurately. Socrates, Alexander the Great, Richard the Lionhearted, Leonardo Da Vinci, and Michelangelo are just a few well-known figures who are often portrayed as heterosexual. Frequently, their homosexuality or bisexuality is ignored, while any whisper of heterosexuality, no matter how faint, is exploited. Even in mainstream media, this trend persists. Those who try to accurately portray the bisexuality of a great figure still face an onslaught of criticism and malice.Take Oliver Stone, for an example. When he attempted to portray Alexander the Great (accurately), as bisexual in his film Alexander, he was bitterly criticized for it. The Greek government refused to let him film his epic in Greece, while a band of Greek lawyers threatened a lawsuit against Warner Brothers if Stone portrayed Alexander as bisexual. There were many critics on the home front as well, and Stone was forced to cut homoerotic love scenes.  A year or so before the release of Alexander, a conference about Alexander in Greece was overrun by protestors and a speaker had to be removed by the local police. The speaker was about to present a paper on Alexander’s sexuality.  The real Alexander fell apart when his boyhood lover Hephaestion died of typhus. His generals had to remove him by force from Hephaestion’s body after a prolonged fit of grief. Alexander demanded Hephaestion be given divine status, and threw him the most expensive funeral in history. Less than a year later, Alexander died. His 20-year relationship with Hephaestion is one of the most well documented in history, but Alexander is still portrayed as implausibly straight in many films and books.Frequently Asked Questions
What is the current status of  The Cupbearers?
The book is within a few weeks of completion. The layout needs to be designed, and six illustrations need to be completed.
What is completed?
Forty plus illustrations have been photographed. The manuscript has been edited and finalized.
How will the money be used?
Layout and design of the book and cover; payment for the proofreaders and photographer; and publication.
What is this book about?
The Cupbearers  is about well-known rulers in antiquity and their male favorites. It covers a period of history from approx. 2500 BCE (BC) to 225 CE (AD) in Greece, Rome and the Bible lands. Soon after this period, in the early 4th century CE, Christianity became the dominant religion in the West and changed forever the sexual dynamics of the ancient world. 
What is a "Cupbearer?"
In antiquity, a cupbearer traditionally represents a trusted servant who serves a king or noble. In Greek mythology, Ganymede became the cupbearer and favorite of Zeus. The role of cupbearer and the name Ganymede became synonymous with the ideal of the young male favorite.
What is The Cupbearers' message?
The book dispels the modern prejudices against same sex love by telling the truth about gay rulers in antiquity. It documents an important segment of history that is frequently ignored, or distorted.
How did  The Cupbearers become illustrated?
The narrative is told through a combination of illustration and text, working in tandem while creating a mood. Like previous projects, The Cupbearers began as an artistic project. I began writing narrative to accompany the paintings. Also, as an illustrator, I’ve always been drawn to picture books. I love to collect books with great illustrations.

story:
Hi there! My name Is Brian Dempsey and I am an aspiring author, Reiki healer, practicing occultist, philosopher, husband, and father of 6. I currently reside near Pittsburgh PA., run heavy equipment and work well over 80 hours a week.  For the last year and a half, I have been working on various writing projects, one of which is the book you see here in my campaign.

Having been raised in a conservative Christian home, I struggled with spiritual and emotional ignorance well into adulthood. The missed opportunity for true love, unanswered questions , misguided decisions, and a hellish relationship of 13 years, which nearly destroyed me,  led me to question everything. In the end I found it all; peace, love, an endless spring of knowledge, personal power, and the revelation something far greater and ancient than I had ever known was at the helm of my life from the very beginning. Our perceptions of this world are twisted by fear and illusion, and for good reason. The greatest conspiracy of ancient tyranny was to conceal the very esoteric truths which would liberate mankind from its own evil. In essence, that truth is the Light in the darkness.                                                                     My goal is to get this one book edited and published so I can get my other projects finished and out into the world.  I am half way through my second book, have an opening chapter and outline for a major suspense novel, and the material for an esoteric grimoire for those who are more occult minded.  It all hinges on this one hurdle. This one book.


What I Need & What You Get

I am asking the entire world for a modest 3500 dollars which is the total cost quoted to me by a professional editor to have the book completely edited  and rewritten in spots if need be, and get it one step from final print. The bill for the last step before print can usually be picked up by the publisher, or I can choose to self publish. Either way, the editing will ensure it is a fantastic book! If by chance there is an overage of funds, those funds will immediately be used to get my next book to print. Once I have a few books printed and in distribution, I can hopefully focus on broader writing projects, speaking, and teaching seminars on spiritual growth. 

    The Impact

    My passion is spirituality, people, and their well being, no matter what path anyone may follow. Darkness and fear are very real things in this world, and I conquered my fear to find peace in what many would call darkness. I had to shift my perceptions of the world around me, and I wish to help those in need do the same as well, emotionally,  mentally, and spiritually.

    Risks & Challenges

    For the amount of money I am seeking I do not see a very large risk. I have a deep confidence in the book and that it will reach a broad audience.  If the campaign is a success,  any abundant overage  will immediately be put right back into the next book project, perks for that project, and perhaps additional secret perks for this one. Which is why I have noted the need for a shipping address on the smaller contributions. :)
      But it is a challenge, just to get your story and first book to print. If the challenges arise, I will meet them head on, regroup, and execute a new plan. Nothing has stopped me thus far, and it would seem I have the energy and blessing of the universe behind me!
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Give what you can and what you are led to. If you cant, but wish to help out, please share my story with others and encourage them to forward the message. Every little bit helps and your small part is essential!

story:
My name is Michael Chandler, and I have been a New York City-based rock & roll musician since the early 1980s. Among the groups that I have formed are The Raunch Hands, The Lost Crusaders, and Chandler & The Chasers. I was also the front man for the 1980s garage band, The Outta Place. I have traveled to thousands of places around the world and have thousands of stories to tell.

I began writing for public consumption while still in high school in Portland, Maine, as a radio news writer/reporter. I have continued to write and to journal ever since, my most recent contributions having been published in Italy's Dante Magazine.

In 2009, I began writing a blog, entitled, "The Rock & Roll Element." It is a collection of short stories (some quite lengthy), memoir, personal essays, and poetry. It by no means contains all of my output, but pieces which I believe will interest my readers. My audience is small, but dedicated, and the blog is followed by people in twenty-three countries on four continents.

For my collection of stories, I have selected thirteen, which I feel are the most entertaining, compelling, and thought-provoking from my blog, as well as from my personal collection of stories and essays, which I have withheld, for just such a publication as, "The Story Tree."

As a teaser, here is a link to where you can read two of the pieces which appear in "The Story Tree." (I'm not divulging the rest of them, but if you want to try to guess which ones by going to my blog, please remember that as they appear there, they are in raw, unedited form and may have typos, grammatical slips, etc.)

http://thestorytreecollection.blogspot.com/

Financing

As any literary project must have financing, mine has expenses and requires the work of professionals who must be compensated for their time and effort. Among them:
  • At least one copy editor - I have a person who has agreed to do the bulk of the work for what I consider to be a very reasonable rate. She is a writing instructor at a college here in Santa Fe, holds a Master's Degree in Fine Arts, and she has offered me invaluable input and criticism on much of my recent work. Once the first draft is completed, I will send copies to various literary friends and acquaintances for further review and refinement.
  • A designer/layout consultant - The book cover and print layout are obviously extremely important to the book's potential acceptance into the literary community - it is the face on the body. Again, I have a Santa Fean who has been helping me along, and whom I intend to pay for his services. I am very impressed with his portfolio, which spans the past thirty years, and his suggestions so far have been eye-openers.
  • A printer - At this juncture, I have not decided whether to work through an online publisher, or to hire a local printer. I intend to balance the cost per copy with the quality of the finished product. Start-up funds are necessary to bring my collaborators and me to that decision - first things first.
Promotion - All artistic projects need a promotional budget. Future sales rely heavily upon websites, publications, reviewers, and small-press advocates whose  subsequent attention and glowing reviews will increase sales. I expect to have to comp and ship between 100 - 200 copies of the book. That costs money.

An LLC - I have future projects in mind, so I would like to make my small endeavor into something larger and self-sustainable. I will have to pay to register the publishing company. I have a name for the company, but since it is not registered, I can't tell you just now.

Your Perks

  • For a contribution of $25 or more, I will include, at the end of the book, a list of all contributors, no matter how many there are. After all, your financial support makes this book yours as well as mine, and I want all of our readers to see what advocates of the arts can achieve. You may also choose to make your contribution in someone else's name, having that person's name appear in the acknowledgments instead. If you choose to use a pseudonym, please keep it within the bounds of good taste.
  • For a $100 donation, I will ship you a signed copy of "The Story Tree." (For those of you whom I know personally, I will try to include an individual message.) You also get the above acknowledgment.
  • Contributors of $200 or more will receive both the acknowledgment and s signed copy of the book, as well as a signed preview edition of the forthcoming Lost Crusaders CD, "Near-Life Experience." It is a full-length LP of new and unreleased songs, with some updated versions of your favorites from or first LP, "Have You Heard About the World?" It is being mastered and the artwork prepared, as you are reading this, and I can assure you that it is a terrific album.
  • $2000 and up - I will come read at your literary event (plus all of the above).
  • $5000 - I have not figured out to whom I'd like to dedicate "The Story Tree." For $5000, it's you or whomever you choose (plus all of the above, excluding the reading).

story:
Short Summary

My name is Elva Narcia, I have recently founded a media for social change NGO called Glifos Comunicaciones A.C. I am a professional journalist with 15 years experience working for the BBC World Service in London and 4 years for a media development NGO called Internews. I have recently returned to Mexico after 20 years living overseas, I am originally from the southern state of Chiapas. One of the first projects of my recently founded NGO will be a book on the challenges that women from Chiapas face when they chose a political career.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are so excited about this project that we have already started doing part of the field work: Research, selection of women, some of the interviews. To move the project forward we need to hire a photographer, a graphic designer, a proof reader, a publisher, a transcriber, We also need to raise funds for printing and distribution. We are planning a multimedia exhibition with portraits, texts of the interviews and interactive maps showing the places where women have advanced in the political arena.  To do all that we need to raise 20,000 British pounds, To cover all the costs we are also trying to pre-sale, so, with your kind contribution we will send you a book . Please leave an email address to contact you so we can send you the book when it is ready.

The Impact

This book will document the struggles of women from Chiapas and their lessons learned, it will document the advancement of women in power through generations in one of the poorest states of Mexico and it will be an opportunity for the younger generation of women to learn from other women's experiences.    

Other Ways You Can Help

If you  can't make a contribution you can still help by getting the word out and make some noise about our project. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

We are planning a multimedia exhibition with portraits, texts of the interviews and interactive maps showing the places where women have advanced in the political arena.  To do all that we need to raise 20,000 British pounds, To cover all the costs we are also trying to pre-sale, so, with your kind contribution we will send you a book . Please leave an email address to contact you so we can send you the book when it is ready.The ImpactThis book will document the struggles of women from Chiapas and their lessons learned, it will document the advancement of women in power through generations in one of the poorest states of Mexico and it will be an opportunity for the younger generation of women to learn from other women's experiences.    Other Ways You Can HelpIf you  can't make a contribution you can still help by getting the word out and make some noise about our project. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Under the covers:

Night Heat Publishing is a new, independent publisher of all things erotic. We specialize in short stories, novellas, and novels. Our manuscripts are professionally edited, formatted, and converted into the primary e-reader file formats (PDF, ePub, MOBI). Our covers are both tasteful and suggestive, while our content is distinctly naughty and nice.

In addition to “Vanilla Erotica”, you’ll find subgenres such as paranormal, BDSM, fetish, Gay/Lesbian/Bi-sexual, and fantasy. All characters are over 18, and we do not sell illegal content.

Getting down and dirty – what we need:

Funds. Readers. Support.

We need to raise enough funds to purchase the following items:

1.  Website hosting

2.  Website design

3.  E-commerce

Yes – free websites and hosting are available on the internet, however, they don’t provide the secure functionality we require to provide a safe and enjoyable shopping experience. Websites take time, patience, and skill to create – and we want to provide the very best environment for our readers.

We have the content, but in order to create a salable product, we still need the following:

1.  Software – to format and convert files for a smooth e-reading experience

2.  Stock photography – so that our cover designer can create engaging, unique book covers to enhance your reading experience.

3.  Marketing – so that we can create a presence, make more money, and continue to provide our readers with the best in erotic fiction.

One last thing – we also need to retain the services of a lawyer. Sexually explicit content always runs the risk of causing legal chaos. While our titles, covers, and content will fall within the limits of Canadian law, we need to verify that we aren’t impinging on any obscenity laws, and that costs money too.

You show us yours and we’ll show you ours:

In March, we’ll open our virtual doors to the public... providing tasteful, erotic literature – complete with sensual cover designs, file format selections, secure e-commerce, and a comfortable environment for browsing our Night Heat titles.

The touchy-feeling stuff:

Sensuality and eroticism are important aspects of being human. We want to provide adults with well-written, beautifully formatted, sensually designed erotic literature to enhance their sexual experiences, and allow them to taste the freedom and enjoyment that comes with sexual liberation.

Beyond that – we love books – and we want to encourage writers and readers everywhere to engage in their passions. By providing solid editing, formatting, and cover design, we want to change the way the world views erotic fiction because it truly is a thing of beauty.

No money? No problem – we’re happy to work in trade...:

Aside from the obvious monetary donations – you can help by sharing this campaign through your social networks. You can also like us on Facebook, follow us on twitter, join our Google+ network, and check out our website. If you know authors who are looking for a way to share their work with the world, who need a little support, editing, and all that jazz – send them our way – our door is always open.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea Raine (my author name is Andrea McKenzie Raine) and I recently self-published my first novel titled Turnstiles. I have been working on my novel for many years. In 2000, I earned a B.A. in English Lit from the University of Victoria, where I also studied Creative Writing. I have been attending a long-running successful reading series in Victoria, BC called Planet Earth Poetry since 1997, and have studied with poet & novelist Patrick Lane at several writing retreats in Sooke, BC. I published my first book of poems titled A Mother's String in 2005.

After self-publishing my debut novel, which was a considerable expense, I am now embarking on a book tour and, so far, I have confirmed reading/book signing dates at book stores in the following cities: Burnaby, Parksville, Calgary, Bellingham and Kelowna. I also plan to promote my book in Edmonton, Prince George, Portland, and perhaps Toronto. My book tour dates will be happening from mid-February to mid-July 2014.

Ultimately I hope my novel will be the first step in becoming a full time writer. Therefore, I would like to present Turnstiles to as large an audience as possible, beginning with this book tour. My funding goal will help to cover travel and accommodation costs for the tour. Extra money, if any, will go towards recovering the expenses I have paid to make the dream of publishing my first novel come true. I also hope that my campaign will help to encourage other writers to explore the opportunities and benefits of self-publishing their work.

What We Need & What You Get

My novel is already receiving great reviews, and I believe it is on the way to a great success. If you help me to further promote my novel to a larger audience, you will receive the following incentives:

- For $5 you will be featured in a list of contributors on my web page at http://andreamckenzieraine.com/.

- For $10 you will get an autographed 5x7 photo of the author.

-For $15 you will get a postcard of the book cover written from somewhere on my book tour.

-For $25 you will get a Turnstiles eBook and bookmark.

- For $40 you will get a signed 11x17 poster of the book cover.

- For $50 you will get a signed copy of Turnstiles.

- For $75 you will get a framed poem written about a personal subject in your life.

-For $80 you will get a signed copy of my novel Turnstiles and a signed copy of my poetry book A Mother's String.

- For $100 you will be able to have lunch with the author (the restaurant of choice must be a location close to or in Greater Victoria, BC).

- For $150 you will get a signed copy of Turnstiles, a personalized and framed poem, bookmark, postcard from my book tour, and you will be featured in a list of contributors on my web page.

Every cent I earn will be invested in promoting my novel.

For more information about my novel, please visit http://andreamckenzieraine.com/


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my funding goal, but would still like to help, please spread the word about my book tour campaign for Turnstiles.

To do this, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I'd like to first say thank you for visiting my campaign. As this is my first Indiegogo campaign, I would welcome any feedback from visitors, even if this isn't your thing. You can reach me at the contact page of my blog: www.danielhowardwriting.com/contact. 

Short Summary

I'm a writer and editor with a passion for what is academically known as "speculative fiction." For those less nerdy than me, that's an umbrella term for science fiction, fantasy, and horror. While I do write the genre, I also wanted to contribute to the body of work in other ways. I decided to put together this anthology, and I wanted it to focus on largely undiscovered authors. This anthology is about getting people out there, people who might not otherwise have a voice. Many authors are publishing for the first time in these pages, while others are old hands with a passion for wordsmithing and a story that fit.

This is the second anthology it what I hope to be a long-standing series. Each volume contains 9 stories, no more and no less. The reason is simple: that's the magic number for many of the publishing options available to me. I can give full credit to 10 contributors (including myself). I can maximize exposure. I can get the word out. 

But I can't do it alone...

What We Need & What You Get

This anthology is a labor of love, but it runs on a shoestring. That's enough cliches for now, I think. In essence, this anthology is going to happen one way or another. The rights to the stories are bought. The contributions have gone through a round of edits. The formatting is under way.

The problem is that I'm an editor, not a marketer. Not a public relations specialist. I'm not a book blogger or social media manager. I do my thing, and I need the resources to hire other people to do their things. The first anthology didn't sell very well, I'm afraid. Everyone that I gave the book to really loved the stories, so that's not the issue. There's clearly something lacking in the marketing.

Here's what I'll be putting the money towards:

  • Hiring someone to write and distribute a press release.
  • A social media campaign to raise awareness of the book (and the series).
  • And any money left over will go to advertising the Facebook page and developing the next book in the series.
As for perks, you will of course get a copy of the book. The level of your donation will determine in what form you get a copy (PDF, paperback, maybe even a limited edition hardcover). Larger donations will earn you a spot in the acknowledgements for helping make the project happen. You will also get the never-ending gratitude of everyone involved in the book. Do with it as you will. 

The Impact

By supporting this project, you will be giving some passionate and talented writers a shot. Contributing towards the success of the book also gives everyone involved exposure. You never know... Your donation could launch the career of the next superstar bestselling author.

    Risks & Challenges

    Since the project is going ahead regardless, there is no risk to those who donate. Everyone will get their copy. The challenges are all on my end. 

    I need to learn how to navigate the various promotion channels, social media, and blogosphere to get the word out on this series. Based on the sales of the first volume, I still have a lot to learn. By having a little money to throw at the problem, all the better.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Even if you don't donate, there are ways you can help. It would be deeply appreciated.

      • Check out Voices of Imagination on Amazon.com. The Kindle version only $0.99.
      • Whether you donate or not, nothing boosts book sales better than a good review. Of course, you should read a copy first. Of any Voices of Imagination book.
      • Submit a story. Really. If you write science fiction, fantasy, or horror, then I'd love to hear from you. Go to my blog (see link at the top) and get in touch with me. I'll get back to you and check out your story. If it's a fit, you may be in Volume 3!

story:
Short Summary

Katherine A Nevitt is a 19 year old girl from Alvaston in Derby. She has spent the last 7 years volunteering for the RSPCA and raising money for various charities. 

2012 was a bad year for Katherine. Her parents began to divorce, her grandfather died, her cousin was diagnosed with cancer and died a few days later and her mother was diagnosed with a brain tumor. Due to all these circumstances she finally decided it was time to do something for herself. She had been writing ever since she first learned to hold a pen and she decided it was time to follow her dream of becoming an author. 

Katherine's campaign is important to her because it is not just her job, it is her dream and her life. Her every waking breath is spent thinking up new ideas for her books and the ways she can help the world be a better place.

Any money raised in her campaign will go toward making and distributing the books she has written. 20% of all royalties from her books will go to charities like the RSPCA.

What We Need & What You Get

Katherine needs the money to publish her books so that she can raise money toward charities and continue doing the work that keeps her heart beating.

The Impact

This campaign will not only help Katherine to continue her dream of writing and publishing. It will go toward raising money for the charities she has worked closely with for the last 7 years. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, don't worry. Get the word out about this campaign and help find people who can.

story:
The Story of The Unbecoming

The Unbecoming is a collection of stories, thoughts, and inspirations about the miraculous journey of healing the mind and body and discovering our true selves. My name is Lauren Giammarco and I am the author of The Unbecoming. I wrote this book because I wanted to share my healing journey of full recovery from multiple chronic illnesses as a way to inspire and instill hope in those who are looking to heal themselves.

My hope is that in reading this book, you will discover the natural healing force within you: the greatest force in getting well. I hope to instill passion and excitement for reconnecting to our authentic selves through dismantling the thoughts and beliefs that prevent living authentically and feeling safe and supported. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help gain clarity on the mind-body connection, and the power that already lies within to heal ourselves.

In this book, you'll learn about uncovering the messages hidden beneath our fear-based patterns that can keep us stuck from moving forward. You will learn about the power of intentional living. You'll hear stories such as...

How I overcame one of my greatest fears at 33,000 feet in the air through a chance encounter sitting next to a stranger.

How unresolved emotional abuse and trauma created perpetuating chronic symptoms and pain, and how I used the power of self-forgiveness to heal.

How a dome sitting in the middle of the Mojave Desert taught me the incredible life-changing power of a still mind.

You will love this book if you are on a healing journey and looking for inspiration on removing limiting beliefs, reconnecting to self through daily wellness practices, and understanding how to self-heal.

The Unbecoming is a nonfiction book that speaks to those who are moving through chronic illness, going through their own self-awakening, or spiritual seekers who want a more intimate look into the mind and body connection.
 

The Book - The Unbecoming

The book is written in three parts:

Part 1: Hidden Messages contains the Introduction and chapters 1-4. It uncovers four key themes - the mind body connection, curiosity, self-love, and fear. Within these chapters, I recount moments when I began to understand how emotional intelligence can truly change lives.

Part 2: Healing contains chapters 5-9. These chapters explore the four key elements that shifted my body into a healing state. These elements include the importance of rest and the fascinating science behind why we sleep, and how I changed my relationship with food, uncovered my values, and learned the power of forgiveness.

Part 3: The Awakening contains chapters 10-13. These chapters are the foundation for how I began to live in a way that supported the body and mind. I write transparently about learning to let go of past identities that no longer serve, how nature and mediation are proven healers, and lastly, how the importance of thriving, safe relationships help to sustain health and live authentically.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter of 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
 

About the Author

Lauren Giammarco resides in Rhode Island, where she has lived throughout her life. She has a love for nature and traveling, and is an avid hiker. She believes that nature is the cure for anything. Writing is her first love. A contributing writer for Elephant Journal and a self-published author, she has been capturing words to the page since she was a child through journaling and short stories. Aside from her career in sales, she also owns a small business, Mindful Spaces, which helps others create calm and simplicity within their homes through organization and interior décor. Her favorite title is “auntie,” which she is called by her two beautiful nieces.

Her passion for holistic healing and the importance of wellness and self-care is the driving force behind her writing this book. She hopes to inspire others, and help them on their journey of healing through her words and experience.

For more information, you can connect with Lauren at laugia78@yahoo.com and on social media Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help


Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:
At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!
Please use #theunbecoming and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram - @heartbased_healing/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - HeartBasedHealing/ @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lauren Giammarco

You'll hear stories such as...How I overcame one of my greatest fears at 33,000 feet in the air through a chance encounter sitting next to a stranger.How unresolved emotional abuse and trauma created perpetuating chronic symptoms and pain, and how I used the power of self-forgiveness to heal.How a dome sitting in the middle of the Mojave Desert taught me the incredible life-changing power of a still mind.You will love this book if you are on a healing journey and looking for inspiration on removing limiting beliefs, reconnecting to self through daily wellness practices, and understanding how to self-heal.The Unbecoming is a nonfiction book that speaks to those who are moving through chronic illness, going through their own self-awakening, or spiritual seekers who want a more intimate look into the mind and body connection. The Book - The UnbecomingThe book is written in three parts:Part 1: Hidden Messages contains the Introduction and chapters 1-4. It uncovers four key themes - the mind body connection, curiosity, self-love, and fear. Within these chapters, I recount moments when I began to understand how emotional intelligence can truly change lives.Part 2: Healing contains chapters 5-9. These chapters explore the four key elements that shifted my body into a healing state. These elements include the importance of rest and the fascinating science behind why we sleep, and how I changed my relationship with food, uncovered my values, and learned the power of forgiveness.Part 3: The Awakening contains chapters 10-13. These chapters are the foundation for how I began to live in a way that supported the body and mind. I write transparently about learning to let go of past identities that no longer serve, how nature and mediation are proven healers, and lastly, how the importance of thriving, safe relationships help to sustain health and live authentically.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2021.The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter of 2021.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.And much more!Campaign GoalsTier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover editionTier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition. About the AuthorLauren Giammarco resides in Rhode Island, where she has lived throughout her life. She has a love for nature and traveling, and is an avid hiker. She believes that nature is the cure for anything. Writing is her first love. A contributing writer for Elephant Journal and a self-published author, she has been capturing words to the page since she was a child through journaling and short stories. Aside from her career in sales, she also owns a small business, Mindful Spaces, which helps others create calm and simplicity within their homes through organization and interior décor. Her favorite title is “auntie,” which she is called by her two beautiful nieces.Her passion for holistic healing and the importance of wellness and self-care is the driving force behind her writing this book. She hopes to inspire others, and help them on their journey of healing through her words and experience.For more information, you can connect with Lauren at laugia78@yahoo.com and on social media Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.International PreordersFor international preorders, please do the following:Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacksSelect the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/VenmoRisks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpNot everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!Please use #theunbecoming and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!Tag:Instagram - @heartbased_healing/ @newdegreepressFacebook - HeartBasedHealing/ @NewDegreePressThank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Lauren Giammarco

Project Summary: 

Let's cut to the chase. In Canada, most writers survive by foraging for roots and berries.

And so, Jeremy Kroeker is raising money to record an audiobook version of his nationally best-selling book, "Motorcycle Therapy - A Canadian Adventure in Central America." (Although it will not likely be a major revenue stream, all sources of income are necessary for independent writers if they hope to sleep indoors year-round.)   

The goal is to have the audiobook ready for the Fall of 2013, when Kroeker's new book, "Through Dust and Darkness," will be released (through publisher, Rocky Mountain Books).

Now, who is this guy?

Jeremy Kroeker is a freelance writer and speaker. With his motorcycle, he has traveled to over 30 countries while managing to do at least one outrageously stupid thing in every one. He has evaded police in Egypt, tasted teargas in Israel, scrambled through minefields in Bosnia and Lebanon, and wrangled a venomous snake in Austria. One time he got a sliver in El Salvador.

Since 1999, Kroeker has made his home in Canmore, Alberta. His writing has appeared in newspapers such as the Toronto Star, Winnipeg Free Press, Calgary Herald, and in magazines such as Alpinist, Westworld, Motorcycle Mojo Magazine, and Outrider Journal.

Let's make this happen:

To create an audiobook, Kroeker needs at least $3,000.

Most of this money will go to studio time and working with a professional audiobook producer. Another $1,000 or so will go into making C.D.'s (an outdated medium, we know, but necessary to have for promotion at motorcycle shows and rallies).

If fundraising goals are not met, the project will proceed anyway. It'll just hurt more.

If fundraising goals are exceeded, the money will be reinvested in the following ways:

1. Another print run of "Motorcycle Therapy." ($3,000, est.)

2. Website maintenance (what are all those blue quesion marks on MotorcycleTherapy.com?)

3. Falsetto audiobook. This is real. Although Kroeker may regret this pledge, if he should raise $9,000 through this campain, he will record a limited edition falsetto audiobook of "Motorcycle Therapy." He is confident (actually, he's quite smug about it) that this will not happen. If you want to humilliate this man, give generously.  

What do I get?

There are incentive packages! Small contributions receive copies of Motorcycle Therapy (eBooks, audiobooks, print books), while larger donations get cars. Well, one car, really. For a single contribution of $3,000, one lucky person can drive away in a rust-riddled 1996 Honda Civic Hatchback.

Of course, there are packages in between these two extremes. There are private slide shows and book events. You can even have your name read out in the acknowledgements for the audiobook version of Motorcycle Therapy.

But I'm broke, too...

No problem. Even if you can't make the smallest donation, you can still help. Kroeker needs this message to spread. Share the link and the video on Facebook or Twitter, etc.

Help an Indie out.

Thanks!

story:
BOOKS OR GADGETS? In today's world, it's hard for books to compete with electronics. But we as parents want our children to enjoy the experience of reading. 
   We are upsetting our children by taking their gadgets from them because we don't know a solution to the problem. 
   But the compromise exists! Here we are - a new generation of books with virtual reality (3D).

"Duke&Musk: Virus in the city" a great example of putting together education and entertainment, skills and fun, books and electronics. 
   We need your support to make this happen so that we can continue to devote our efforts to your child's love of books. You can support us by pre-ordering the book or by donating to our project. Any amount will be most appreciated as this project depends on the support of people who care about the future of books.

story:
What is Inaccurate Realities?

Inaccurate Realities is a brand new literary magazine for young adults and the young at heart. There is no denying that people of all ages are now reading YA, but when we looked around we noticed a significant lack of publications focusing on YA short fiction – especially genre fiction. Our emphasis here are Inaccurate Realities is on speculative fiction, in all its forms. Science fiction, fantasy, paranormal, horror, dystopian, steampunk, cyberpunk, alternate history and everything in between. We are a quarterly magazine and are looking for fresh and exciting Young Adult short fiction from writers of all ages.

 

Who We Are

One day after hours of searching for publications that published YA short fiction Christa decided to create her own. Thankfully Sara and Andrea volunteered to help. By day the we work in different areas of the Canadian publishing industry and in our spare time we all blog about books and spend way too much time on Twitter.

 

Where does your donation go?

Donations from this campaign will be split into three parts

1) Payment for the writers and artists who contribute to Inaccurate Realities

2) First run printing costs

3) A Launch Party in Toronto

 

We are accepting donations at all levels. Every little bit helps!

Here are some of the perks you can get for helping out!

 

$1 - Thank you!

$5 - (and all subsequent levels) - Get thanked as a donor in the first issue of the magazine

$8 - Digital Copy of Issue #1

$20 - Digital Copies of Issues #1-3

$30 - Print (and digital) copy of Issue #1

$50 Advertise with us (125x125) up to and including the run of the first issue* (6 available)

$75 - Print (and digital) copies of Issues#1-3

$100 - Advertise with us (250x250) up to and including the run of the first issue* (3 available)

 

*Please note advertisements must be suitable to the magazine’s theme and audience. Bloggers, bookstores, authors etc welcome.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out! Tweet, Facebook, Tumbl. Make a video about it. Tell all the aspiring writers you know. Yell it from the rooftops! It’s a speculative fiction magazine - get creative!

 

And Don’t forget to use IndieGoGos sharing buttons below!

 

“The thing about reality is that it is frequently inaccurate”

— Douglas Adams
